campaign.story:
***IMPORTANT: If you've just arrived here and the project looks sold out/finished, you can still get the "no brainer" package (the digital book and video course & loads of bonuses including 3 webinars and entrance to the secret Facebook group, our most popular package) via Gumroad right now, so no sweat!
>>>>> CLICK HERE TO GET IT NOW! <<<<<
--
Tired of bullsh*t marketing and growth hacking books that don't give you any f***ing idea what you have to do to get users/traffic/revenue?
We are too, so we made this step-by-step guide anyone can use to start growth hacking immediately, using proven strategies we've used ourselves.
Me speaking at Google Campus, London, April 2016
I’m an entrepreneur and one of the creators of the e-book and video course: “Secret Sauce: A step-by-step guide to growth hacking”, along with growth hacker and my co-author, Austen Allred.
 The truth is that marketing is pretty easy once someone tells you what you should be doing. The only problem is that no-one wants do that.
There’s too much money in consulting and selling books about the veneer without ever giving up the actual secret sauce.
“This book and video course won’t be like that. In fact, they’ll be very different from that, and probably nothing like what you’re used to. Here’s why: Secret Sauce is not so much a book as it is a tutorial.
Secret Sauce is a step-by-step, systematic dismantling and dissection of every channel and practice that actually works, laid out one after another. It’s a guide that will handhold you all the way to getting traffic, users, and revenue.
Our goal with this book and course is that someone who knows absolutely nothing about marketing could sit down, follow the instructions, and make what they’re doing blow up. We’ve done this before - a lot.
Our combined efforts account for millions of monthly pageviews, millions of social followers, millions of emails, millions of dollars in revenue -- no matter how you slice it, this stuff just works. We’ve tried hundreds of growth hacks in order to give you only the methods we know will work.
Most everything you’ll read is something anyone can do with a little bit of effort, and which requires very little (or zero) marketing budget.
By the time you finish this book, you will not only have a dozen ideas about different strategies that can help your idea succeed, but you’ll know exactly what it takes to implement each one of them.
After you read this book you will be able to sell units of and get users signed up for literally anything.
What you’ll find in the growth hacking playbook works.
I was on welfare/benefits 3 years ago, and used growth hacking techniques to get millions of visitors to websites I created and raise hundreds of thousands of dollars in investment, and got into the Techstars accelerator. I then launched a growth hacking agency and have used these techniques to move hundreds of thousands of people to websites, and acquire tonnes of users and followers for startups.
Speaking in London, England, Winter 2015
A key change in my life happened a year ago. An accelerator had heard I was a “growth hacker” and asked me to give a talk to their current teams. I put together a slide deck of what I considered the basics, and gave a presentation. Halfway through my talk I realised half of the room was taking pages of notes, while the others stared at me in disbelief. The minute my talk finished, founders ran up to me asking for my slides and if I did consulting. I was surprised- I hadn’t seen many people in marketing give talks and presumed you were meant to give practical advice and show people how to do things, pieces of software you can use to automate things, etc. this was not the case. I gave more talks and it’s an incredible feeling how much people find my talks useful. That’s where the idea for this book came from. Give as many people practical, actionable advice and strategies as possible. My growth hacking talk was eventually voted best workshop of SXSW V2V 2015. Earlier this year I gave a 30-date speaking tour of America, and am so excited to get this knowledge out there in full for the first time.
This is the first time I’m pulling back the curtain and unveiling my secrets, along with my co-author Austen Allred, who has moved millions of visitors and dollars through growth hacking across every channel from SEO to Pinterest and everything inbetween.
What you’ll discover in Secret Sauce can be used for good or evil. It is very powerful stuff. Right now, only a few people know how to do these things. We’re blowing the whistle on the tactics other people are using, and handing you the tools to do them yourself, and find your secret sauce.
And with that substantial word of warning, we launch our kickstarter. If this book gets funded, it will be available very soon after the Kickstarter ends (like, by the end of June or mid-July at the very latest). We’re not sure what the blowback is going to be as no-one has done a book like this before. If you’ve ever read a marketing book and found it didn’t contain enough specific strategies to try, the growth hacking playbook is for you. If you work in marketing and want to use new techniques to boost your companies brand and get promoted, this book is for you. And if you run your own company, you are going to adore this book.
Secret Sauce will give you the tools you need to execute growth hacking strategies in a wide range of environments—but I have another goal in sharing it with you. 
As many have pointed out to me, I could keep this information to myself and make more money from clients- but I truly believe we’re all better off if we share the knowledge and grow our companies together. As such, everyone who donates anything will be invited into a private growth hacking group on Facebook, where we’ll create an ongoing community to help each other with our digital marketing and startup growth problems. I wish there had been a group like this when I was on welfare and starting out on my company three years ago, rather than having to learn it all by trial and error. There’ll be no links or spam in the group, just questions, answers, and discussions from and to the community around this area which has so little useful information. This will make sure that the learning will continue after the campaign ends.
Those of you who have followed me for a while know that when give a talk, I love to go big—ridiculously big—in offering as much value as possible.
We’ve created several different backer reward levels with lots of rewards for each bracket.
Tier 1 “GROWTH HACKER” will receive:
A digital copy of the seven-part growth hacking book.
- Entrance to the secret growth hackers’ club on Facebook
- Thank you page in the book. Exclusive content and backer updates
THE "NO BRAINER" PACKAGE
The best package we're doing. Get this package for an insane amount of bonuses and content:
- A digital copy of the seven-part growth hacking book 
- Entrance to the secret growth hackers’ club on Facebook 
- A voucher for the 20+ hour Udemy course walking you through the book, including screencasts so you can follow step-by-step how to perform many of the strategies we talk about in the book. The video course will be sold on Udemy, 3 courses for a total value of $150
- 1x ticket to a free webinar (including Q & A) with Vincent Dignan “Growth hack your content marketing strategy” value $99 
- 1x free webinar (including Q & A) with Vincent Dignan “How to get rich and internet famous (Hacking sales and personal branding)” value $99 
- 1x ticket to a free webinar (including Q & A) with Vincent Dignan “Growth Hacking live: Boost your startup in real-time” (updated version of the talk which was voted best at SXSW V2V 2015) - value $99 
- Entrance to private Q & A with authors Austen Allred and Vincent Dignan 
- Thank you page in the book 
- A special “What we learned from our Kickstarter campaign” Google Hangout (or some similar platform) with both authors, Vincent Dignan and Austen Allred - A Kickstarter exclusive “Kickstarter: Behind the Scenes/What we learned” mini eBook.
Tier 3 “Masters” (very limited numbers) will receive the below:
EVERYTHING in the“Serious about growth” package plus: 
- 1 or 4 Growth hacking brainstorm/sessions from Vincent Dignan via Skype, pending the package chosen 
- An audit of your website/app, social channels and SEO by Vincent Dignan Social media shoutouts to over 100,000 people on Twitter EVERYTHING in the“Serious about growth” package.
Tier 5 (very, very limited numbers) will receive:
FULL DAY WITH VINCENT DIGNAN (UK/Europe ONLY) Package:
This is UBER limited. Only 5 will ever exist.
Spend a FULL day with Vincent Dignan (10am to 6pm) SOLO, meaning no one else, just you and Vincent Dignan in your offices with your team. Build a growth engine, discuss community management techniques, create a full content marketing strategy, learn how to completely automate your social media processes, anything!

campaign.story:
What is Pillarhub?
Pillarhub offers a unique and innovative approach to mobile computing - two portable 15 inch HD screens allow you to instantly increase your screen real estate, improving productivity and visibility. It is quick and easy to set up, connecting to your computer via a single USB 3 or USB C cable.
Pillarhub does not require a separate power source. It draws power from your laptop via the same USB cable use to connect the screens, allowing you the freedom to use it anywhere and anytime. The slim, padded carry case makes transporting Pillarhub easy and safe while the simple, sleek design means you can use it with any style of computer and it can fit right alongside your laptop in your carry bag.
Introducing Pillarhub
Pillarhub comes with USB 3 and USB C compatibility
Our Story
The Pillarhub team got together over the common frustration of find a truly portable monitor that was slim enough to not add too much extra bulk over the laptop. We were all fed up with fiddling with software or working with half hearted solutions. There was no one product or solution that we could take with us while traveling. After the frustrations cleared, we got our heads together and came up with the following checklist that would make the perfect solution for us:
It needs to be light and portable
It needed a good screen
It needed to run with no power cables (or ability to charge)
It needed to fit into my laptop bag
With that in mind we got to work and went through a few iterations before settling on a 2 screen system. There was always a fear that the second screen would add too much bulk and would make the product non-viable. We worked with our manufactures to chip away at the weight and slim down the panel until we are now confident that the added bulk is no longer a compromise.
We’ve since worked with a dozen manufactures to ensure the high quality of our panels and spend countless hours on the 3D printer prototyping parts to finalize Pillarhub. We believe that the powerless setup was a big leap and we are proud to share the Pillarhub product with the world. Help us spread the word so we can showcase our product to the world. Thank you for supporting us!
Working on our Prototype
Engineering team working on an early prototpye
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After countless hours of design, engineering, and working with a dozen manufactures, we are ready to start production. We do not anticipate any major hurdles or obstacles and should be able to ship Pillarhub by Late 2016 to Early 2017.

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Thanks so much for all your continued support.
Just wanted to address some comments that have mentioned that we are using rebranded screens. For those of you who are familiar with large-scale electronic manufacturing(molds, wiring, inputs, etc); there are often overlaps from facilities which produce for multiple brands (e.g. Ho Hai Precision industry (trading as FoxConn) manufacturing for Apple at facilities that are not wholly owned by Apple; thus Ho Hai makes devices for multiple Chinese brands beyond Apple and often phones are using similar if not identical technologies.) This is similar to our case, as we do not have the resources to setup a screen manufacturing facility in China, so contacted many facilities in an effort to find a solution that met our needs; often which have overlap such as using similar tapered design, brightness controls, etc. that will work with our custom 3D stands.)

WOW!!! We are beyond overwhelmed with excitement and very appreciative of our supporters who quadrupled our funding goal this morning. We couldn't have imagined exceeding our goal this quickly and want to thank each one of our early supporters, you guys are awesome!
We will be in touch with more updates & information very soon. Have a great start to your week everyone!

We want to wish all of our early supporters a safe, relaxing and fun Memorial Day Weekend! We cannot express how excited we are about the outpouring of support and pledges. We could not have imagined exceeding our goal and then some so fast. 
We THANK YOU and are still working on getting more answers out to your questions. We appreciate your patience and hope everyone enjoys the weekend.
- Pillar Hub Team

campaign.story:
Trequant is a wearable for tremor patients. It records their tremors and provides detailed insights about how their activities and diet affect their tremors. 
Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Website | Press Kit | support@trequant.com
Share us on Facebook & Twitter
Trequant helps you to be more confident and aware of your situation, by letting you know how your tremors work. 
 Tremors are completely unpredictable, even the slightest change in your mood can cause huge changes in your tremor intensities and you have no control over it. With Trequant you can observe and identify what activities affect your tremors positively or the diet that helps you to reduce your tremors. You can also connect with a community of tremor patients and share your problems, or solutions with the community. You are able to share your tremor intensities and collaborate in friendly challenges that motivate you to perform daily exercises that are beneficial to you as a tremor patient.
The graphs visualize how with changed activity i.e increased morning walk and a nap during the work stress John was able to reduce the intensity of his tremors. He has a better understanding of how his activities affect his tremors, now he can choose what helps him. This will help him control his tremors better and be more confident.
 Trequant is collaborating with thehopenet.org to get the donations into the hands of rightful patients so they can benefit from it the most and help align their activities to handle their tremors better.
Tremors are unintentional shaking or trembling of muscles. It is the most common neurological movement disorder and hands are the most commonly affected parts. Other parts of the body include head, vocal cords, trunk, and legs. It isn't a life threatening disease but makes life difficult, even the simplest daily tasks become really hard
 Its as simple as it gets, once the watch is paired with the companion application, you're a tap away from recording your tremors.
Trequant allows tremor patients to easily record the values of their tremor intensities accurately without even thinking about it. It allows you to go about your daily routine doing the tasks you do and records your tremors silently. All you have to do is wear it on your wrist and start recording, and it gathers your tremor intensity based on kinetic vibrations of your tremors. It uses 6 sensors to monitor the movement of your arm. Our proprietary algorithm records the accurate value of the tremor intensity by filtering out normal hand movements. Not just that, the device comes equipped with vibration motor to remind you of your medications.
Trequant companion application (which can be used both on a mobile or a computer) is an extension of the wearable. The application allows you to record your tremors, or set up medication reminders, and the type of recording you want to do. The application creates detailed insights of your tremors and lets you see for yourself what activities or diets affect your tremors positively. It can let you know if your tremors have been intense throughout the day or not.
The design of the wearable has been carefully chosen after numerous iterations along with your feedback. Minimal and strong to make you feel in control, and it saves you from all the weird looks.   
 The mobile application is built keeping you in mind, simple, extremely easy to navigate and great readable design for non-technical people. The application is completely self explanatory, and completely friendly.
Trequant houses 6-axis accelerometer and gyroscopes, which allows the wearable to accurately determine the vibrations in the body caused by tremors. Isolating the tremor vibration, Trequant determines the detailed amplitude and frequency values which helps define the tremor in numbers to be understood in a more rational way. 
Trequant has been in the works for 2 years now. Let us give you an insight into the different stages:
 We have been working for two years, and in two years we have developed 4 different prototypes of our product. We now have our final prototype and all we need is your support to finish this product and get this into the hands of people.
Trequant watch was designed to keep it classic so people feel comfortable wearing it in public. Reaching to the final stage required a lot of changes and feedback from product design & manufacturing experts. These are the dimensions of the watch:
The watch is is just about the size of a normal watch with double the intelligence. It is suited for both the genders.
 Trequant makes use of the latest technologies available in the market, including:
6-axis motion sensor to accurately record tremor movements
Vibration motor for medication reminders
Swiss watch movement to show time
Ultra low power processor and bluetooth low energy for long battery life
Extra memory to save data for a month 
Lithium polymer battery to power for 7 days 
Leather straps for comfortable wear
After discussing the manufacturing with various famous names in the manufacturing sector we have choses PanAsia Solutions http://panasia-inc.com as our partner. They have finalized the dates along with the feasibility reports that certify the manufacturing of Trequant in the given time frame and costs. 
PanAsia specializes in the manufacturing and distribution of the hardware products and the company is behind some of the biggest names in the industry. Panasia Solutions provides us on the ground presence in China. They have 15 years of experience in designing, refining, and producing branded consumer products for sale and distribution in markets throughout the United States, Canada, and the EU.
As we anticipated some patients who cant really make use of a watch requested for a bracelet/band that fulfilled the basic purpose. After numerous iterations we present the Trequant Band. We haven't built a prototype for the band yet but based on our previous designs and the technology equipped in the final prototype of the watch we are 110% confident that this would be the final shape, size, battery life and technology of the Band.
This band comes in multiple sizes and you'd be able to put it on different body parts, such as your head, thighs etc. We will be introducing multiple attachments for ease of use on any part of your body as a stretch goal. And if we are able to cross the stretch goal the attachments will be given to all the people who have pledged for the band.
The technology used in the band is same as the watch, but to avoid  any confusion here is the breakdown: 
-6-axis motion sensor to accurately record tremor movements.
-Vibration motor for medication reminders.
-Ultra low power processor and bluetooth low energy for long battery life.
-Extra memory to save data for a month.
-Lithium polymer battery to power for 7 days.
Trequant companion application is a multiple platform application, which means it can be run on your mobile phone, or personal computer both.
We understand not everyone has a smartphone and or is able to use one, especially those who suffer from extreme tremors. Trequant can easily be connected with your computer using our usb. 
*Some Laptops come with built-in Bluetooth BLE. You might not need the USB at all, however we are sending out free USBs to everyone who pledges to buy our wearable.
Trequant Circle, be a part of something bigger the best way to stay connected with the people you love.
Trequant Circle is an exclusive idea being introduced by Trequant. The purpose of the Trequant circle is to link the people with tremors via a unique chain. Because we believe you are who know the best about you because we believe that in order to find a solution for this problem people need to be encouraged to talk to each other, indulge in collaborative discussions and find answers to their problems including tremor anomalies. With Trequant Circle, people can add their friends, share their tremor stories in complete confidence with each other for discussion or collaborative analysis and motivate with each other with the help of positive competition.
With detailed discussions and deals with the manufacturer we have been able to workout our goal and where it has to go.
By supporting this project, you are also contributing to the future of Trequant. These funds will help Trequant progress from prototype stage to a power system that is ready for the global market. Your sponsorship will help us to finalize the mechanical design, build the electrical content inside each module, get the requisite certifications to meet the international safety standards, and deliver you your own Trequant.
                    DISCLAIMER
www.trequant.com is strictly for your own self-assessment. All content, including text, graphics, images and information, contained on or available through this website is for general information purposes only. Always check with your local physician before starting any training, exercise routine, medication, diet etc.. By pledging to Trequant, you agree and understand that all the advice, tips, and readings are taken at the user’s own risk. By pre-ordering here and joining www.trequant.com, you understand that you should always consult your physician before beginning any exercise program or medication routine. This general information is not intended to be used for the self-diagnosis of any medical condition or to replace your healthcare professional. Consult with your healthcare professional to design an appropriate exercise regime. If you experience any pain or difficulty with these exercises, stop and consult with your healthcare provider.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since the device has already been built and has been undergoing testing for several weeks, we hope that no problems will be encountered and the rewards will be delivered to the backers within the estimated delivery time. Nevertheless, as with any hardware project, schedule risks are always associated with manufacturing and supply chain logistics.

Trequant team has built four versions of prototypes from the beginning of this company. We obtained some data from our early prototypes and completed the proof of concept. Aside from manufacturing, the risks involved in this project are relatively low. While making the samples, some problem with the molding of a few parts were encountered. We'll finish the design for manufacturing and make the molding cost-effective.

campaign.story:
My name is Mitchell Williams. I noticed a growing trend in the industry with Operating Systems like Windows and it's various versions.... More and more cost and less and less reliability/security/privacy/freedom.... So to combat Microsoft's stranglehold on the market I came up with a new path... I want to make a new OS based on Ubuntu and Debian with some Gnome Flavors thrown in (for banks, and higher end businesses in the beginning... with home users and even a server version later on...) Essentially I want to make a hardened version of Linux, similar to Ubuntu. I can base it from Ubuntu or any other flavor... 
However...ultimately.... we need ot make OUR OWN Brand, and package it as such. I haver extensive coding knowledge, but most recently have been in data science and cyber security. I also have a healthy amount of experience with Debian, Gnome, Ubuntu and Ubuntu Server. I am willing to hire qualified people to help, or even do it myself... but I need funding to cover expenses. The first phase is done. Currently the first phase of the OS is done. I will need to perform further testing. Alpha phase completed. Will need to test it thoroughly and add some additional features. Stage 1: Wireframe. Stage 2 Alpha version. Stage 3: Beta. Stage 4 First Release. SO on and so forth. Thoughts? 

We have completed the First TWO STAGES! This has me out of pocket, and thusly I cannot continue on my own. This is why I am on KICKSTARTER. Everyone donating $100 or more will receive a free PREVIEW edition as well as a FREE WEBINAR! ($399 Value)

campaign.story:
writeHackr Magazine. A Digital Magazine App for Professional Writers.
"As a writer, writeHackr is the resource that I’ve been wanting for years. Forget about the same old rehashed fluff; the content is unique, actionable, and provides seriously unparalleled value." - David Hindin, Invented Magazine
"writeHackr isn't just for writers! As a business person I'm tasked with communicating ideas and moving people to action via writing everyday. Whether through a well crafted email or a compelling marketing piece, good writing is a make or break skill for me. writeHackr has the right mix of actionable content and interesting interviews that keeps me coming back for more." - Doug Watson, The Notebook Project
There’s something about reading a magazine. Digital or print. Flipping through the pages, eager to see what’s up next, to get reacquainted with your favorite columnists, to learn something new. It’s an experience that should be savored like a glass of scotch or a molten chocolate lava cake.
It’s exciting getting a new magazine in the mail, or receiving a notification that a new issue has been delivered to your tablet. 
So first things first: why a magazine on writing?
There are a few reasons I feel it’s time for a fresh take on the topic. One, there aren’t that many out there specifically by and for writers, for people who make their living working with words. There are a ton of excellent literary magazines and genre magazines out there. And the big players are still around—Writer’s Digest, The Writer, Poets & Writers. Plus you have trade magazines that cover things like marketing and advertising, but that don’t specifically cater to writers. 
I felt there was an opportunity to bring the entire writing community together—authors of fiction and non-fiction, copywriters, bloggers, and content marketers—to learn from each other and pass along the transferrable skills from each discipline. 
In this day and age we’re all marketers to an extent. Authors need to build platforms just as much as startups need customers and bloggers need readers. Experts need to put butts in seats, fill rooms, and sell programs.
That's what writeHackr Magazine is all about.
We all love working with words, each in our own way.
I created writeHackr Magazine for you. Because you love talking and reading about writing just as much as you love writing itself.
Because you want to be a part of a community that values the same things you do, that will help you get better at your craft, and, ultimately, earn more money as a professional.
The money we raise during this campaign will go directly to the talented writers, editors and designers that are bringing writeHackr Magazine to life. Our ultimate goal is to become a premier paid market for writers, and we'll use the money raised to increase our pay scale and build a thriving community of great contributors.
Thanks so much for your support!
Here's some more love for our first issue:
"I loved the first issue of writeHackr, with its beautiful design and epic stories. Writing is one of those core, universal skills for entrepreneurs and creators. Learning from people who have made it happen, in a format like this, is a great way to go." - Dan Norris, WPCurve
“There’s no doubt, writeHackr Magazine is just getting warmed up. Their first issue was full of gold nuggets and original actionable content that I haven’t come across before. Very excited to see what else they’ve got coming!” - Jackie Damelian, Mundo Experts
"writeHackr is jam-packed with information on how to create compelling content that captures my readers imagination. It’s become my #1 reference for ideas and new approaches for writing my articles and books. It's easy to read and filled with actionable next steps that will help me stay on track. Can't wait for next month's issue!" - Lucy Hoger, Visionocity Magazine
"The inaugural issue of writeHackr Magazine blew me away. Every article is packed full of useful information--beautifully presented and easy to understand. It's really more of a writing bible than it is a magazine. I can't wait to receive the next issue!" - Laurel Bern, Laurel Home Interiors
Featured Reward
Limited Print Edition of our Premiere Issue—for all reward tiers $60 and above, shipped anywhere in the world.
Warmest regards,
Scott Sind
Editor-in-Chief
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're working hard to publish the magazine monthly, however we recognize that it's possible to experience unforeseen delays with any project. 

The delivery date listed on the project is when our app will go live, and is simply an estimate: the creative process of creating a magazine is very fluid and can easily lead to delays. 

The good news is that writeHackr Magazine is a digital project—we won't have manufacturing delays or supply issues. The better news is that we already have a published issue, and are nearly ready to go with issues two and three. However, because we're an app, there are some things we can't control, like the approval process or technology barriers.

We've built a buffer into our expected delivery date just in case we run into any such issues.

Please be assured that we're doing our very best to ensure we deliver the project on time, including the print edition.

I will be keeping open and honest communication with all of our backers. Thank you for believing in us!

campaign.story:
Millions of people use dry erase whiteboards every day. Bring yours alive with a Kaptivo.
Whiteboards are found everywhere - in our offices, schools and even our homes. We depend on whiteboards to help us communicate our ideas to others in the room, but in today's connected world, we often need to share those ideas more widely.
Kaptivo is a brand new accessory that transforms any whiteboard into an online collaboration solution. With Kaptivo, everything you write on your whiteboard can be shared in real time with colleagues working remotely, or distributed to your team afterwards as a PDF document. You can even rewind your whiteboard to a particular point in the meeting to see how an idea developed.
Using Kaptivo is easy. Just work with your whiteboard as normal – any pen, any colour, any number of people collaborating. As you work, everything you write is captured automatically by Kaptivo.
There's no need to take notes or pictures of the board any more - Kaptivo gives you clean, sharp images ready to share or stream wirelessly in real time. With a secure invitation, anyone can access your whiteboard via their web browser or mobile device using the Kaptivo companion app. Participants can view the whiteboard evolving in real time, and rewind to any point of the whiteboard's timeline using the history feature.
Kaptivo works with any size of whiteboard up to 6' x 4' (1.8m x 1.2m). Installing Kaptivo above your whiteboard is as easy as hanging a picture frame and takes less than three minutes. Kaptivo comes with simple, clear instructions and a template for easy installation.
Inside Kaptivo is a digital (CMOS) camera with a processor, memory, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth LE. Our patent-pending image processing algorithms run in the processor.
The algorithms perform the highly complex task of analyzing the scene in real time to identify the content written on the board and remove all artifacts, such as people's hands, distortions, shadows and reflections.
Kaptivo then streams a live view of the board to connected clients via any Web browser, or the Kaptivo iOS/Android app.
Kaptivo automatically stores key frames in a history, so you can go back in time and see how the board contents changed during a session.
When you buy a Kaptivo unit, you will receive:
The main Kaptivo unit (to be mounted above your whiteboard)
A ‘control pad’ which mounts on the wall next to the whiteboard and connects to the main unit with a discreet cable
A power adapter, which plugs into the control pad
A mounting plate to enable easy fixing of Kaptivo to the wall or whiteboard
You can connect to Kaptivo from any modern browser without the need to download any software. There are also native iOS and Android apps for those who prefer to work via mobile. Depending on the volume of customer demand, we may also release a native Windows app.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have over ten years of experience developing products and software that help people collaborate. We've selected world-class manufacturers and distributors to ensure you receive the very best product right on time. However, as a contingency should any production issues arise, we have a back-up manufacturer ready to step in. 

We have tested Kaptivo prototypes rigorously as part of our two-year development process and are fully confident in its reliability and durability. We use only the highest quality parts and tooling for Kaptivo, with a diverse supply chain to de-risk any problems that may arise with individual suppliers. 

Our experienced app developers have already developed Kaptivo apps for iOS devices and the Web, and a port to Android is now in progress. As with our manufacturing, we have back-up developers identified should any issues arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Kickstarter Backers-
We're happy to announce that we have now fulfilled all orders to all of our Kickstarter backers who have provided us a shipping address.
We truly appreciate your support, ideas, and words of encouragement as we worked towards building and launching this product. We now ask you to please use your Kaptivos and let us know what you think by sending us your thoughts to feedback@kaptivo.com.

updates.update_userinfo: Exciting news - Founders' Club Kaptivos have shipped!
updates.update_content:
Dear Kickstarter backers,
We have some exciting news to share: Kaptivo is now shipping to our FOUNDERS' CLUB backers! We have shipped out all 75 of our Founders’ Club orders today, so you should be getting an email within the next 24 hours with tracking information.
Our next batch of Kaptivos will arrive at our warehouse mid-December and we will be fulfilling ALL of our remaining Kickstarter backer orders then. We’ll of course update you as we get ready to ship those.
We very much hope you enjoy using Kaptivo, and would love to hear any feedback you may have – feel free to contact us any time at feedback@kaptivo.com.

Thanks all for your enthusiasm and comments. We last updated that we’d be sending out the Kaptivos this week. Here’s the latest:
As we prepare to launch Kaptivo globally, we’ve been working on FCC/CE certification in the US and Europe to make sure we are fully compliant with national standards. During this process, we found that we needed to switch out a component in our power supply. This has added a delay of a few weeks. Conservatively, the new estimate is mid-December but we are optimistic that we will ship earlier.

Dear Kickstarter backers,
Time for a good news update! We’re on track to ramp our initial production run over the next few weeks. Once our product certifications are complete (estimate mid-November), we’ll be able to fulfill our Kickstarter orders, which means that as of the week of November 16th, your Kaptivos will begin delivery rollout based on your Kickstarter tiers – starting with the “Founders’ Club” backers.
Here's Adrian, co-founder of Kaptivo, with a video update for our Kickstarter backers. Shipping will start in October - we appreciate your patience and continued support!

Dear Kickstarter backers - we’re sure you’re all keen to know how Kaptivo’s development is progressing, so we hope you find this update informative.
On the product development side, we’re making great progress. Hardware development is now complete, and we’ve almost finished the cloud services web application, which will let you securely access and share your whiteboard from anywhere in the world from any browser on your computer or mobile device. We’ve completed preliminary development of the product packaging, too – and hope you enjoy the photos.

updates.update_userinfo: First product form factor prototypes received!
updates.update_content:
Dear backers - thank you very much for your patience while we prepared this update. We have been making great progress with our contract manufacturer - tooling and build process development and testing for mass production is now underway, and the manufacturing plan is running to schedule.
We have now received the first Kaptivo units with the final product form factor - these are still hand-assembled, but visually the units will look identical to what our Kickstarter backers will receive when we begin shipping. As you can see, compared with the earlier prototypes we showed in the video and stills, the product units will have a thinner and sleeker form factor. We love the new design and think you will too!

updates.update_userinfo: Tooling is underway! Backer survey coming soon.
updates.update_content:
Since the project was successfully funded we have been very busy and thought it would be good to bring you all up to date...
After a few weeks of final modifications, based on feedback from our manufacturer, we have now frozen the design and kicked off the tooling for mass production. We are due to see first (Alpha) samples in early July and we will have some of our engineers out in the factory in China before and during the sample build to help ensure everything goes smoothly.

Thanks to our 477 backers, we made it, raising more than $88K to bring Kaptivo to production!
We owe all of you a huge thanks from me, Nic and the whole Light Blue Optics team. Now the most exciting part begins, as we tool up with our contract manufacturer. We're getting right on it and will keep you posted with regular updates.
Watch this space!

campaign.story:
Kickstarter is Over, Life is Not!
As this Kickstarter project is coming to conclusion, I still have a chance to say a few last words on this page. First of all, I want to say THANK YOU (with a UDP packet on top)!! to all our backers who have helped this project to happen. 
Second, if you missed this project but still want to get the book, there are two options available. You can use "Pre-Order" button above (well, it should appear as soon as the project is over).  Or, as an alternative, you can wait for a Kickstarter for Vol.2 of the book; we certainly plan it, and we certainly plan to have "Vol.1+Vol.2" option there (though we do not provide any formal guarantees). For this second alternative option, you will probably get Kickstarter-specific discounts, but you will need to wait for the second project to start and complete before you get anything. If you don't to wait - make sure to PRE-ORDER :-), and if you want to get notified about Vol.2 - subscribe to our mailing list on ithare.com.
"By far the most comprehensive book on specifics of multiplayer games" - Dmitri Dain, Managing Director @Amaya Software
"Finally!" - Boris Taratine, Cyber Security Programme Chief Architect @Lloyds Bank Group
"Looking forward to read the book when it is finished" - Nuno Leiria, Core Tech Programmer @Lionhead Studios
"Looking forward to read the final book. The promise is great. Finally a book on the subject that isn't outdated or vague." - Özkan Can, Backend Technical Director @Blue Byte, A Ubisoft Studio
"The colossal book you are writing... looks very promising and exciting"  - Alessandro Alinone, Co-Founder and Co-CEO @Lightstreamer
"The really useful and highly practical book. This book will be a valuable addition to the library of anyone game developer." Michael Morgovsky, Co-Founder and CTO @Plarium
"This is one book I would like to write" - Robert Zubek, GDC speaker, formerly Principal Software Engineer @Zynga, currently Founder @SomaSim
"This is the most comprehensive reference for a developer making a multiplayer game that I have even seen. After 20 years in the AAA industry, this project is teaching me new things. Even if it was just half as ambitious as it is, it would be a must-have."- Matt Pritchard, AAA Industry veteran, developer of RTS games, FPS, Mobile F2P, and IoT devices, author and expert on multiplayer cheating.
What's the Big Idea?
One of 20+ illustrations from Vol.1
The idea behind this book is to summarize the body of knowledge that already exists on multiplayer games but is not available in one single place. And quite a few of the issues discussed within this series (planned as three volumes 400+ pages each), while known in the industry, have not been published at all (except for maybe in discussion forums). 
Programming and deploying an MOG is a daunting task, and having a frame of reference is usually quite helpful — "hey, those guys have already tried this, and it worked for them."
By the end of Vol. 1, we'll complete our discussion of the things related to architecting your MOG, and will be ready to start discussing "Development" (Vol. 2) and "Deployment" (Vol. 3). For more details on what's within the book, see the tentative Table of Contents (it also includes links to all the beta chapters from Vol. 1). 
This current project is only about Vol. 1, "Architecture," but Vol. 2 and Vol. 3 are already planned (and obviously my enthusiasm about them will get an additional boost when Vol. 1 is successfully funded ;-)). 
Why Me?
I really hate to speak about myself, but this is one of those cases where I don't have much choice. So, here it goes (and if you really want further details, you can dig them out of my LinkedIn page).
20 years ago (damn, I am getting old) I was a co-architect for an electronic stock exchange of a G20 country, and for all practical intents and purposes stock exchanges are just another game genre. The project was fun and, among other things, allowed for real-time trading over the cellphones of that time (those with 9600 baud connection).
A few years later, I became a chief software architect working for a start-up that quickly grew into a rather large online game with half a million simultaneous players that processed half a billion user transactions per day. The project taught me a damn lot about such different issues as scalability, DB physical layout, server farms, attackers and cheaters of all kinds, and bot fighting — just to name a few.
Since then, I have consulted and performed due diligence on several game-related projects. In addition, I've spent quite some time researching the field and discussing related problems and their respective solutions with people from the industry.
I feel that this puts me in quite a unique position of knowing not only one single game, but a bunch of them, and being able to summarize and generalize my real-world experiences. Oh, and I have been writing for industry journals (and am especially proud of articles in CUJ and C++ Report) since 1998, so the process of typing sentences is not something new for me either.
Since When Are Rabbits Programming??
From an 2010 article in Overload
I cannot speak for all of rabbitkind, but this particular hare has gone alongside my writings for quite a while now. He was born as "No MT Bugs" Hare in 2010, in an Overload article titled "Single-Threading: Back to the Future?"
Therefore, there is evidence that this particular rabbit has been programming at least since 2010. Yes, he has changed his appearance, but deep inside, he is still the very same bunny with a naïve idea of making programs less buggy. BTW, the character is created by Sergey Gordeev, a guy with many animation awards, known (among other things) for being a director of some of the Animated Mr. Bean series.
Who Is this Book For?
The book is intended for those intermediary developers who want to become senior ones, and for senior developers and up. I expect that the book will also be useful for decision-makers, from PMs all the way up to CEOs — so if you by any chance know one, please make sure to give her a link to this page ;-). 
On the other hand, if you are working on your first programming project, this book will probably be too difficult for you. There will be no explanation on what event-driven programming is all about, what the difference is between optimistic locking and pessimistic locking, why you need a source control system, and so on. Instead, there will be discussions on how the concept of futures fits into event-driven programming, when the use of optimistic locking make sense for games, and how to use source control in the presence of unmergeable files. 
In the same spirit, the book is not intended to be a CD to copy-paste your sample MOG from. Instead, the book aims to help you write your own code that is tailored to your own needs, and tries to advise on the available choices at most of the junctions.
What's the Plan?
Currently, the "beta" chapters of the Vol.1 are already available on my blog ithare.com. The same "beta" posts are also available re-formatted as a single PDF (11.1M, 355 PDF pages; please note that this is NOT how the book is going to look). 
Steps still to complete to bring the "beta" draft into the shape of the ready-for-printing Vol.1:
Restructure Vol.1. Done.
Go through Vol.1 again, "harmonizing" and clarifying things. I expect to add about 30'000 words during this process (give or take). Current progress: ~30% completed, 12'000 words already added. ETA: July 2016. At this point all the backers will get an (MS Word) draft.
Make another pass through Vol.1, this time is more about self-editing (not that much will need be changed at this stage, I hope). ETA: August 2016. At this point all the backers should get another (MS Word) draft.
Give it to a professional copyeditor. Cost estimate: $3100 (140'000 words @ $0.022/word). ETA: September 2016. At this point all the backers will get yet another (MS Word) draft. 
Give it to a book design/layout specialist. Cost estimate: $2900 ($500 overall design + 400 pages@$6/page). ETA: October 2016. At this point E-BOOK rewards will be sent out.
Print paperbacks with CreateSpace, and get them sent to backers. ETA - November 2016. At this point PAPERBACK rewards will be sent out.
Start selling Vol.1 on Amazon (planned price is $24.95 for Kindle, and $34.95 for paperback)
Become rich and retire to the Bahamas ;-). On second thought - this book probably won't suffice ;-(.
What's Inside?
Pretty much all MOG genres are within the scope of the book, from MMOFPS on one side of the spectrum to social games on the other side — with stock exchanges and multi-player casino games in between. However, things such as gameplay (including AI), and monetization are intentionally left out. In addition, the areas of physics and 3D graphics are too large by themselves and — to avoid expanding this into a 10-volume series — are only discussed very briefly (with pointers to good books on these subjects provided).
An excerpt from the tentative full ToC of the Vol.1: 
Chapter I. Game Design Document from an MOG Perspective
Chapter II. On Cheating, P2P, and [non-]Authoritative Servers
Chapter III. Protocols
RTT, Input Lag, and How to Mitigate Them (includes Client-Side Interpolation, Client-Side Prediction, and Lag Compensation)
Game World States and Reducing Traffic Publishable State, Interest Management, and different Compression techniques)
Point-to-Point Communications and Non-Blocking RPCs (including discussion on message queues)
IDL (includes hints on writing your own IDL compiler)
Chapter IV. DIY vs Re-Use. In Search of Balance
Chapter V. Event-Driven Programming
Classical Event-Driven Programs
Deterministic Event-Driven Programs (including benefits such as production post-mortem for both client and server, replay testing, and so on)
RPC Processing in Event-Driven Programs: from Plain Event Processing to Futures (with lambda call pyramids in between)
Relation to Actors, Node.js, and Erlang
Chapter VI. Client-Side Architecture
Graphics (only very basics)
Programming Language for Client-Side
Client-Side Architecture Diagram (based on multiple event-driven objects)
Chapter VII. Server-Side Architecture
Naïve Architectures
Web-Based Architecture (including write-back caching and locking strategies)
Classical Architecture
Front-End Servers
Load Balancing (including Round-Robin DNS, Server-Side Balancing and Client-Side Random Balancing)
Eternal Linux-vs-Windows Debate
Programming Languages for Server-Side
Chapter VIII. Unity 5 vs UE4 vs Photon vs DIY for MOG
Chapter IX. Pre-Coding Checklist: Things Everybody Hates, but Everybody Needs. From Source Control to Coding Guidelines
Chapter IX concludes Vol.1; for the list of the Chapters planned in Vol.2 and Vol.3, see the full tentative ToC.
STRETCH GOAL @10K: +50% ILLUSTRATIONS - REACHED!
As we have reached our first stretch goal @EUR 8K, it is time to announce our NEXT STRETCH GOAL. If we reach EUR10'000, then we'll ask our illustrator Sergey Gordeev (who is more known for his animation awards and directing Animated Mr Bean) to draw additional 10 or so illustrations for the book, increasing the number of illustrations in Vol. 1 by approximately 50%!
In addition, if we reach this goal, it will be our backers who decide on the face of the 'No Bugs' which is used in the book (see options here: http://ithare.com/facelift-for-no-bugs/ ). While we already had a vote on it on the site, results were not conclusive, so (at least for the book) we'll defer to the vote of our Kickstarter backers!
STRETCH GOAL @8K: "KICKSTARTER SPECIAL" EDITION - REACHED!
As we're now 100% funded (BIG THANKS TO ALL THE BACKERS!), here comes our STRETCH GOAL (which will become available at reaching the number of EUR8000). If we reach this stretch goal, all the backers will have a choice to have their books/e-books shipped/downloaded either as "regular" books, or as "KICKSTARTER SPECIAL EDITION" books, with the latter only available to Kickstarter backers.
These "KICKSTARTER SPECIAL EDITION" books/e-books will get a new cover (probably with "KICKSTARTER SPECIAL EDITION" on it), a special "THANK YOU" page (and probably a separate ISBN too, though it doesn't really matter). Our illustrator will start working on the Kickstarter cover as soon as we reach this stretch goal, so you will see it sooner rather than later...
On "VIRTUAL PRESENCE" Consulting
Two of the rewards mention "VIRTUAL PRESENCE" Consulting. It will be as if I came to your office for the specified number of days. However, I will come not in person, but over Skype or something similar. You will describe your problems to me, and I’ll do my best to advise you on how to solve them. A few notes regarding this:
How I use my time during these days is up to you. You tell me your story, I listen; you show me a document, I read it; you ask me for advice, I go offline for some time and come back with the best solution I can think of.
With this in mind, it makes sense to ask me questions at the end of one day to get some advice the next day. While technically I am not obligated to think between the days, I am unlikely to be able to keep myself from thinking about a challenging problem ;-)
100% confidentiality is assured (well, save for somebody hijacking the Skype channel or something).
Please do NOT assume that you can hire me at these rates outside of this Kickstarter project. Beyond this Kickstarter project (for which I have special permission) it will need to be done through my employer and, to the best of my knowledge, it is going to be MUCH more expensive.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At the moment, the project is already at a rather advanced stage. The whole Vol.1 (~110K words) is already available as "beta" at http://ithare.com/contents-of-development-and-deployment-of-multiplayer-online-games-from-social-games-to-mmofps-with-stock-exchanges-in-between/ 

It still needs another two passes by me (probably adding another 30K words in the process), followed by professional editing and layout, but with 80% of the content ready, IMHO the risks are minimal.

NB: this doesn't include the risks of you being bored to death, or shooting your project in the foot C++-style. These risks (and pretty much any other risks too) are expressly disclaimed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Long time no see, but Vol. II is on the horizon
updates.update_content:
Hi!
My apologies for a long time without updates. A few things have happened since the last update:
Bad: unfortunately, we had to change our book design team :-(
Good: on the plus side, we found an even better design team, which is currently working full-speed on the design of the Vol. II (which is currently text-ready on Leanpub, but still needs to be properly formatted, and once again proofread before going to print).

updates.update_userinfo: If you didn't receive your Vol. I - it is time to complain
updates.update_content:
Hello! 
While ETAs for shipment of Vol.I were atrociously long (sorry, but we weren't able to improve it without breaking the bank), even these times are over now, so if your reward included PAPERBACK or HARDCOVER, and you filled your survey months ago, and by any chance you did NOT receive your Vol. I yet - it is a good time to give me a shout. 
Updates about other things:

updates.update_userinfo: All PAPERBACK/HARDCOVER Vol. Is are shipped!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
Good news! Finally, we can say that all the PAPERBACK/HARDCOVER Vol Is are printed and shipped (more strictly - they were sent to "all those backers who filled in their surveys at least a week ago, and didn't ask to keep their book 'on hold'"). It took a while, but I hope you'll find that the wait was well-worth it.
Please keep in mind that we had to use the cheapest possible shipping - which means that (a) there is no tracking, and (b) many deliveries were estimated as late as the end of August :-(.

updates.update_userinfo: "Coupons" to access up-to-date drafts/e-books are e-mailed
updates.update_content:
Hello!
Currently, PDF version of Vol. I is ready, and EPUB and MOBI versions are in the process of being formatted (should be ready in a few days). And for Vol. II - Vol. III, current "early drafts" are available.
To provide you with access to both "early drafts" and to final electronic versions (when they're ready), we decided to cooperate with Leanpub. We sent all our backers (except for EUR2 pledges) an e-mail with three "Leanpub coupons" (one "coupon" for each volume). These "coupons" allow you to "purchase" (for $0.00) Vol.I-Vol.III of "Development and Deployment of Multiplayer Online Games", and after this "purchase" you will be able to download the-most-current-version-of-each-volume whenever you want (NB: Leanpub will ask your e-mail address, and will create an account for you to facilitate such an ongoing access).

campaign.story:
UDOO X86 is the New PC: the most powerful maker board ever and an Arduino™ 101-compatible platform, all embedded on the same board.
On UDOO X86 you can run all the software available for the PC world, from gaming to video streaming, from graphical editors to professional development platforms, plus all the software for the Arduino™ 101 world, including all the sketches, libraries and the official Arduino™ 101 IDE.
You won't ever worry about lack of drivers or stuff like that. 
This is a true next-generation computer.  
UDOO X86 is 10 times more powerful than Raspberry Pi 3, able to drive up to three 4K screens at the same time.
It is based on Quad Core 64-bit new-generation x86 processors made by Intel®, designed for the PC domain. Prodigious processors concentrated in 14 nm, with an amount of energy consumption of 5 or 6 Watt.
The UDOO X86 embedds the newest Arduino™ 101, with all the upgrades - including 6-axis accelerometer and gyroscope and Bluetooth Low Energy connectivity.
The Arduino™-compatible platform onboard is connected with the main processor through an internal USB port.
In terms of software UDOO X86 is compatible with the official Arduino™ 101 IDE and with all the sketches, tutorials and resources available in the Arduino™ 101 community.
Speaking of hardware, UDOO X86 has the same pinout layout of Arduino™ 101. In other words, UDOO X86 is compatible with all Arduino™ 101-compatible shields, sensors and actuators.
The board operating voltage and I/O is 3.3V but all pins are also protected against 5V overvoltage.
Why is an Arduino™ 101-compatible module such a great addition to this board? 
UDOO X86 can be used to program the Arduino™-compatible module directly with the standard Arduino™ IDE.
  But the ace in the hole of UDOO X86 is the communication between the Intel® Quad Core processor and the Arduino™-compatible plaform. The interconnection between the two systems is the distinctive feature of UDOO, and this time we have pushed this interaction even further. The board is designed to allow the Arduino™ 101-compatible microcontroller to run when the powerful CPU is powered off, and wake it up when something's happened in the world. IoT gets easy. 
UDOO X86 supports a multiboot configuration and boot from everywhere, being even more flexible.

But what really makes UDOO X86 a true PC is its flexibility, first of all in terms of storage: UDOO X86 mounts 8 GB eMMC on board, a Micro SD card reader as well as SATA, M.2 Key B and USB 3.0 ports to attach your new-generation hard disk.


UDOO X86 is also above the standard in terms of software flexibility: on UDOO X86 you can run any x86-compatible OS: Linux®, Windows® or Android™.

Moreover, the processors we've chosen are specifically dedicated to the PC domain. 

 

The UDOO X86 can connect over Gigabit Ethernet.

Moreover it has an M.2 connector that can connect over Wi-Fi 802.11ac and Bluetooth Low Energy via an external Wi-Fi/Bluetooth Low Energy module, that you'll get if you choose the Performance Kit here on Kickstarter and, once the product is shipped, on sale in our shop.  

In case you're wondering, you can use any Wi-Fi/Bluetooth module already available on the market.
Not only this: the Arduino™ 101-compatible has its own embedded Bluetooth Low Energy module embedded to seamlessly communicate with wireless sensors, smartphones and tablets.
Need some ideas?
Watch Netflix, Sky Go, Amazon Instant Videos or other streaming platforms in the quiet calm of a fanless Home Theather Personal Computer;
add a USB DVB-T2 tuner to turn whatever attached monitor into a Digital Terrestrial Television;
exploit the HDMI-CEC to allow UDOO X86 connected to your TV through HDMI port to communicate back-and-forth with your TV and thus, to control UDOO X86 through your remote control;
use your mobile phone or any RC5 IR-enabled remote control.

All the retrogaming old glories fits in your pocket. 
Use UDOO X86 also as a Steam© in-home streaming machine for your main Steam©-machine: you can play in a different room or even remotely over 7,500 videogames!
Power to the gamers!
  UDOO X86 is Home PC  
Surf the web. Check your email. Edit your holiday pictures on Photoshop. Update your Facebook status. Write a novel with Microsoft® Word®. Read the newspaper. 
Still need a netbook?
Finally comes a fast compiling board, so to let you experiment also when you're short on time - at hackathons or in class - a board which is compatible with all the resources for the PC and Arduino™ world, well-documented and supported by an open source community: you won’t ever feel alone as a teacher.
Considering its compatibility with Arduino™ and the gargantuan amount of resources for the PC world, no other single board computer is supported as much.
Need even more power? Choose the CLUSTER KIT among the pledges, build a cluster of UDOO X86 and skyrocket to the supercomputer level! 
UDOO X86 is indeed the perfect platform for cluster application: thanks to OmpSs programming model, developed by Barcelona Supercomputing Center and supported by the EC-funded AXIOM Project it is possible to set a multi-node application in a simple and efficient way.
UDOO X86 is a truly complete toolbox for makers that won't take a no for an answer.
It's what Makers want:
Full-fledged PC + Arduino™ 101 
Open Source Hardware 
Open Source Software 
Growing community 
Huge compatibility: Arduino™ 101, Open Source and x86 worlds
Any PC-OS or distribution 
Any computer language 
No delays for kernel's porting or stuck to old kernels 
Boot from everywhere 
Fast compile time 
Tons of I/O 
Oodles of interfaces and peripherals

Unleash your creativity with true freedom of choice. 
Any PC-OS, any language, expandability, modularity, UDOO X86 is a brethe of fresh air for creative minds and experience designers. 
Leveraging the Arduino-compatible Intel® Curie™ and embedded sensors onboard, UDOO X86 is ideal for interactive spaces, enhanced with gesture control, spoken commands, high-resolution displays and distributed motion sensing input systems like Intel® RealSense™, Microsoft® Kinect™ 2 or Leap Motion. 
UDOO X86 allows to easily build new solutions based on already worldwide known high-level tools, such as Open Frameworks, Unity 3D, Processing, Unreal Engine and Pure Data. 
UDOO X86 is Digital Signage on Steroids
Move on to digital signage on steroids: no more just a vehicle for distributing information but a complete infotainment/entertainment package, captivating the audience and engaging them at the purchase point, and possibly tracking and reporting on that experience.
With compatibility of resources your world opens up to new possibilities.
UDOO X86 as thin client in the office means an incredible amount of energy and money saved, not only because it costs insanely less, but because it consumes just a fraction of your computer.
On UDOO X86 you can run the Microsoft® Office® environment as you're used to with your Windows® computer. If you're used to Linux instead, no problem! UDOO X86 is based on desktop processors, thus don't you worry: drivers for Linux distributions are supported!
Set up your work environment and you won't ever notice the difference. 
UDOO X86 gives you the coolest microcontroller in the maker domain and a huge set of programmable peripherals to interconnect with the mobile and the embedded worlds, as well as programmable 6-axis motion sensors and even Bluetooth Low Energy connectivity.
By exploiting the wireless interaction with UDOO BRICKS you'll get the ideal IoT control unit.
UDOO X86 is Prototyping at Light Speed
UDOO X86 accelerate your build-measure-learn cycle to light speed, with no more dead times for porting software or slow compilation time, but overall, it's the single board computer with the widest amount of compatible resources.
You can finally concentrate on the next iteration, focusing on what truly matters the most for your startup/product idea.
Here's a non-exhaustive list of schools, Universities and research groups we supported so far with donations or through collaborations or with internships.

At UDOO we promote the Open Source culture.
We will release Schematics, 3D design, binaries, the Bill of Material (BOM) and other resources following the end of the campaign, along with a Creative Commons CC BY-SA 3.0 license, as we have done before for all of our boards already on the market.
  UDOO X86 Acrylic Enclosure
If you're looking for a cool, geeky support for UDOO X86 select the pledge that includes the acrylic enclosure. It's so nice! 
The acrylic enclosure design file will be published under a Creative Commons license to give the possibility to modify it and to produce it with your favorite material and colors.
UDOO X86: a glance under the hood
      Pledges
    Testimonials

PLAY

Roberto Giorgi
Associate Professor, IEEE Senior Member, ACM Lifetime Member


PLAY

Roberto Fazio
Visual Artist, Interaction Designer and Educator

PLAY

Enrico Viola
Creative Coder, Interaction Designer 

Bruno Sinopoli 
Associate Professor at Carnegie Mellon University, Electrical & Computer Engineering Department


Previous UDOO campaigns
UDOO is back!
With UDOO DUAL/QUAD, our first single board computer launched on Kickstarter in 2013, we created a new playground for students to learn the basics of coding, electronics and physical computing with an all-in-one solution.
With UDOO NEO, our second single board computer launched last year on Kickstarter, we empowered makers, designers, startups and research groups all over the world with an IoT-ready all-in-one device for moving applications (rovers, drones, robots, automation) and educational purposes.

With UDOO X86 we aim at an even easier, unique solution, designed to empower demanding, experienced developers as well as beginners.

Community
A strong point of UDOO is its growing community of developers and makers. It's a community based on Open Source values, where people share their ideas and problems. 
Our forum is daily updated. Our blog reports the news from the UDOO and embedded domains, especially from hackathons and tech events we take part to all over the world - for example we are aficionados of Maker Faire Rome, Embedded World Nuremberg and Droidcon and we usually organize workshops and talks at the place of the event. Taking part to these events and many many others is crucial to enlarge the community. Finally, UDOO-based projects are collected on Hackster on our dedicated page.
On our website we also have other resources, where we put all our stuff (3D files, schematics, BOM, etcetera) available for free.


    UDOO is the result of a joint effort between SECO and AIDILAB. SECO designs and manufactures each product in the UDOO family. Relying on SECO means relying on a manufacturer with over 35 years of experience in the single board computer field, with an in-house manufacturing unit that has been an ISO9001 certified company since 2003. AIDILAB is an Interaction Design Lab of artists, designers and engineers focused on nurturing the UDOO community, building software and hardware applications for the UDOO family and spreading the open-source philosophy of UDOO around the world.
License Disclaimer

Acknowledgments  
We'd like to especially thank Santa Chiara Lab for granting us a wonderful location for the video. We'd also like to thank Università di Siena for the support.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SECO, a strong player in the B2B embedded market, is a fundamental partner in the project and manufacturer of the board, with over 35 years of experience in the design and production of electronic embedded solutions. 
SECO is also the designer and manufacturer of the whole UDOO family, as well as thousands of other single board computers for industrial customers. Its in-house manufacturing unit has been ISO9001-certified since 2003. For this reason, we don’t foresee any problems with the design, manufacturing or shipping of UDOO x86 within the expected deadlines. At the moment the product has already been developed as a rev A prototype, but it is still a work in progress on the hardware side. Funding through Kickstarter is fundamental for us to buy components in large quantities and at the same time keep the price as low as possible. 

Regarding the software, the only risk regards the development of an Android OS for UDOO X86 within the time schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Aluminum Mosquito Egg Trap
Don't Kill Mosquitoes - Kill their Eggs!
A Revolution in Mosquito Control
Now more than ever, with the Zika virus threatening, we need an efficient way to eliminate mosquitoes.
The Study:
Mosquito Get Gone is based on the work done by researchers over a period of six years, and tested in the mosquito-rich environments of Central America.
“The study, conducted in Guatemala, shows the successful development and implementation of a cheap, easy system to reduce virus-carrying Aedes genus mosquitoes by capturing and destroying its eggs.” 
 – Science Daily, April 7, 2016
What Did They Find?
The studies revealed that when mosquitoes lay their eggs, they release pheromone, a chemical which signals to other mosquitoes this is a safe place. As more mosquitoes lay their eggs, the pheromone concentration increases and this specific location become more attractive to other mosquitoes.
How Does It Work?
We have created a proprietary mixture, based on the mosquitoes-friendly swamps of Southern Louisiana, which is already attractive to mosquitoes. When you set the trap, you include this liquid which will entice the mosquitoes in your environment to lay their eggs there. This is when the magic happens…
Mosquitoes lay their eggs, and while doing so release their pheromone into the liquid to signal to other mosquitoes this is a safe place. 
 Every three to five days, you drain the liquid, discard the filter and the eggs, and put the liquid back in the trap. As more mosquitoes lay their eggs, the pheromone content in the solution (fluid) increases, making your trap the most popular place for female mosquitoes.
Soon, your trap has the highest concentration of pheromone in your environment, and the vast majority of the mosquitoes lay their eggs it… … and get discarded as well. Leaving you without mosquitoes!
The Trap
The trap is sturdy, made of metal (aluminum or copper) and decorative. 
The trap is about 12" high, with a cap about 6" high. It is highly durable and will last for years.
It's shipped with a quart (liter) of the starting breeder liquid to attract mosquitoes, and a year-long supply of filters to replace every 3-5 days.
Perfect for Gardeners and People Who Care about Their Enviroment
The ideal person to use this is someone with a yard or garden, and who takes care of it regularly. As you water your plants and go about your garden, you also drain the trap, discard the filter and eggs, put a new filter and refill it with the drained liquid. 
The whole operation takes about 5 minutes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are no risks to this project.

The challenge is to get it to market by the beginning of mosquito season, and help eliminate a very serious threat to public health due to the Zika virus and other diseases.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Project is Funded - Production is Starting!
updates.update_content:
Hello All:
I wish to thank you for your great support in this venture! The project is now funded, and will allow me to go into production shortly.
Many of you have sent me very interesting questions. This has sent me checking on sources and studies that have been made on mosquitoes.

One of the backers of the project has sent me this news from the Wall Street Journal:
http://www.wsj.com/articles/zika-virus-mosquitoes-may-spread-farther-north-than-thought-1459372466
Over here in New Orleans, we're very worried about the effect an outbreak will have on our economy, let alone the danger to women of child bearing age.

updates.update_userinfo: New discovery means more U.S. states will face a risk from Zika
updates.update_content: From the Washington Post

Hello All:
I've had a couple of request about the ability to order more than one unit. I'm not an expert on Kickstarter, but I've kicked the tires a bit (pun intended...) and this is what I came up with:
If you wish more than one unit, pledge the amount that corresponds to the number of units you wish, and send me a message so I can make a note of it. I'll ship however many you ordered. Only include one shipping cost, I'll take care of the rest by shipping the units in the same package.

I don't know about your neck of the wood, but here in New Orleans, the mosquitoes have come out. 
I have set up a couple of traps in my yard, and have also done so at my children's locations. As the weather warms up, we are going to see more mosquito egg-laying, and consequently a decrease in the number of these flying pests.
The traps have been up for about three weeks now, and there is a marked decrease in the number of mosquitoes. This is anecdotal, but definitely noticeable.

project_data.project_name: Natural Mosquito Control that Works

campaign.story:
In September 2015, the the Spartan 6 Learner's board PCB was released for prototype manufacturing and we expected it to be ready for release in October.
It delayed a bit and we finally had the working prototype ready by October 2015.
We finally posted it on Kickstarter, However, we overestimated the demand and the project was unsuccessful.
Nicknamed Spartixed, the evaluation board ( Part Number REF0115V1) is designed to help learning Verilog / VHDL and FPGA design. You can actually download the synthesized code into the board and see the working code in action. The interfaces include UART, SPI Bus, I2C Bus.
Spartixed Block Diagram
 We listened to the feedback from the previous post and decided not to include the 12V  5V regulator. The board is now powered by the USB OTG Connector which also functions as USB to UART port.
Here is the list of the complete features
1. 3 digit 7 Segment Display
2. Three Push Button Switches
3. 8 Slide Switches for Input
4. UART Port connected to USB connector
5. I2C EEPROM ( to learn I2C Bus)
6. SPI Bus EEPROM
7. SPI Bus A/D Converter ( optional)
8. Two General Purpose LEDs.
9. One power LED and a configuration ready LED.
10. 16 Megabit Flash for program.
The example programs running on this board has been uploaded at referencedesigner.com and can be viewed here - http://referencedesigner.com/tutorials/s6evalboard/eval_board_01.php
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The board has been verified to work and as such we do not see any risk. We have ordered the manufacturing of 50 boards and these are expected to arrive by the time pledging ends.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It has been long since the project was launched. We hope that you enjoyed working with Spartixed as an education tool. 
We have an inventory of about 40 Spartixed and we wanted to clear our inventory. The Spartixed is now being offered at $30 each. If you or anyone else need Spartixed, you may follow the buy link or go directly at the referencedesigner page here -  
http://referencedesigner.com/blog/spartixed-order/3272/

It has been 2 months since we last posted the update on Spartixed. We hope that at least some of you have tried out Spartixed. We would like to know how was your experience with it.
We also announce the availability of Spartixed on our Reference Designer site and on Amazon.
1. Reference Designer - http://referencedesigner.com/blog/spartixed-order/3272/
2. Amazon - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01IKN03A0/

By now all of the US backers should have received the Spartixed. Most of the backers outside US should also have received it.
Please send me a message if you have not received your Spartixed in private message box and I will look into it.
We have uploaded most of the details of the Hardware of Spartixed and can be seen here http://referencedesigner.com/tutorials/s6evalboard/hdd_01.php

The US Backers have started receiving the boards, and I hope it is not too late to post the instructions on how to get started with this board.
So this update will focus on how to get going with the board you received.
By default the board has been programmed to display one of the 7 Segment displays. If you hook the board with a USB Cable to power it up, it will show up, most likely a digit 8. If you change one of the 4 slide switches on the left, the letter will change - for example 0101 will display 5.

All Spartixed and the associated programmer have been packaged and will ship on Monday May 02, 2016 and Tuesday May 03, 2016.
Everyone in US should get these by this weekend. Backers outside US should expect to take another few days.
The Spartixed and the programmer looks like a nice combo. The programming is breeze and experience is nice as much as we had time to work with it. There were few issues during the assembly ( we pointed one of these in our last email).

We shipped out Spartixed to everyone who backed only the Spartixed board and not the associated programmer. The The boards have been shipped with a USB Cable for powering up.
We had some minor assembly issue - the firs one was a resistor swap that led to dim LED display in one of the 7 segments of the 7 Segment LED. The details and the pictures are posted in

We thank everyone who supported Spartixed and our sincere apology for not posting update earlier.
50 Spartixed Boards Arrived
The good news is that we have 50 manufactured Spartixed boards in hands that arrived couple of days ago. We tested it and it looks nice. In the coming days all the boards will be tested and packaged for shipping.

project_data.project_name: Spartixed - FPGA Board for Verilog / VHDL learners
