campaign.story:
PiSec - BEST security solution to your Rasbpberry Pi.
PiSec offers, right out of the box, all you need to secure your Raspberry Pi, from the Ethernet connection to the SD Card..
You can use your RBPi to collect, store, and transfer data, but these bytes are always handled in clear text.
There are several scenarios where you can use this small & powerful computer:
Standalone PC as a storage system.  
Standalone PC as a data logger.
Standalone PC with licensed software.
Embedded device to control complex machines/systems. Standalone server.
Very powerful and flexible, indeed! But …
What happens if someone steals your NAS disks, your SD card, or your USB drive? 
What happens if someone sniffs the sensors' or actuators' communication lines and steals your telemetry? 
Can you afford to expose your data? Or …
Worst-case scenario: since RBPi is easily available, all your products can be replicated by your competitor.  
Even worse: what if a system mimics one of your authorized machines? (Man in the Middle attack).
… Can you afford to lose your business?
We want strong security, so we cannot rely on software-generated keys/certificates because they do not use true random generated numbers. At the same time, this strong protection system must not overload RBPi's processor, nor collapse its OS.
We're proud to introduce PiSec, the best security solution to your Rasbpberry Pi (and all devices with a SPI bus).
RBPi + PiSec = 360º security
PiSec is a hardware solution. No previous experience on security is required and you don’t need to study complex security algorithms or write long pieces of code. All you need to do to secure your RBPi-based system is to plug PiSec on it.

Reduced development costs and faster time to market!
PiSec features:
PiSec features:
A True Random Number Generator (TRNG). The random seed is obtained from white noise generatos with a very high entropy level (FIPS & AIS 31 compliant). Remeber that  true random generated numbers are crucial to create strong secure keys, and therefore, certifcates.
A Hardware key generator which store them internally (inside the chip). 
A certificate generator which generates the certificates, based on the keys mentioned above.
A secure file system that uses an internal certificate to prevent unauthorised access.
API/Tools to encrypt/decrypt USB, Ethernet, I2C, etc., by using internal certificates.
API/Tools to check application certificates against the local ones to prevent unauthorised use.
PiSec features:A True Random Number Generator (TRNG). The random seed is obtained from white noise generatos with a very high entropy level (FIPS & AIS 31 compliant). Remeber that  true random generated numbers are crucial to create strong secure keys, and therefore, certifcates.
Cryptoprocessor
By connecting PiSec Shield to your Raspberry Pi, you are boosting your device with an Egeon Technology's Cryptoproccessor with the following powerful features:
Reliable and Secure Platform 
True Random Number Generator
Certification Authority (CA). 
Data is encrypted inside the processor (hardware). 
The keys never get out of the chip. 
This reinforces security and makes external attacks very difficult. 
You can set up groups of authorised PiSecs. This way, only those PiSecs can decrypt the files.
PiSec uses Elliptic Curve Cryptography. It reduces the processor load and speeds up the key verification process. 
PiSec uses AES 256 – XTS Once connected, 
PiSec is automatically detected with a single command. 
TRUESIGN - Verification and sign process with X.509 certificates. 
SECURITAS - X.509 certificates generator. 
FIDES - Key verification process with Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC). 
Encrypted and secure storage, both within USB devices and PiSec's SD card. 
After a predefined failed access trials, PiSec automatically get blocked to prevents force brute and DOS attacks. 
After a predefined idle time, PiSec's encrypted file system is unmounted automatically.
Goals and project calendar
To complete PiSec v1.0’s development according to the above-mentioned features and capabilities, we will need to raise 35.000€.
We want to go one step further and include three additional functionalities that will make PiSec a more interesting and powerful device for your IoT applications: WiFi, Bluetooth and Real Time Clock on board . This would be PiSec v2.0. 
To afford the development of these extra features, we will need an extra 15.000€. Thus, if we reach 50.000€ with your support, we will start developing and producing PiSec v2.0 and you will get this powerful module including secure WiFi and Bluetooth communications instead of the initial PiSec v1.0.
Our final goal is to obtain FIPS security certification for PiSec, but this is a long, close to 8 months, and expensive process which requires an extra 50.000€. Thus, if we reach 100.000€ with your support, we will start the FIPS certification process.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In any development project, there may arise difficulties which can cause the project to be delayed or even forcefully to cancelled. However, in EGEON Technologies we are fully confident that we will successfully finish PiSec’s development.

This is not just an optimistic view of our capabilities. The knowledge and professional experience of our team members prove that. Our team has more than 20 years of experience in developing and manufacturing hardware with special emphasis on the design of secure systems, such as Cryptotoken – the only USB storage device approved by the Spanish government. Our involvement in the design of the secure HDD on board of the Airbus A330 MRTT, or the communication devices installed in several international airports’ control towers are also worth mentioning.

Nevertheless, it may happen that we bump into some obstacles such as delays in the software development, the detection of vulnerabilities in the OS and in other software tools we use, or, in case we reach the 100k goal, delays/incidents in the FIPS certification process (in this last case, goal reached, the first units could be delivered before the completion of the certification process, and therefore not certified).

In any case, none of these incidents will stop PiSec’s development because, as already mentioned, they are part of the market strategy of EGEON Technology.

campaign.story:
Create Mobile Apps in Minutes without Coding!
Our mission is to help companies and individuals create professional iPhone, Android and Amazon applications easily using a drag and drop system.

With our new platform you don't need to be an Xcode expert, a Java guru or a software developer to build your own mobile app. Simply choosing a template, easily edit and format the content, and then adding pictures and multimedia files.
Our web based platform will allow anyone to create amazing mobile apps without any programming skill and without sacrificing functionality.
Just take a look at the early version of the editor:
As you can see there is no code at all, only simply buttons to add and format your content. This creation environment allows anyone to quickly and easily create a gorgeous mobile application with superior functionality.
The future platform will be based on a monthly subscription with different prices depending on the number of created apps. Our Kickstarter supporters will have a LIFETIME account without any more payments.
How It Works
Once you have entered the web platform, you can choose among more than 200 templates that we have developed or just start from scratch.
Some of our greate Features:
Sync Content: you can choose to put the content in your app package or submit it to the cloud; if you choose the cloud option you will be able to send your updates through the cloud to every single device that has your app.
Unlimited Push Notifications: all of our plans will include unlimited push (pop-up messages from the website to all of your users devices).
In-App Purchases: the apps created on our platform will be able to offer digital content such as: virtual currency, expansion packs, upgrades, and more for purchase within your apps. 
Your awn eCommerce App: ultimate way to make a mobile app for your business in sales. Target all markets around the world with your products and services. It doesn?t matter what it is: food, garment, gadgets, etc.
GPS and Maps: displays a location on an interactive map and and locate items near you on an interactive map.. Shows current location and directions to the desired destination.
PDF Editor: have a unique app on the App Store and Google Play with multimedia PDF in it. Embed video and audio content in your PDF files and give your magazines or books a new life.
Be Social! : you will be able to promote your app on the most important Social Network channels like Facebook, Twitter and many more.
Your BLOG in your APP: with just a pair of clicks, you can include your mobile web page in your app. The page will load from your server.
Monetization methods: you can choose the way you want to monetize your app. At this moment the platform can integrate banner and interstitial ads with Admob, Revmob, Pollfish and AirPush.
Statistics : track your detailed app statistics using this integrated feature. Track the number of installs and the actual application usage (the number of times app was activated).
HTML + CSS Edition: if you need some feature that is not available at the platform or to personalize even more some aspects.
Someone said Games?? Yes! You will be able as well to publish games on iOS and Android. We currently have more than 10 games developed and working on more. Just need to change some graphics and/or sounds and publish, keep it simple!
Here you can see some examples of available games templates:

The funds
The funds provided by our backers, will be used to test the font-end and to add more features and templates. This templates will allow for the quick and easy creation of mobile applications.
Also, we need to funding for hosting and servers that support the user's cloud contents.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our team's first rodeo and the risks and challenges faced are minimal. 

We have already developed , built and tested the back-end of the app builder and at the moment have already built the front-end too.
Now the team is working on adding more features and templates (working on more than 200 templates at this moment and 100 features!). 
However, the front-end testing and the synchronized building on iOS and Android still needs to be developed. .

We'll keep you posted along the way with new features, templates updates and much more!

campaign.story:
We are very excited to get funded so quickly within 27 hours. And we've gathered 1,000 qualMeter lovers all around the world within 13 days! We know we can do better. With your continuously help, we can reach the $50,000 CAD stretch goal, so we can start to work on upgrading the qualMeter to qualMeter X ASAP. Please help sharing qualMeter to your friends, family and community! Thank you very much!
QooPow™ qualMeter in the News:
http://www.geeky-gadgets.com/qoometer-smart-usb-charger-hits-kickstarter-10-02-2016/
http://www.kicktraq.com/projects/1187836018/qoometer-finally-a-smart-usb-cable-charger-tester/
http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/charger-tester
http://www.omicrono.com/2016/02/protege-tus-dispositivos-de-cables-usb-baratos-con-este-aparato/ (Spanish)
http://www.shenzhenware.com/articles/10614 (Chinese-中文)
========================================
The $50,000 CAD Stretch Goal for qualMeter X has fulfilled! Please scroll down to find out the details.
========================================
Introducing the QooPow™ qualMeter
QooPow™ qualMeter is a revolutionary, smart and cost-efficient DIY device, which can simply help you to diagnostic and get to know the quality of your USB cables and chargers in a glance without any technical background. 
With qualMeter around, you will never need to worry about on getting wrong cables and chargers for your precious smartphone or tablet.
Special rewards exclusively for BackerClub's Members only!
qualMeter handles wide range of mainstream USB charging cables. It also tests loading capability of the 5v chargers to roughly define their quality.
Our motivation for creating the QooPow™ qualMeter was from the observation that there are too many low quality and compromised charging products in the market, especially 3rd-party charging cables and chargers. There is lacking of an easy and simple way to measure the quality of charging cables and chargers for people.
In our daily life, USB cables and chargers are playing big role of mobile device charging, therefore their quality is critical for the charging. Low quality charging cables and chargers could cause serious damage on your mobile devices or might even burn down your house. You can easily find tons of images, videos and stories by simply search Google and YouTube with keywords like charging cable burning, charger on fire etc. 
Google Search Screen Shot about "charging cable burning "
Well, a burning or something on fire is very obvious to us to catch. The question is how can we find it out before it burns? or even before we buy it?
Furthermore, there are also other important but hidden impacts that most of people wouldn’t know in a easy way such as slow charging, strange behaviors on smart phone when charging, dropping data transfer and so on. The following Tip would give you some ideas about how a low quality charging cable will cause slow charging.
Tech Tips:
Wondering why is your charging so slow? A non-qualified charging cable could have a dramatic voltage drop. For example, if your charging cable's impedance is 500mΩ, which many low quality cables do. It will have 0.5v drop @1A charging current, that means you will only get 4.5v at the phone end when your charger provides 5v for charging. Most of smart phones won't even charge in this case. That explains a lot of charging issues we have.
A Low Quality Cable at Charging
In addition, the charging current is now getting higher and higher due to massive application of smart devices. Many devices are charged at 2A or above such as pads and tablets etc. The quality of charging cable has become critical nowadays. Take the given example above, it will have 1v dropping if you are charging at 2A current which leads to only 4v to the device end. Beside the safety issue you may have, there will be certainly no charging at this low voltage for smart devices.
FYI, Check out this USB charging cable review video from YouTube: （in case if you are not able to watch here, here is the link: https://youtu.be/doMHmGatyYc）
Unfortunately, like the above video, to evaluate the performance of the charging cable and charger is not really an easy task for most of non-tech people or even sometimes for tech people. It requires not only some electronic knowledge but also needs expensive testing equipment. People find it's very hard to deal with all different kind of massive charging products.
Now, with qualMeter, we’ll be able to make differences. It is a revolutionary product that allows everyone to have the easiest and smarter way to rule the charging.
QooPow™ qualMeter was initially made for our own lab demanding as we are developing smart and fast charging products for mobile devices. The purpose of making such tool was based on the situation that we needed to roughly measure the different qualities of the cables/chargers and their impact on our products’ performance. 
With qualMeter, we are able to easily category the pile of cables and chargers without complicated reading and analyzing. When some of our friends were showing their great interests in this little device, we started to realize that it could benefit others. So we decided to take qualMeter to Kickstarter and to share with you.
Part of qualMeter's testing environment
One of our friends, Rebecca, was suspecting on one of her new bought charging cables, which always felt hot when charging. We gave Rebecca one of our qualMeter prototypes for testing. By using the qualMeter, she was able to find out this cable was in a bad condition before the wire burns on fire. She then checked rest of her cables and chargers, and was able to eliminate 2 other bad cables and 1 bad charger. The next day, Rebecca went shopping. With a little help from qualMeter she bought 3 good cables in a decent price. The businessman was shocked to see her using qualMeter and even asked her where to get one. Lol~ Rebecca was extremely happy with qualMeter, because she's smarter. 
What makes the qualMeter so unique is it comes along with a simple idea that everyone can measure the quality of random cable/charger in a simple way, an affordable way. It intends to provide an easy and simple solution in a fairly low cost. 
qualMeter is designed for non-tech people but can certainly be used by tech-savvies for roughly testing as well.
Who needs QooPow™ qualMeter?
If you…
Are unsure about the quality of your USB cable & charger;
Are looking for safe and faster charging; 
Don’t want to be cheated by those unscrupulous businessmen; 
Are tired with poor quality of charging cables and chargers; 
Have ever been in dilemma of choosing right USB cable/charger; 
Are dealing with USB cables/chargers as a business; 
Wanted to have easier and simpler solution to rank the pile of cables/chargers; 
More...
The Features of QooPow™ qualMeter?
qualMeter is basically made for testing USB charging cables and chargers. It has two major functions:
Cable Test Mode - Simply connect both ends of your USB charging cable with qualMeter and plug it into any 5v USB charging port. You can read the LED indicators to have an idea about the quality of your charging cable.
Charger Test Mode - Simply plug qualMeter into any 5v USB charging port. You can read the LED indicators to have an idea about the quality of your USB Charger.
qualMeter has embedded an ultra low power Micro-Processor, a brain, to provide the ability of being smart. Beside its main Cable Test and Charger Test features, it also comes with the following highlighted features:
Cable Shielded Test – A shielded cable usually has better quality. It’s not only good for charging but also a benefit for data transferring.
==========⇊⇊⇊ New Added Function ⇊⇊⇊==========
Cable Short Circuit Test - When you plug qualMeter at Cable Test Mode, the red LED indicator will start flashing If your cable is shorted. You should stop using this cable immediately!
==========⇈⇈⇈ New Added Function ⇈⇈⇈==========
Reversible USB plug – With the reversible USB plug design, you don’t have to worried about the direction of plugging into a USB charging port. 
PLAY

Plug n Play – qualMeter comes with no switch or any control button. There is no manual operation needed to be done. It works automatically according to the status it detects.
How does QooPow™ qualMeter work?
qualMeter is designed to provide a simple and straightforward way to test cable and charger without any technical background. That means with qualMeter in hand, everyone is able to distinguish the quality of a cable or a charger.
Simply connect the cable you are willing to test into corresponding ports as following diagram.
QooPow™ qualMeter has two main testing modes, cable test and charger test. It automatically switches between two modes.
Charger Test Mode: Without cable plugged in, Charger test mode is enabled right away when qualMeter has been plugged into an USB power source. The orange charger test indicator lights up and it also confirms the testing current is 1A. You can find out the quality of this charger at 1A output by reading the Quality Indicators on the left.
PLAY

Cable Test Mode: Cable test mode will be enabled when both ends of a cable have been connected with qualMeter. Then plug qualMeter into an USB power source. The blue cable test indicator (the left one) will be turned on. You can find out the quality of this cable by reading the Quality Indicators on the left.
PLAY

Shielded Indication: At the Cable Test mode, if the blue Shielded Indicator (the right one) lights up, it means this cable is shielded.
PLAY

==========⇊⇊⇊ New Added Function ⇊⇊⇊==========
Cable Short Circuit Test - is as simple as other functions. Just plug both ends of the cable into qualMeter as usual, then plug qualMeter into any 5v USB port. The red LED indicator will start flashing If your cable is shorted. Otherwise, if the cable is not shorted, the qualMeter will automatically start the Cable Test mode to tell you how good is this cable. That’s it ! :)
PLAY

==========⇈⇈⇈ New Added Function ⇈⇈⇈==========
How to read the testing results?
Unlike regular testing devices, there are no numbers bother to read, no buttons, no extra operations, no calculations and no technical background are needed. All you need to know is just colors, the Green, Yellow and Red, which correspond to Good, Fair(OK) and Bad. That’s it! 
You see colors; you see the quality of your cable and charger.
QooPow™ qualMeter is suitable for wide range of mainstream cables and is compatible with most of major 5v USB chargers.
Specifications
Main Material：Raw PCB (CCL FR-4) Pb free
Dimension: 47.8mm x 23.8mm x 11mm (the length of the USB plug is not included)
Power Input: USB Type A reversible Male Connector
Input Voltage: 4.5~5.5v
Cable Test Connectors: USB Type A Female Connector, 4 types of mainstream charging connectors such as Micro-USB, Mini-USB and others.
Charger Test Current: @1A
LED Indicators: Green x2, Yellow x2, Red x2, Blue x2 and Orange x1  
The Rewards for qualMeter
If you are interested in getting extra USB charging cables proved by qualMeter, please visit our online shop at www.qoopow.com. Thank You!
The Stretch Goals
The CAD$50,000 stretch goal (Fulfilled!)
We have also come up an idea to develop a more advanced version qualMeter X. It provides more advanced Charger Test function by allowing 1A/1.5A/2A/2.5A/3A output testing and an Output Compensation indicator, which can cover almost all major USB chargers. If you think you’d like to support us to continue on developing the qualMeter X please help us to reach the CAD$50,000 stretch goal. 
The pledge option for qualMeter X will be available when the CAD$50,000 stretch goal has been reached.
WE'VE MADE IT! REMARKABLE! 
$50K CAD stretch goal is behind us!
Get ready to upgrade your qualMeter to qualMeter X?
Here are the list of the upgrades which will be brought to you with NEW qualMeter X :
All functions from qualMeter; 
2x USB Type-C ports are now added (which you are all asking for :)); 
Advanced Cable Test Mode, @1A/2A; 
Advanced Charger Test Mode, Full range 1~3.1A (100mA step) Current testing; 
Adjustable Electronic Load;
Output Compensation Indication; 
32-bit 48MHz MCU;
Flash memory for saving the last testing result;
Control Switch
Future Function Extension.
We have brought much more than it was expected! 
The qualMeter X is about 1/3 bigger compare to qualMeter.
And here is the way how we can upgrade your qualMeter to qualMeter X.
Here is a simple chart to tell you how to upgrade by saving you some time.
Please be aware, The upgrade price doesn't apply to the extra qualMeter. If you have pledged extra qualMeter and wanted to upgrade to X version at the same time, you could either drop it to get the Extra qualMeter X reward or jump to the X Angel's Dual Pack.
How to use qualMeter X?
Same as qualMeter, the X version is also simple to use.
When will the qualMeter X be shipped?
To be honest, we only have a rough idea for now since qualMeter X wasn't part of our development and production plan at the beginning. The development has just started. We are currently working on the first PCBA layout. The embedded programing, tooling, material and other related sourcing are very different with qualMeter.
General speaking it will be at least 2 months later after qualMeter has been shipped. However, we are going to try our best to make it happen as fast as we can without compromising the quality. We should have a clear idea on the delivery time for qualMeter X by May.
The CAD$80,000 stretch goal
As you know qualMeter came from lab usage, it might not look pretty for now. We decided not to put a plastic shell for it to lower down the total cost since the industrial design and plastic molding are expensive. However, we have made efforts to make sure it's durable and safe to use. We do think the style of current looking is raw and tech-ish, kind of nice. :) 
If you think you'd like to have a plastic shelled version of QooPow™ qualMeter please help us to reach the CAD$80,000 stretch goal. Then we will be able to hire an industrial design team and to make moldings. 
If you have other ideas, we'd really love to hearing from you!
Where are we at in development?
qualMeter Prototypes, PCBs and some Development Tools
At the current point, we have the latest PCB version on hand. Intensive testing is coming to the end, and we are ready to turn it into mass production version. The outline is pretty much firmed though there might be a few slight adjustments to be done on PCB. We are approaching the moment when the capable manufacturer should be involved. We are working with our partners in manufacturing and supply chain and will continue push forward while Kickstarter campaign is going on.
The latest qualMeter prototype is ready for mass production.
The Schedule
Who are we?
Intelliplus is a creative tech start-up formed in 2013, who is focusing on Smart-Ware development. Our vision is to Make Life Easier & Simpler. Currently our main development team is based in Chengdu, China. Chengdu is one of the biggest cities in western china. With her over 2,500 years of historical and humanistic culture, Chengdu is also well known as the cradle of China IT industry. And our manufacturing partners are mainly located in Shenzhen, China, where is the world's IT manufacturing center.
We have been contracting and working with one of the top Internet Companies in China and helping them to build fast charging products under their own brand since 2014. By going deeper and gaining more knowledge on the fast charging technologies, we think it’s time to launch our own smart charging products and brand - The QooPow™ series.
On our mind, charging is one of the things that should be peaceful and joyful like art. It should be a part of our quality life. Despite there are plenty of charging related products in the market, few of them can stand out. In fact, there are too many low quality and compromised products.People deserve better charging products!
We believe we can do better! And here we go.
By launching the QooPow™ qualMeter with the excitement, we are proud that we have made it and will continue to do so. Other QooPow™ series smart charging products are in the line of development, more to come.
The Core Team
What you can help us? 
Our efforts over the past two years on smart and fast charging technologies have helped to bring qualMeter onto Kickstarter stage where you are connected to participate. A journey we have started to Make Life Easier and Simpler, and to free our mind to make our world a better place! 
qualMeter is our ice breaker to the world. And now, we are heading to mass production and turn our idea into real products! 
Thank you! Kickstarters, Backers and Viewers, with your help and support we can: 
Purchase all materials for production;
Apply for Apple MFi certification and other necessary certifications;
Get into production (Sourcing, Tooling, Testing, Assembling, Packaging etc.); 
Build up global Distribution; 
Setup customer service team;
Continue to develop, to optimize and to upgrade products;
Others
Big thank you & Stay in touch!
Big thank you to everyone who stops by here. Our team is fully committed to support not only our backers but all our community.
You can register on our QooPow™ Smart & Fast Charging forum and subscribe to our Newsletter in receiving the rewards, exclusive offer for Angels, specials, discounts and latest news updates and in answering all the issues and concerns in time!
Below are more ways to stay connected with us. Please join us and be part of our happy journey!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mass Production: 
Production is jumping on the stage at the moment as we are rolling the schedule down towards fruition. We have fully understanding that production plays big role in the project and also we are also aware that there might always be some unforeseen troubles in the way to mass production. We will further leverage our resources and try all the angles to ensure our expectations are met. Our manufacturing partners we’ve been working with are the tops in the industry with decades of experiences. We have locked down high quality and schedule with agreement to ensure the orders are fulfilled as promised. 

Product updates:
As all our community know that all the pictures showing above are not final version. The product details may be slightly different over the manufacturing process. Optimization is what it takes and more to lock off highest quality possible. The updates will be regularly sent out to our community.

Delivery:
Since all the manufacturing will be done in China, the rewards will be sent from China as well. We are aware that there may be issues that are unexpected when it comes to international shipping. Our solution is to set up second backup in logistics to avoid delivery failure. This way the shipping risk will be truly minimized. The issues such as on route delay and other unexpected things may happen that we are willing to do our best to avoid and to help solving them if it happened. However, we are not able to take the responsibility on the import duties you may be charged by the custom.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Cowtech Ciclop: The first 3D laser scanner under $100. 
The 3D printing revolution has come, and it’s time for 3D scanning to follow. The CowTech Ciclop is a RepRap 3D scanner with a large scan volume, simple, yet elegant design, and a disruptive price point that blows any other laser scanner out of the water. The user prints the plastic parts on their own printer in any color and resolution they choose, and can assemble the scanner in less than 30 minutes. Then, simply take any object you want to replicate, set it on the 200mm laser cut acrylic turntable, and start scanning. We wanted to make sure our product was usable for anyone who owns a 3D printer, so we meticulously designed  our parts for a print bed volume of only 115mm x 110mm x 65mm (4.5 x 4.3 x 2.6in) so they can be produced on even the smallest of printers. 
Laser scanners are a very common type of 3D scanner that use a pair of line lasers that flash in succession in combination with a camera and a rotating turntable. As the lines flash on the object, they trace the outline of the object in red light. The camera then picks up the location of the laser lines in 3D space, converting those lines into hundreds of thousands of points, and as the turntable rotates, every side of the object is scanned into a cloud of points, which can then be stitched together to form a mesh that replicates the surface of the object with up to 0.5mm precision. 
3D printed model, scanned on the CT Ciclop. Print resolution 0.2mm, PLA, on a Prusa i3 (Horizonal banding due to poor printer quality)
Overhead view. 0.2mm, PLA, Prusa i3.
The CT Ciclop retains a high degree of precision, even after printing on our entry level 3D printer.
.stl File ready to print in Cura alongside the cross-section of the 3D mesh in CloudCompare
Our scanner was born out of the BQ Ciclop, an open source scanner using the same design and software as our scanner. We kept all the same basic functionality as the original BQ, but redesigned the scanner from the ground up, making several significant changes and adding many features.
First, we were able to slash prices by designing our own Arduino shield, using a more logical turntable bearing, purchasing our own laser cutter for the acrylic parts, and importing many of our components from reputable manufacturers overseas. We designed our printed parts to use significantly less filament and half the print time of the BQ version. Furthermore, we decreased the minimum bed size of the printer needed to print the parts to a measly 115mm(L) x 110mm(W) x 65mm(H) (4.5in x 4.3in x 2.6in), from a 6x9x3 required on the original. We focused a great deal of energy on aesthetic improvement as well, replacing the ugly and unwieldy threaded rod with sleek laser cut acrylic, adding a magnetic back cover to access the electronics, and an internal LED glow to make the scanner stand out in any environment.
The CT Ciclop scanner is a fully open source Rep Rap project, and all details will be released after the campaign is concluded. 
The term 3D scanner is a bit of a misnomer. Technically, most 3D scanners are actually point cloud generators. The scanner itself is a tool to make a .PLY file, or a point cloud, made up of hundreds of thousands of points that represent the geometry of the object. The typical user will want to convert this point cloud to an .STL file, which can easily be printed on a 3D printer. Once you have a digital 3D file of the part, the possibilities are endless. The CowTech Ciclop uses Horus, software developed by BQ for their version of the scanner. Unfortunately, Horus doesn't support .STL exports at this time, but this feature may be developed in later versions of the program. Fortunately, there are many options for post processing programs that can stitch the point clouds together into a printable file. These include Meshlab, Cloudcompare, Netfabb, Blender, and more. We recommend Meshlab and Cloudcompare, and will provide detailed documentation with the scanner on how to use these programs. 
Limitations
All laser scanners can struggle with objects that are very black, very shiny, or furry, as the laser doesn't register properly with the camera. The CowTech Ciclop, like the BQ version, is designed for experienced users who can familiarize themselves with different software programs in order to use the scanner and get high quality outputs from it. 
We like to think of a 3D scanner like a video camera. A nice camera gives you the tools to take great pictures and videos, but without post production work in a video editing or photo editing program, you will likely be disappointed in the end result. 
You want a scanner? We can make that happen. We also want to offer plenty of other ways to support our project in lots of different price ranges. (Descriptions of Rewards also available on the sidebar on the right side of the screen.)
$1-Thanks for the support! Pledge a dollar to stay connected with the campaign and receive updates down the line. 
 $10-Receive a custom laser engraved keychain or pet tag with the CT logo on one side and your name or pet’s name on the other. 
$20-Receive a premium cotton poly blend Cowtech T-shirt to show support for your favorite 3D scanner! 
$20-Receive the CT Arduino shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, and right angle USB cable to build your own scanner from scratch in the Cowtech or BQ designs, or make your own scanner totally from your own design. 
 $79-LIMITED TO 20 UNITS-The Earlybird special CowTech 3D scanner kit. Everything in the standard kit, but $20 off for the early adopters! Kit includes everything seen below, including NEMA 17 stepper motor, 2x Class 1 red line lasers, Logitech C270 Webcam, CT Arduino Shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, Right Angle USB cord, 1.5A power supply, laser cut acrylic parts, 6008Z steel bearing, adhesive scan table cover, calibration square, and LED strip. Does not include 3D printed plastic parts. Once parts are printed, assembly should take less than 30 minutes.
Parts included with all scanner rewards
$99-Standard CowTech 3D scanner kit. Kit includes everything seen above, including NEMA 17 stepper motor, 2x Class 1 red line lasers, Logitech C270 Webcam, CT Arduino Shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, Right Angle USB cord, 1.5A power supply, laser cut acrylic parts, 6008Z steel bearing, adhesive scan table cover, calibration square, and LED strip. Does not include 3D printed plastic parts. Once parts are printed, assembly should take less than 30 minutes. 
 $119- Customized CowTech 3D scanner kit. Get text, your company logo, or anything you want engraved on the scanner. Kit includes everything seen above, including NEMA 17 stepper motor, 2x Class 1 red line lasers, Logitech C270 Webcam, CT Arduino Shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, Right Angle USB cord, 1.5A power supply, laser cut acrylic parts, 6008Z steel bearing, adhesive scan table cover, calibration square, and LED strip. Does not include 3D printed plastic parts. Once parts are printed, assembly should take less than 30 minutes. 
 $149- Complete CowTech 3D scanner kit. Get the 3D printed parts included so you can get right to scanning. Kit includes everything seen above, including NEMA 17 stepper motor, 2x Class 1 red line lasers, Logitech C270 Webcam, CT Arduino Shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, Right Angle USB cord, 1.5A power supply, laser cut acrylic parts, 6008Z steel bearing, adhesive scan table cover, calibration square, and LED strip. Assembly should take less than 30 minutes.
$179- Double CowTech 3D scanner kit. Includes 2 of everything seen above, including NEMA 17 stepper motor, 2x Class 1 red line lasers, Logitech C270 Webcam, CT Arduino Shield, Uno R3 development board, A4988 stepper motor driver, Right Angle USB cord, 1.5A power supply, laser cut acrylic parts, 6008Z steel bearing, adhesive scan table cover, calibration square, and LED strip. Does not include 3D printed plastic parts. Once parts are printed, assembly should take less than 30 minutes. 
Want a combination that isn’t listed here? No problem, just shoot us a message or email and we can get you just about anything you want. To add any of the other rewards to a scanner pledge, simply add the amount of the smaller reward to your pledge and we will ship them with you scanner for free: 
Because the scanners will be shipped as kits, large scale production and assembly difficulties are avoided entirely. We will marshal the components from various manufacturers at our shipping facility, then package and mail all orders from there once all the parts arrive.
We grew up together in a small town community, and were 2 members of a 5 person high school graduating class. While we took different paths in college, life led us both back home to our respective family farms, and we formed a logical partnership, designing products together in the winter time when the farming workload is significantly reduced. We have both been designing logical products for use in farming and ranching our entire lives, and while 3D scanning was a new field for both of us, design and fabrication is certainly not.
Jason Smith received a BA in engineering from Harvard in the spring of 2015. His first foray into entrepreneurship and Kickstarter came when he invented a music responsive LED light show with his roommate in an introductory electrical engineering class. After a summer internship with Salt Lake City based company Power Practical, which has launched 5 successful Kickstarter campaigns totaling over $1.1M, he launched Rayger with his roommate ( www.raygerlights.com), bringing in nearly $25,000, earning a Kickstarter Staff Pick (now "Project We Love"), and delivering over 90% of the rewards 2 months ahead of schedule. When he isn’t working on product development, he takes care of 500 black angus cows on his family ranch. His long term goal is to grow CowTech into a company that produces innovative agricultural products. 
Weston Downs was raised in small town Montana working on a family owned and operated farm. He received an associates degree in aviation from Montana State University, earning his private pilots license and an instrument rating. He has developed many innovative ideas such as a Hydrogen heater with an onboard hydrogen generator and a hydrogen injection system for mileage and power improvements on automobiles. When not working on CowTech, he is busy on the farm raising wheat, malt barley, peas, and safflower.   
Find us now and after the campaign at CowTechEngineering.com
 This project will be released under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International License. (CC BY-SA 4.0).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any campaign or new product there are a host of challenges. With one campaign under our belt, we know this all too well. However, the experience of a previous campaign has taught us a lot about many of the issues. By building several working prototypes using sample parts from the same manufacturers we will order our production run from, we are confident in the quality of our components as well as the speed and reliability of our manufacturers. We have even used several of the manufacturers before to provide components for our first campaign.
 
The most likely issue we foresee is a delay in shipment. This is an issue that plagues many Kickstarter campaigns, and can be challenging to avoid if even just a few small things go wrong. We have tried to mitigate this issue by doing most of the legwork of part sourcing ahead of time, and listing a realistic delivery date on the rewards rather than an optimistic one. In Jason’s first Kickstarter campaign, all but one reward tier was delivered over 6 weeks ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: For any of you who might have chickens or other birds in your backyard, we wanted to introduce The Hatch automatic chicken door by CowTech!

Hey Everybody, 
We're switching gears a little bit here into a new type of product. We are making the classic, boring light switch cover interesting again! They make great gifts, and the custom option lets you design your own to make your home totally unique. 
We would love it if you could support or share our campaign!

Wow.....well its hard to believe and we are a few months late but fulfillment is finally over. We shipped out the last of the orders a couple of weeks ago and the odds and ends seem to have trickled off enough. There are still a few people who haven't filled out their survey, and a few people surely still have some outstanding delivery issues, but please contact us if you haven't gotten your reward and we will get it taken care of. 
We have put together a tiny survey that will just take a minute to fill out, and we would really, really appreciate it if you gave us a tiny bit of your time to do it. We will pick one of the responses at random to win a Rayger Lightshow or $100 credit to our site, and they will help us to improve our next campaign, product, and overall service.

Good news! All tiers and rewards have shipped except the custom engraved tier. With RTS kits finished up, they are the next tier to complete. NOTE: Wire clips have been removed from the design and are no longer included with the kits. There have been a number of concerns that kits without wire clips are incomplete. Simply thread the wires through the holes in the bottom T. 
If you are in any tier except for the $119 custom engraving tier, and you haven't received a shipping notification or your reward, please send an email to info@cowtechengineering.com and we will look into it. Emailing is much better than Kickstarter or Facebook messages.

Hey everyone. As you are wearing of waiting for your scanner, we are getting weary as well of the production dragging on and are anxious to complete it so we can move on to the laundry list of fun projects we have been tabling since last November. The bright side is the light is clearly visible at the end of the tunnel. About 70 RTS kits have shipped, and we think nearly all the orange scanners are complete. Way more parts are ready to go, and the Hatchbox filament for the last 150 scanners just arrived. Printers are simply whirring on the new printer shelf, which has been an incredible space saver.

Hey All, 
Just wanted to update that the CowTech Scan Guide documentation version 1.1 has been released on our site. We added about 6 pages detailing the most common issues people are having and how to fix them, based on the feedback we have received so far. 
We have redesigned the bottom Ts for more structural stability and eliminated the wire clips from the design, so all scanners shipping from now on out shouldn't have bottom T breakage issues. The wires thread through slots cut in the beam itself.

Hey Everyone, 
We want to update everyone on the status of the RTS kits, among other things like the UPS charges.
First and foremost, we have decided to end our relationship with MakerGeeks as a filament supplier. The past few weeks have been absolute misery on our end attempting to get printers running. Even going back to the past month, we kept having jammed extruders, on about every other bed. It made printing impossible, and while we focused on shipping, we didn't have time to go in depth and solve what we though were our own printing issues.

Hey Guys, 
Great to see all the scanners in the FB group and the great discussions going on in the Google Group. We have learned lots of things from the first shipment, primarily our wire clip design sucks. Not only did we forget to send a bunch of them, a number of people have reported breaking both the clips and the bottom t upon insert. 
We scratched our heads for a while about how this could have happened, as we tested lots of clips here. They were a tight fit, but we never broke anything. Finally we realized that the clips were the only part where we relied on the dimensional thickness of the acrylic in our design. Acrylic sheeting be +/- 0.4mm in its thickness, and we neglected to account for that dimensional tolerance. It's an engineering mistake and its on us.

Hey everyone, 
All the domestic standard scanners have been shipped and most delivered and the international ones are set to leave soon. About 200 of them are boxed and labeled ready to go including all the Canadian ones. Please check your address in the verification email when you get it. We can't verify international addresses, so the package will ship to wherever you typed in the survey, even if it is invalid. The boxes should be picked up tomorrow so we can pull them off the shipping queue and fix them if you find an issue.

We are finally getting lots of boxes out! All of the earlybirds have shipped and 300 domestic standard kits have sent out as well. The earlybirds didn't get email confirmations, so don't fret if you haven't gotten an email. Some of the rest of you probably got 2 emails, the tracking number on one of them should be voided. We made a mistake on some of the initial labels and had to reprint them. If your shipping address is incorrect on the email, please let us know ASAP so we can pull it from the shipping stream and adjust it.

campaign.story:
For business inquiries please contact us HERE.
Holapex.com is forwarding to this campaign.
For business
The Holapex Hologram Pyramids are the highest quality pyramids ever made. All materials are high and durable quality. After testing and prototyping for over 1200 hours, We have developed the most durable and improved Holographic Pyramid, into a product, not just an office toy.
 Holapex pyramids work great with Tablets and Smartphones, as well as IPads and IPhones. The quality of the reflection (hologram) is one of the bes,t as the clear panels are made out of the thinnest possible plastic, yet can hold up to 5lb of pressure when fully assembled.
Holapex LIGHT: This hologram pyramid measures 4 inches wide, and 2 inches tall. The Holapex LIGHT was designed to fit most smartphone/IPhone screen sizes 4"-6" inches.When assembled it can take up to 3lbs of pressure.
Holapex VIVID: The Holapex VIVID was designed to work with tablet/IPads 7"-12" inch displays. It measures about 6 inches wide and 3 inches tall. When assembled it can take up to 5lbs of pressure.
Parts: Both Holapex Pyramids come as parts and can easily be assembles. Each pyramid comes with the following parts:
1 X Matte Black Hat/Cover with model of Pyramid printed in white (VIVID or LIGHT)
4 X Clear reflectors made out of PET Flexible plastic.
1 X Matte Black Base/Feet made out of Acrylic.
After producing many prototypes, with different materials, angles, sizes, and colors, we improved every part of the pyramid, provided best angle for best reflection, best color for pyramid, and best materials for each part.
The clear panels come with a protective plastic on each side, to protect it from any scratches when shipped. The material used for these panels is a PET Plastic material that is flexible and will not break. The panels are made out of the thinner possible PET plastic to give the best hologram effect with the least to none double blurr reflection.   Each panel comes with male or female connectors, that allow you to easily assemble all 4 sides into the shape of the pyramid. Then easily place the hat over the top of the pyramid and the base on the lower area. Keep in mind, the hat and the base are just optional, and are not needed to use the Hologram properly.
How does the Hologram Pyramid work?
The pyramid reflects whatever is being displayed on your device, giving it a hologram effect. It's simple technology, but here is a picture to better illustrate how it works.
Can you use any picture or video with the Holapex Pyramids?
Yes! Although there are hundreds of videos on youtube that you can use with your Holapex pyramid, we decided to make an app for Android and IOS devices!
The app is called "Holapex" and is ready for download and use! The app allows you to select any videos or pictures from your gallery, and automatically converts it into a 4 sided video or picture, that you can use with your Holapex pyramids! There are also a few videos loaded into the app that you can use, with the pyramid.
 Easily convert your video and images into a 4 sides graphic to display on each side of the pyramid! Choose and convert! Simple!
Now all needed for this to come to life is your support! Please share this project with friends and family and spread the word to reach the minimum for manufacturing!
Featured on :  http://kickingitforward.org

campaign.story:
Please email me directly if you'd like to discuss ways I can improve franchino@problemspaces.com
The Boy & the Computer has brought together top artists from all over the world.
The Boy and the Computer is the first graphic novel of its kind and offers a unique educational opportunity for anyone that wants to learn about and play with innovative technology. It incorporates existing tech, offering them a way into the Internet of Things. Using QR codes, Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and hands-on tutorials, readers learn with the characters as they vividly experience real hacker culture.
What you are buying as a backer!
We are creating a graphic novel, a soft and hard cover book filled with comic book style pages. We think that graphic novels are a highly under-appreciated and lesser known medium for teaching. Our first volume will contain over 150 pages of action packed adventure, learning, hacks and interactive content. 

Stretch Goal Swag - Let’s hit it! 
$15k   3 stickers and 5 promo cards for all backers! 
$20k   Character decals for all backers at or above $19 – Kickstarter Exclusive! 
How this all got started...
Francesco Pinto (aka Franchino) started Gamifyed in 2013 as he tried to teach his three children computer science (2nd, 3rd and 4th grade). Now, he's making it his mission to help other parents inspire their kids to get more involved. He says the number one issue is that we don't provide kids with enough context around why they should learn computer science.
 “It was impossible. I simply could not get the buy-in amongst my kids. They refused to willingly spend time on it no matter how much I incentivized it. It was too intangible for them.”
Author and creator, Franchino is the a real world computer programmer and designer

Eventually he discovered the reasons why they were reluctant:
It felt like more school work to them. It wasn’t as cool to them as it was to their father
The digital natives were more interested in playing traditional video games and sports
His kids had no context of why they should spend time studying computer science. The benefits and opportunity were not clear to them
A programmer, HCI designer and user researcher by trade, Franchino quickly saw the opportunity in this crisis. He began asking other parents what their views were on the matter and found that most parents had similar goals and frustrations, with no solution at hand.
“These kids were practically born with iPhones and tablets in their hands. They don’t care about how they are made, programmed or what impact the underlying technology can have on their future. They take technology for granted.”
Franchino's three children are digital natives
Franchino isn’t just talking about learning to code apps either. He’s talking about ECE, an emerging field that bundles electrical engineering, computer sciences, the internet of things and more.
“Today you can put your skin cells on a chip and analyze them with a Pi. You can remote control a live beetle with diodes and some code. There will be 50 billion IoT objects online by 2020. Even your soccer ball will soon have a MEMS chip and a tiny wifi module that can tell your phone how much force or spin you kicked the ball with. I wan to start educating kids early on about the future of ECE by way of story telling.”
Last year, Franchino quit his job and developed this graphic novel so he could share his experience and ignite students’ passions for designing and building their own projects. “I began authoring parts of a graphic novel illustrating the life of a young hacker using the likeness of my oldest son, Frankie Jr. I like to think I combined lots of action with real world hacks and technology. Every chip, hardware part, code snippet and brand in the book is real, nothing is masked.”
Franchino found success in doing this and his kids are now eager to learn on their own and are fascinated with hacking and hardware. “I’ve given the materials to other parents and the results are in, this definitely could work.”
Franchino and John Richard have been working on The Boy & the Computer since April 2015
 Much progress has already been made!
The first draft of the graphic novel was tested amongst a controlled group of 15 students in August of 2015
Opening scene of the main character, Gou, as he sets his on the Raspberry Pi for the first time.

World leaders express their views on why kids should get started earlier.
PLAY

Franchino explains some of the philosophy behind why he started his company
Franchino uses inspiration from his personal career to illuminate the politics in the tech and startup industry.
Many of the characters are real people Franchino has worked with. Practically every cast member will teach you about computer science.
Franchino has even used his own children as models that represent typical American household behaviors.
Unlike other tech inspired comic books and graphic novels, The Boy and the Computer does not mask brands or concepts with fake alternatives

Earlier character sheets profiling real world industry professionals, hackers, designers and prodigies to understand their reactions, expressions and thought process. All of these people will come together to teach the reader important lessons, give clues and help the reader memorize important concepts which could make the difference in real life.

Here are some early examples of our sketches:
Here is Gou, the main character. You can get a sense for his intellectual capacity by the faces he makes and his reactions to people and his environment.
Here is Gou's father who's been discouraged from the technology industry by local entrepreneurial, disparaging zealots Chad and Deric
Tara is Gou's crush although older and extremely mischevious, she is one of the only characters who is not a hacker or technology industry type
Dr. Winslow is one of Gou's many advisors. Gou meets with Dr. Winslow at the University of Chicago to be inspired
Ladybug is an MIT hardware hacker who plays hard to get with Gou and is reluctant to help him for a variety of reasons.
The Rabbi in many cases, helps Gou understand the gravity of many situations and uses analogies from the Torah to guide Gou
Nōn, Gou's brother is an athlete. Each cast member supports Gou in a unique way.
 TSHIRTS!!!!!
The Node, a small computer that Gou builds along with the reader, is called the Node.
What's a function?
Hardware hacker
Our timeline is simple, we don't want to overcomplicate it. We will send our final edited version to print ninja in April 1st (our 1 year anniversary). The copies will arrive by sea a month later and begin shipping May 15th. Our supply chain and distribution facility is in place, we simply need demand. 
Great conversation starter!

campaign.story:
Perfect for:
Home automation, security and HVAC
Robotics & Machine control
3-D printing & Industrial automation
Education
PLAY

Arduinos are great boards, but they need stacks of shields & wires, and they're not very durable.  
Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) are complete and durable, but they're expensive and hard to program.  
It's time our friend Arduino got tougher and smarter than a PLC!
Eliminate the wires. Create something safe and reliable. Get Ardunio ease-of-use, running on real US industrial quality hardware.  Build your project on a reliable and durable platform.
Easy- to use. Complete. Reliable. Priced right.
Have I seen something similar before?
A few of us backed "Controllino".  It hasn't arrived. Meanwhile, we listened... Backers want:
More Power ...than just an Espressif chip
Expanded Memory  ...like 128Mb + 4GB  instead of 8Mb
Easier Programming ...stable Arudino
"How about a decent LCD?"
US design / build / QC
Honest delivery at a fair price
You led us to this second generation, three-processor design. Have a look at the schematics here.  Peek under the cover here.
The Mega 2560 gives you ease of use and stability. Opto-isolation and durable power relays give you industrial strength. There's a micro SD slot for files, an extra EEPROM and enough rugged digital and analog I/O for almost any app. A color touchscreen and speaker give you a nice user interface. We've included a real-time clock and plenty of other bells and whistles... 
Design and testing are complete. We're ready to build. The campaign is "damn fast".  We invite your pledge to defray component costs.  You'll get a high quality product on time. 
Ships "Damn fast" !
Look for us here!
Our last two KS projects shipped in just a few days...
Our backers say...
Guys, I got my 10 relays very quickly! Thanks so much!
Fastest ever fulfillment by a kickstarter! Mine are here - I put them on my test rig and they pass all the UL requirements with flying colors.
I used mine as a WiFi remote controller.  So there was NO programming needed...  Nice work.
Mine arrived today. Looks very nice. I opened one up and the build quality seems quite good.
Three days??? Damn fast. You guys are serious.
I got mine yesterday and tested it! Works flawlessly!!! 
Thanks for a super fast campaign 
This is best Kickstarter ever. There is no Kickstarter can do as you guy did. Few project that I have been pledge said will shipping right after project end all fail until now haha still nothing.
Hardware Features:
AT Mega 2560 + 16U2 + ESP8266 + Expanded flash & EEPROM
External 2.4GHz WiFi antenna with RP-SMA connector
Six high-power relays, DPST, safety fused
Eight digital outputs with open collector drivers
Eight opto-isolated digital inputs 3-24V AC/DC
Eight 10-bit ADC input channels
USB connection for Arduino compatibility
Powered from 12-24VDC
Clock calendar with battery backup for scheduling
RS-232 for long distance wired communication
Expanded 128Mb FLASH for WiFi / Lua program storage
4GB SD card free to KS backers (expandable, great for logging)
2.4" 320x240 Color LCD touch screen
Speaker with audio amp
DIN Enclosure for easy rail or panel mount
Keep goin' we'll add more!
Best of all.. It's easy to use!
Build something cool.  Have fun with it!
-Team IoT

campaign.story:
(Videos mentioned can be found at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLHzpGJMi9PUjhG5-4zpIfA)
"We didn't make the computer to solve computer problems. We made the computer to solve Human problems."
AOS is a Virtual Operating System that operates within Microsoft Windows. It allows Users that have no knowledge of any Software languages or methods to create sophisticated and complex Programs in a fraction of the time of contemporary methods using only their High School knowledge and problem-solving skills.
It took 5 years to find the answer to the long-standing question: "How do you bring the power of software creation to all educated persons?" and then 5 years to write the Software "Code" with contemporary methods and tools.
AOS creates a code-less Environment for the User that is based solely on the academics of Information usage that we all learned by the time we left High School. It is based on the foundation of Humankind's knowledge - Algebra, Mathematics and Informational Solutions but extends beyond just numbers as do all Software Development Tools to work on Text, Time, Logic, Pictures, Audios, and Videos (the 7 Universal Data Types).
AOS creates a bubble around the User/Programmer. Outside of the bubble are horribly complex constructs like the TCPIP Protocol which requires a 3 Volume Set of books to describe how to move Information around the planet. Inside the bubble is the User/Programmer, their Informational need (which never has anything to do with the box), their High School knowledge, and a clear idea of how to work their problem through Mathematics and Grammar.
The bubble around the public should have been the first thing accomplished by the original creators of software technology at Bell Laboratories back in the late 70's. The hardware technology could then change anyway it needed without affecting the interface to the public. But it never happened - until now.
The toolkit we use to figure out anything Informational (it's all informational) is really, really tiny but powerful beyond words in how we put that simple set together in complex ways.
AOS is in essence all of the fundamental Information manipulating capabilities that software professional have sitting down to the most prominent tool for making Windows programs. Therefore, there is no piece of Information you cannot work with and no Answer you cannot produce if it's pure Information you are after (vs entertainment or something related to the operation of the computer).
The System at present is in Alpha stage. This means that all of the System Design has been verified and exists in a rough but very usable form. AOS Alpha (and Beta) will be Free for exploration by the general public on the Sentience Inc website. AOS Alpha is available now and Licensed until April 1. Enjoy the temporary ability to select any of the Types of AOS Machines because Licenses are for a specific Type of machine. A CentralLibrary is a system's security core. A BranchLibrary extends the security outward allowing ClientComputers to connect to different branches in TheTree.
Sentience Inc does not support the policy of charging more to businesses just because they have deeper pockets. We do not support the policy of disguising updates as Versions to get more revenue.
AOS is Licensed to the public for $5/mo per license regardless of business or individual to be affordable to all persons who need assistance with their Informational life. A free version will always be available to the public so that Programs made in AOS can be used by anyone. Customers can license their creations if they so desire because AOS was designed to support User Licensing. This opens the door for the truly great problem-solvers out there to make money with their intellectual abilities.
For security, all AOS Licenses are renewed every month. The software makes this transparent to the customer if they so desire without financial info being retained otherwise AOS is renewable with a button click each month. The software monitors the renewal process and completes it.
Sentience Inc needs a small staff of Software Engineers to cleanup and support AOS to bring it to the Licensing stage. AOS will then be ready to assist any organization on a global scale. Mobile usage is incredibly important now with the way most people stay connected. The Applications we make in Windows Desktop need to be usable on Android, iOS, and Windows Phone to be truly available to us as the creators and users.
A minimum of 3 full time Software Professionals and an office for them to work in for the next year will cover the cleanup of AOS, Licensing startup, and entry into the mobile computing environment.
The future of AOS with your gracious help and support:
adopt Linux, own it, improve it, then marry it with AOS and be the only OS on the machine: ALUX (AOS on Linux)  for $5/mo
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest difficulty to producing a powerful and useful software product is not in whether or not you can solve the problem but rather how well will it operate in its environment.

AOS handles everything computer to support the Programmer and therefore represents a significant time-based overhead. Performance therefore is job 1 and will remain that way. We need to be able to operate 10,000 Node Programs with imperceptible lag.

The situation gets even worse when you don't have the horsepower of a desktop so getting AOS to run our Programs smoothly with limited processing power on mobile phones may be a challenge. We won't know until we examine those OS's and their efficiency levels.

Suffice it to say that 1) being mobile is not an option and 2) we will find the answers we need to go mobile.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is JaguarBoard?
It is a single-board computer similar to Raspberry Pi. The difference is that it is based on x86 architecture.
Why x86 architecture is a big deal?
Being based on the x86 architecture brings JaguarBoard better performance, with high level of scalability and compatibility. It allows developers and DIYers who are experienced with x86 architecture to enjoy the single board software development without having to learn about embedded systems such as ARM.

You are the geeks. You are the DIYers. You are the developers. Armed with the range of development toolkits available for the x86 architecture and emboldened by the processing prowess of JaguarBoard, you are only limited by your imagination. Here are just a few examples:

campaign.story:
The EspLight:
LED strips need to be controlled by WiFi, but they aren´t. So I have designed the EspLight.
I have made a prototype. It´s a working PCB but it need some tweaks. Also, there is no firmware yet.
Because It´s open source, (firmware and hardware) you can write your own software.
I need your pledge to build at least these things:
The PCB:
Support for 5 and 12V LED strips. Because LED strips are not limited to one voltage and current, A power supply is not included.
Support for almost all LED strips currently available. For example, but not limited to: WS2811, WS2812, Neopixel, WS2801 and RGB.
A button to turn the EspLight into Access Point mode, so you can connect your phone or laptop with it and you can set up you local wifi router with a webinterface.
A programming mode button.
A reset button.
A Windows/Linux program to easy install/upgrade the EspLight.
An Android app with at the very least:
Fade color button for a cool fading effect.
"Rainbow" mode for digital LED strips.
Dim option.
Full on.
A color "wheel", for this I forked this project: http://trevorshp.com/creations/android_led.htm :

A laser cut case:
Made from plywood.
Easy to assemble.

The prototype:
To power up the EspLight and LED strip, you´ll connect a power supply from 5 to 12V (depends on your LED strip) to the DC-Jack or screw terminal.
There is a connector on it for a RGB LED strip and a ws2801 LED strip. There is also a RGB screw terminal output on it, if you want to control bigger currents.
pcb

campaign.story:
Twitter: @deep_fried_code
~~ A book to answer your questions about advanced Rust ~~
Rust is a new systems programming language with guaranteed memory safety designed to replace C/C++ but with high-level abstractions to please those coming from Java and C#.
While the rust-lang.org website is a good place to start learning the language, the official documentation leaves you wanting to thoroughly understand the essential concepts of the language like traits, borrowing, lifetimes and more.
This book will explain the difficult concepts of Rust in practical terms using code examples.
Currently this information is spread out across many different websites and documents. Compounding the problem, many sites refer to older versions of Rust that used different syntax. Instead of wasting time trying to find the information you need in the current syntax wouldn't it be better to have a single source of information on Rust? 
Rust is a melting pot for ideas from diverse languages:
Traits: Very similar to typeclasses in Haskell
Stack and Heap memory allocation: From the land of C/C++
Pattern Matching: Common in functional programming languages
Iterators: Mundane in Object Oriented Programming
Algebraic Datatypes: A powerful feature from functional programming
Channels: A dataflow concept that originated in Communicating Sequential Processes by Tony Hoare
Additionally, these topics are unique to Rust:
Dynamically Sized Types (DST)
Trait Objects
Object Safety
Closure/Function Traits
Multiple Pointer Types (Box, Rc, Arc, Cell...)
Depending on your background you may have experience with some of these concepts but to be proficient with Rust you need to understand all of them. The official documentation does not explain all of these concepts in detail.
Proposed Contents
This book investigates topics that are only briefly introduced in the official documentation
The following is a preliminary list of topics I feel are important to understand but are not explained in detail in any single source of information. The basics of the language can be learned from the rust-lang.org site so this information will assume you have read the official documentation but want more.
These topics will be covered in detail using code examples and just enough theory so you thoroughly understand them.
Traits and Multidispatch
Dynamically Sized Types (DST)
Trait Objects
Object Safety
Associated Types
Algebraic Datatypes ('struct' and 'enum' types)
Ownership, Borrowing and Lifetimes
Higher-Ranked Lifetimes
Pattern Matching ('match' keyword)
Stack/Heap Memory
Pointers
Unboxed Closures and Function Traits
Backers will have access to draft chapters.
Target Audience
This book is intended for those who already have experience in at least one programming language and have read through the documentation on the Rust website.
Depending on your experience, some topics may cover information you already know or be completely new to you.
Your background can be in C/C++ or Java/C# or Python/Javascript or Haskell/Scala... it doesn't matter as long as you already understand how to program.
Why Am I the Right Person to Write this Book?
Many of the features found in Rust are also found in other programming languages that I have already learned.
My desire to learn new things has pushed me into languages such as Haskell, ML, Lisp, Eiffel, Mozart, Prolog, Java, C, C#, Lua, Python, PHP and now Rust. I understand various programming paradigms like OOP, dataflow, reactive, functional and logic. Using knowledge from all of these areas I will be able to explain how these concepts relate to Rust so you too will understand them.
Previous Publishing Experience
In October of 2013, I ran a successful Kickstarter project for a book called "Dataflow and Reactive Programming Systems". It was delivered on time in April of 2014.
Since then I have been selling the book on Amazon, LeanPub and my own website (deepFriedCode.com).
Recently some readers commented on Hacker News...
Matt Carkci's book discusses the different closely related topics of data flow, flow based programming and reactive programming, very clearly and in quite some detail ... Can highly recommend.
- samuell
...seriously it's a good book, if you have interest in the topic it's worth reading.
- tbirdz
Backing Levels
For all backing levels that receive ebooks, we will email you a link to download the book(s) from the deepFriedCode.com website.
RUST EBOOK: $15
PDF, ePub and MOBI versions of "Rust Programming Concepts"
DRM free
Upon completion of the book we will email you a download link
DATAFLOW & RUST EBOOKS: $20
"Rust Programming Concepts" and "Dataflow and Reactive Programming Systems"
PDF, ePub and MOBI versions of both books
DRM free
Upon completion of funding, we will email you a link to download "Dataflow and Reactive Programming Systems"
Upon completion of "Rust Programming Concepts" we will email you another link to download the book
RUST PAPERBACK: $35
"Rust Programming Concepts"
Paperback and ebook versions
PDF, ePub and MOBI formats
Paperback will ship about 2 months after book completion
Ebook can be downloaded immediately upon book completion
Free shipping in US
Shipping to non-US addresses could take up to 30 days
DATAFLOW & RUST PAPERBACKS: $45
"Rust Programming Concepts" and "Dataflow and Reactive Programming Systems"
Paperback and ebook versions of both books

Upon completion of funding you may download "Dataflow and Reactive Programming Systems" immediately and we will ship the paperback version
"Rust Programming Concepts" can be downloaded as soon as it is done with paperbacks shipping about 2 months after book completion

GOLD SPONSOR: $75
You get everything from the $45 pledge level

Your name and/or company name, logo (optional), URL (optional) and short text (optional) will be displayed prominently at the beginning of the book for all to see

FULL PAGE SPONSOR: $95

Sponsorship Restrictions: All text and images must be G rated. Get-Rich-Quick schemes are not allowed. Basically, keep it clean.

campaign.story:
If you use websites such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr or any other sites you need virtually unbreakable passwords. And you need to store them safely, but conveniently, so you can recall them whenever you need to.
The Enigmaze password manager takes the headache out of creating new strong passwords or updating existing ones and allows you to quickly decode your password when you need to use it.
Featured in:
With the Enigmaze kit there are hundreds of ways to create strong passwords.
You need to have passwords that are difficult to decipher.
How do you do that?
It's simple: create different passwords for every single account, and make them impossible to guess.
However, this creates a new problem. How good is your memory?
If you are like most people, you probably have difficulty remembering what you had for lunch yesterday! When you have many different, extremely complex passwords how can you remember even just one of them, let alone all of them?
 Take this one for instance: xXkleG!8+Ke$?mcd
It's a great password, but will you be able to remember it?
And, you need dozens more just like that one - all different.
Enter Enigmaze - a secure password manager logbook that enables you to quickly create passwords that are almost impossible to guess, yet easy to find and use when you need to log in to your online accounts.
Enigmaze comes in a classic gift box, so it's a great present for your geek friends.
Why do we call it Enigmaze?
Enigma comes from the second World War where there was a gadget called the Enigma Machine. The Enigma Machine was invented by a German, Arthur Scherbius to encode messages sent by wire so that if intercepted, the messages would be unreadable. Basically it was a method of creating a coded message that looked like nonsense to anyone other than the recipient.
Creating passwords that are difficult to crack is not difficult, but remembering them is.  

Enigmaze to the rescue!
Keep your password secure in your wallet or share it with a client


You can use a variety of encryption methods, such as a UV invisible ink pen, transparent overlay cards, your own custom method, or much more. The choice is yours!
The Enigmaze notebook gives you:  
- Hardcover stitched binding
- Pocket size A6 (94 x 143mm / 4"x5.7" exterior) 
- 88 sheets of acid free ink-proof 70 g/m2
- Different grid for every sheet.
- Alphabetical tabs (3 pages per letter) for organizing and storing you passwords. 
- 10 empty sheets for taking notes at the end of the book
- Plenty of space for web addresses, usernames (yes, we forget those, too!), and passwords.   
- A light weight, sturdy construction that is ideal for carrying in your pocket, handbag, or backpack. 
- An elastic closure and an expandable inner pocket.   
- Invisible ink marker with UV light (may not be as shown)
- Frosted, grid printed PVC card.


 With Enigmaze, you will never, ever, forget a password again! 

Early prototype under UV light
How to use Enigmaze:

There are many ways to use your Enigmaze password logbook, and your methods are completely up to you. You can even vary your methods for different websites creating impossible to crack passwords, even if somebody else has your Enigmaze.
For example, one method is drawing a line on the grid with a UV pen. 
The line can be straight, or parts can be drawn at different angles. Alternatively, using the outer letters and numbers for navigation, you can highlight individual characters on the line. Your password can be any length you wish, but anything less than eight characters is not recommended.

Using an erasable ink pen to change your password often.
PLAY

The alphabetical index enables you to find your password quickly, for example you would go to 'G' for Google, or Godaddy. 


You can have lots of fun just thinking up new methods while at the same time creating passwords that are almost impossible to crack!
