campaign.story:
Synthino XM Polyphonic MIDI Synthesizer
First, a BIG Thank You!
The Synthino XM Kickstarter campaign was a huge success, with all available Synthino XM synthesizers claimed in record time. We know there is demand for this great product and it will be available for purchase at synthino.com starting in May 2015. Watch for campaign updates here or sign up for email notifications at synthino.com.
What is Synthino XM?
The Synthino XM is completely new polyphonic synthesizer with unique features running on a powerful hardware platform. It is compact, well-constructed, open source, and absolutely beautiful. Most importantly, it is really fun to play whether you are a musician or you just want to make some noise.
Capabilities
Synthino XM is a polyphonic, multitimbral synthesizer with many features:
5-note polyphony for superb playability
12 waveforms, 5 drum samples (kick, snare, hi-hat, tom, clap), and noise generator
12-bit audio at 25KHz output rate
4 MIDI channels, each with separate waveform and ADSR envelope settings
MIDI over 5-pin MIDI jack or USB
MIDI over USB works with DAW software on Mac and Windows computers as well as iOS and Android devices
low pass filter with cutoff frequency and resonance controls
2 independent low frequency oscillators (LFOs): pitch and filter
selectable waveform for LFOs
1V p-p audio output voltage with enough current to drive headphones
arpeggiator mode, up to 16 notes
4 arpeggiator patterns: up, down, up-down, random
4 built-in arpeggiator chords or use MIDI to specify up to 16 notes
arpeggiator pitch transposition control
tempo control with MIDI clock input
16-step live performance "groovebox" sequencer
save/load patches and sequences in EEPROM
pitch fine-tuning adjustment
programmable/upgradable over USB
Hardware Features
Back view: MIDI input, mini USB, 1/4" mono audio output
1/4 inch ( 6.35 mm ) output jack: Works with headphones, line output for recording, and direct connecting to standard guitar amplifier. We will include a 1/4 to 1/8 inch stereo adapter with each Synthino XM for headphone/earbud use. When running on 9 volt battery power, the unit turns off when the audio plug is removed.
Standard 5-pin MIDI input jack: This allows you to plug-in any standard MIDI keyboard, interface, sequencer, or drum machine to control the Synthino XM.
USB mini jack: Allows MIDI over USB functionality. This modern implementation enables sequencing and control from iOS, Android, PC,  and Mac devices. It can also be used to upgrade firmware using a simple upload utility. Synthino XM can also be powered from the USB port of cell phone charger, laptop power, or battery pack.
Laser-cut acrylic cover: The top and bottom of the device are laser-cut frosted acrylic that give the Synthino XM a gorgeous finish. We searched far and wide for acrylic with just the right look.
Knobs, Buttons, and Blinking LEDs
We wanted a fun, tactile, aesthetically pleasing user interface free of distractions and with just enough buttons and knobs that change your parameters on the fly so you can instantly explore new sounds. The software modes we designed are geared towards people to have fun playing around without any previous musical experience and at the same time we have a powerful live sequencer groovebox mode that every synthesizer fan will enjoy. The visual indicators are in the form of 4 bright orange LEDs located below the buttons. 
Software
The Synthino XM has 3 modes: synthesizer, arpeggiator, and groovebox. When Synthino XM is powered on, all the LEDs blink, prompting you to select a mode by pressing one of the buttons (1-3).  In some modes, the pots have secondary functions labeled as "fn:". These functions are enabled/disabled by pressing button 4. When "fn:" functions are enabled, the LED under button 4 flashes. The entire device can be reset by holding button 4 for 3 seconds, allowing you to choose a new mode to use.
Mode 1 - Synthesizer
Synthesizer mode allows you to play the Synthino XM with a MIDI controller connected to the MIDI jack or from your favorite DAW (digital audio workstation) software with MIDI over USB. You can also play the synthesizer in standalone mode using the 3 note buttons. Explore different sounds by changing the waveform, controlling the note envelope parameters (ADSR - attack, decay, sustain, release), modulating the pitch and filter with independent LFOs for each, and adjusting the low pass filter.
There are 4 independent voices corresponding to MIDI channels 1-4. Each voice can have its own envelope and waveform, allowing you to play 4 completely different sounding instruments at the same time. Use the voice select knob to choose a voice (indicated by LED) and then use waveform and ADSR knobs to modify that voice's parameters. The LFOs and filter, however, are global and affect all voices.
The Synthino XM is 5-note polyphonic, and the 5 simultaneous notes can be played on any combination of voices. For example, all on one voice when playing from a keyboard, or the 5 notes can be spread across the 4 MIDI channels when sequencing the Synthino XM from DAW software on your computer.
Synthesizer demo:
Mode 2 - Arpeggiator 
The arpeggiator lets you play predefined arpeggios or set your own arpeggio notes with MIDI. Use the pattern button to cycle through the patterns: up, down, up-down, and random. Use the chord/MIDI button to cycle through predefined 4-note chord arpeggios: major, minor, M7, and m7, or to select MIDI mode which creates an arpeggio with currently played MIDI notes (up to 16 notes!). Of course you can change the speed (BPM), transpose arpeggios up and down, and modify the envelope, waveform, and filter parameters. There's a ton of fun to be had, even when using the arpeggiator in standalone mode without any MIDI input.
Arpeggiator demos:
Mode 3 - Live performance "groovebox" sequencer
Groovebox mode is the most sophisticated feature of the Synthino XM. It is a "live" 16-step sequencer which allows you to lay down 4 different tracks by playing a MIDI controller. For simplicity when performing a live sequence, this mode does not have secondary functions on the pots.
When the sequencer is running, any note or drum sample you play will be recorded to the current track and repeated as the sequencer runs. Change tracks using the track select knob. Each track can have its own envelope (AR) settings. The individual notes on a single track can even have different waveforms, so you can create very rich, complex sequences. The clear track button clears the currently selected track, and the preview button lets you play notes/samples with your controller without recording them so you can hear what it will sound like. The track fader knob lets you control the volume of each track individually, and transpose lets you transpose notes up/down (but drum samples won't transpose). You can even enable a metronome to help with your timing. The Synthino XM groovebox mode is incredibly powerful and expressive. No musical talent is required to make great sounding sequences! And when you have a great sequence you can save it to memory to recall later, even after the power is turned off.
Groovebox demos:
Synthino XM is better...
Powerful microcontroller - The ATxmega128a4u has 2x speed, 4x flash memory, 4x SRAM of any comparable Aduino based synthesizer out there. Waveforms are synthesized with a true 12-bit DAC for smooth sound. This is not scratchy PWM audio!
MIDI Over USB - Note sequencing from Android with OTG (On-The-Go) cable, USB Camera Adapter on iPad or iPhone. Standard USB port on Desktop PC or Laptop. Drivers are pre-loaded on all those systems. It will just show up as "Synthino XM" under MIDI Output Interfaces.
Built for easy upgrades and customization - We will release mechanical drill files for anyone who wants to integrate the Synthino XM into a custom project. We take the community of our users seriously and any improvements and upgrades will be considered. Custom colors of laser cut panels and accessories will be eventually available.
Made in USA - By keeping our fabrication and assembly in-house we can afford to expand and economically create the Synthino XM. With fewer middle men you as a backer and future customer will received the best deal. We also take pride in being a local business.
Our Story  
We are both experienced "makers" that have both run our own electronics business for years. In fact, we were both recently profiled in the new book Maker Pro published by Maker Media:
Michael Krumpus and Alex Dyba both featured in Maker Pro
We started collaborating on Synthino project in early 2014, the finished design you see evolved almost naturally because the hardware was telling us what to do. Initially the synthesizer experiments were coded for the nootropic design's Audio Hacker Shield, surely it made sounds but limited by only 5 buttons and 3 pots with no way playing notes, but even with the added MIDI shield, we obviously had monstrous setup was not clean, friendly, or practical. 
Audio Hacker synthesizer prototype
Yet those steps helped us to define the limits of what we wanted in a portable microcontroller synthesizer. Our team had a deadline later that spring, a pivotal point and we concentrated on developing a standalone synthesizer not a collection of Arduino shields. Thanks to Michael's tireless efforts writing the software and laying out the hardware to incorporate Alex's functionality suggestions the Synthino ONE was born and debuted at the Maker Faire Bay Area 2014.
We had overwhelmingly positive feedback and of course plenty of suggestions from people who stopped by our booth. Before boarding the plane for cold Minnesota Alex contacted RobotSpeak synthesizer specialty retailer in San Francisco, although an actual meeting never happened that contact led to surprise project producing 100 units over the summer for the band Information Society! 
Information Society Deluxe Synthino ONE Project
In August of 2014 we fulfilled out obligations of delivering the units to be included in the band's deluxe box set of their new record _Hello World. The Deluxe release sold out within hours. 
NEW Synthino XM Production Version
We learned so many things from painstakingly creating over 100 units by hand and soldering thousands of through-hole components. The functionality and features were all squeezed out of the Synthino ONE's same as Arduino ATmega328 hardware. We needed faster fabrication and a faster processor with double the speed and 4 times as much memory. From the Atmel ATxmega128a4u the new Synthino XM was prototyped and born. 
Over the fall and winter of 2014 we continued the work on Synthino XM perfecting the code and improving our manufacturing processes to be able to produce the new XM units in-house. We chose white circuit boards, orange LEDs and frosted acrylic for an aesthetically pleasing design that will get attention for its beauty, not just its great sound.
Rewards
Alex Wearing a GetLoFi Black GetLoFi T-Shirt - $20 reward level
2 T-Shirt Options, we will contact you for size.
Project Timeline
Why Crowdfunding? 
We know that this Kickstarter campaign will be the best way to get the word out about our awesome product. We ask for your support to validate our vision of a fun user-friendly synthesizer by providing us with materials we need to make it a success.
"Synthino" is a trademark of nootropic design, LLC
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are experienced makers that both run our own electronics businesses and have proven track records in manufacturing and shipping to customers all over the world. But, like any complex project, there are some risks that could get in the way: 

Production Equipment Failure: We are planning on using a shared laser cutter for this short run of Synthino XM units, its possible that the machine can break or be broken by another user. Our surface mount reflow oven may malfunction and cause delays until new one is acquired. 

Software Bugs: It is possible that there could be grave software errors that may not manifest until after the units are shipped. Although the units can be easily updated over USB it is an extra step we would not be thrilled with making users do. 

Component Failures: It is also possible that any one of the parts we receive and use in our batch of units could be faulty and fail from repeated use of Synthino XM. With many years of customer care, these issues will be resolved quickly to the customer's satisfaction.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: It's been a fun year bringing the Synthino XM to market, and now we have neon acrylic available to make your Synthino XM look awesome! Acrylic sets are available in orange, green, pink or blue. You can also now buy the Synthino XM with whichever color you would like already installed. Check it out at the Synthino XM store!

Just a heads-up that everyone can buy a Synthino XM now at synthino.com. So if you are one of our lucky Kickstarter backers and like the Synthino XM, tell your friends! 
We now have a version with nice aluminum knobs, as well as a cool Synthino XM t-shirt.

Synthino XM received an incredibly positive response at the 10th annual Maker Faire in the Bay Area. Alex and I went to San Francisco for 4 days to show the Synthino XM to everyone there. The attendance was over 125,000 people and it was a great event.

We have been very busy manufacturing and testing your Synthino XM synthesizers, and will begin shipping them to the $129 reward level backers this week. Here's what 48 of them look like while waiting for packaging!

updates.update_userinfo: Synthino XM Rewards Starting to Ship This Week!
updates.update_content:
Thank you all for helping to make the Synthino XM Kickstarter campaign a success! We are extremely grateful for the support. 
The assembly has started and at this stage we are freezing the firmware features and concentrating on fixing bugs and oddities so you can have the best possible experience right out of the box!
Here is what will happen next:

updates.update_userinfo: Early Delivery Synthino XM units starting to ship
updates.update_content: Thanks to all of you, we were able to begin the production early! Units are getting assembled on schedule and our software is getting better and better. Can't wait to hear what you will do with Synthino XM! Have a great weekend. Alex and Michael.

updates.update_userinfo: The campaign is wrapped up -- here's what is next
updates.update_content:
Hi, it's me Michael -- I'm the guy working feverishly in my basement lab to add new features to the Synthino XM software as our Kickstarter campaign comes to a conclusion. Here are a few of the new features that I've added. These will be included in your devices when they ship.
Noise generation - a new "waveform" that allows you to generate white noise. Higher MIDI notes create a pure sounding white noise. Lower MIDI notes slow down the rate of the noise generation, creating a low, scratchy growl. You can apply the ADSR envelope to noise notes just like any other note, and the low pass filter gives some great results too.

project_data.project_name: Synthino XM Polyphonic MIDI Synthesizer and Groovebox

campaign.story:
What is Proto-pasta Conductive PLA and why is it interesting?
Have you ever wanted to create something with your 3D printer that includes electronics?  Maybe an LED, touch sensor, or some other genius invention to solve the world’s problems?  Help us launch Conductive PLA and you will be able to!   
Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is an FFF/FDM 3D printing filament designed for users interested in combining 3D Printing and electronics. It allows you to print conductive assemblies that integrate switches, potentiometers, LED’s, capacitive touch sensors, and more!
Proto-pasta Conductive PLA Highlights
1-High electrical conductivity, between 60X and 700,000X more conductive than readily available conductive filaments at 15 ohm-cm
2-Compatibility with other PLA materials for use in dual-head printers with good layer adhesion for creating circuits
3-Reduced brittleness over existing conductive products (filament is quite flexible)
4-Excellent print quality
5-Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is affordable
What is it made of?
Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is a compound of Natureworks 4043D PLA, a dispersant and conductive carbon black.  
How conductive is “conductive”?
Great question!  Here are the numbers:
Volume resistivity of molded resin (not 3D Printed) – 15 ohm-cm
Volume resistivity of 3D printed parts perpendicular to layers – 30 ohm-cm
Volume resistivity of 3D printed parts through layers (along Z axis) – 115 ohm-cm
Resistance of a 10cm length of 1.75mm filament – 1.8Kohm
Resistance of a 10cm length of 2.85mm filament – 600ohm
The measure normally used to characterize a conductor is “volume resistivity” with the units of Ohm-cm.  This can be confusing because it is not obvious what it means like “miles per hour”.  It is simply the resistance through a 1cm X 1cm X 1cm cube of material, with full sheet contact at 2 opposing surfaces.  It is often misprinted as ohm/cm which is not a common unit of measure.
We measured the conductivity using a fixture we machined that clamps a sample between 2 sheet conductors and 1cm cubes printed on a Printrbot Simple Metal and machined from solid resin. 
 Measuring Volume Resistivity of Molded Resin
Printing Samples on Printrbot
PLAY

So how strong is it?
We have not done substantial mechanical testing on this product but have some subjective parameters that should be useful in comparing this material with others.
-Strength:  Fair strength.  More flexible than PLA, but less layer adhesion
-Stiffness:  Low, semi-flexible
-Heat Resistance:  Similar to PLA, use below 50C
-Layer Adhesion:  Fair layer adhesion.  Not as good as normal PLA
-Flexibility:  Filament is quite flexible but will break if bent repeatedly (particularly 2.85mm).  Printed parts are rigid if more than a mm or two thick.  Thin sections are somewhat flexible but fail along layer lines if flexed more than a few times.
-Failure Mode:  If flexed to breakage, failure will be along layer lines.
-Warping:  Very low warping
-Dual-Head compatibility:  Compatible with (sticks to) PLA in dual material prints
Printing
Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is quite easy to print and is compatible with most printers that can print PLA.
Parameters:
Bed Temp if available: 50C
Hot End Temp: 230C
Rewards
We have a number of rewards that we are excited to share! 
$15 + Shipping - 125g Loose Coil of Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
One 125g Loose coil (no spool) of high quality Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm diameter.  One coil is approximately 42 meters of 1.75mm filament and 16 meters of 2.85mm filament.
$39.50 + Shipping - 500g Spooled Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
One 500g spool of high quality Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm diameter.  One 500g spool is approximately 168 meters of 1.75mm filament and 64 meters of 2.85mm filament.
$142.50 + Shipping - 2000g Spooled Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
One 2Kg spool of high quality Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm diameter.  One 2Kg spool is approximately 672 meters of 1.75mm filament and 256 meters of 2.85mm filament.
$20 + Shipping - Stylus Kit
One of the great things about Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is that you can print projects that will control mobile device touch screens!  You could make braille overlays for virtual keypads, an I-device Stylus, or prosthetic fingertips! 
We chose to make a simple Stylus which is just a 3D printed pencil shape.  To make these work really well it helps if the tip is super soft and flexible to make a nice large surface area against the touch screen.  For this we used a little piece of anti-static foam used for shipping electronics devices.  It works great!!
Reward Includes:
1X 125g loose coil of Proto-pasta Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
1X piece of conductive foam for making the tip
1X link to design and printing files with detailed instructions
PLAY

$24 + Shipping - Creator Kit with 9V battery, 2LED's and flashlight files
One of the fun things to do with Proto-pasta Conductive PLA is to light up LED's in your 3D prints.  This kit includes all the materials you need to get started with lighting things up.  The 9V battery flashlight is a great first experiment and lets you easily print a working flashlight with an integrated switch using a single or dual head printer.
Reward includes:
1X 125g loose coil of Proto-pasta Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
1X 125g loose coil of Proto-pasta Translucent Red PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
2X super bright white LED's
1X high quality 9V battery
1X link to flashlight design and printing files
PLAY

$75 + Shipping - Controller Kit with Makey Makey included!!
Thanks to the great folks at Makey Makey, this reward includes a collectors edition Makey Makey kit!  With this and Proto-pasta Conductive PLA filament you will be able to use your 3D printed parts to interact with your computer!
By using Conductive PLA and normal PLA in dual-material prints, capacitive touch buttons can be integrated into 3D printed objects. Makey Makey is the perfect interface for experimenting with these touch sensors, just hook your print up using the included alligator clips and you can control your computer!
Reward includes:
1X 125g loose coil of Proto-pasta Conductive PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
1X 125g loose coil of Proto-pasta Translucent Red PLA in 1.75mm or 2.85mm
1X Makey Makey Collectors edition Kit. Includes a Makey Makey, USB Cable, 7 Alligator Clips, 6 Connector Wires, 20 Color Stickers, and carrying tin!
1X link to controller design and printing files with detailed instructions
PLAY

A Note on Safety
We are big supporters of DIY projects, experimentation, and Making in general, but please use caution!  Electricity, 3D printing, and the tools used in Making with these can be pretty dangerous.
We recommend only using our Conductive PLA filament for low voltage and low current projects.  Too much current will cause the material to heat.
Please keep safety in mind and have fun!
Thank you!!!
A big part of what makes 3D printing so amazing is the community around it.  We are supported by you, inspired by you, and challenged by you to create the most interesting materials we can. So thank you! 

We would like to give a special shout out to John Biehler for his continued support and use of his video footage in our Kickstarter.

- The Proto-pasta Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have launched 2 successful Kickstarter campaigns and delivered all rewards on time for both. While there are always risks, we have high confidence in this project because of the effort we have put in already to develop the material supply chain and manufacturing processes. We will make every effort to get every backer their rewards on time and with high quality standards.

The main risks are manufacturing and delivering rewards on time. Our supply and manufacturing processes are stable and we gave ourselves enough time to deliver a large number of rewards but if the demand gets too high a schedule slip is possible. If this happened we would let you know with an updated ship date for additional backers while the campaign is live so there are no surprises.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
We have had a few general questions on LED's and using the conductive filament for prints, so hopefully this will help!
-First, the Creator (flashlight) Kit is intended to printed all at once, we had some folks wondering how to attach the 3 pieces. We printed it on a dual head printer with PLA in one head and Conductive in the other. The PLA fuses to the Conductive during printing, holding the assembly together. If you have a single head printer this is still possible to make, but you will need to switch out filament twice during the print. How exactly to do this depends on your slicer, but basically it pauses at a specified layer letting you change out filament.

A great big THANKS to all our KS backers, we are thrilled to be able to bring this new product into the 3Dp community.  
Last week we placed orders for raw materials and everything was picked up today, scheduled to arrive Monday. We will then start working hard on your rewards; we are looking forward to shipping them!
More soon, and thank you.

We are having a great time here in Las Vegas at CES! We are meeting all kinds of folks in the industry and seeing some really amazing 3DP hardware. Our conductive material has been a big hit, people get really excited when they see what they can do with their printers at home.
Our other new materials (Stainless Steel and Iron filled PLA) get people pretty fired up too; we had a number of "OMG, you printed that on a Printrbot!!??" comments.

Thanks to you we have met our goal!  We're ready to get to work and can now place minimum orders for raw materials and start production soon.  We will keep you posted along the way!
We have been working tirelessly on improving our production facility and researching new filaments since our last KS campaign just over a year ago.   We plan to continue re-investing in our products, packaging, and brand to help bring the most advanced 3D printing materials available to our customers.

campaign.story:
Photon Elephant turns your 3D printer into a smartprinter! It’s easy to use the browser-based control panel to start, pause, and resume prints, stream from a webcam and slice your STL files. The Photon Elephant is the simplest electronics solution for getting a 3D printer up and running without needing to coordinate a bunch of independent software and firmware tools. 
Unlike existing solutions, we use the Raspberry Pi’s GPIO pins to directly drive the motor controllers for your printer. We even went a step further and built a convenient SDK that makes Photon Elephant a tinkerer’s dream! Do you want to try incorporating sensor feedback to close the loop and get perfect prints every time? Maybe you want to build an SLS printer, but the standard five motor controllers just aren’t enough? We provide a simple specification so the Makers and Hackers of the world can spend more time innovating and less time figuring out the inner workings of firmware code.
Photon Elephant is a bundle of hardware and software built around the Raspberry Pi that controls your 3D printer. Many printers today use a Raspberry Pi to send commands to an Arduino, which actually manages the motors and sensors, but has no operating system. Photon Elephant eliminates the Arduino entirely, putting the power of linux directly on your printer!
We think that creating new and exciting 3D printers should be easier, so we set out to make a simple and powerful platform that anyone can build on. We found the process of working with the available open source solutions to be tedious and out of date. The next generation of 3D printers deserve better. That's why we built Photon Elephant.
Photon Elephant is built for Hackers, Makers, Students and Entrepreneurs! It can handle the whole stack, controlling everything from the User Interface to the motors and sensors! If you just want to get a printer up and running, Photon Elephant does the work of a slew of other products, making it the simplest solution available. If you are looking to do something new, the SDK makes Photon Elephant the easiest platform to build on.
Never flash firmware again! We’ll send you an SD card (or an image if you’re feeling a bit more adventurous) and you just plug it into the Raspberry Pi. Wire any compatible* printer up to the Photon Elephant companion board, and you’re ready to go! No more worrying about making a bunch of different programs like slicers, firmware and printer managers talk to one another. Just open a browser on any device on your WiFi and start printing!
*We currently officially support only Cartesian RepRap-style printers (Prusa, Printrbot, etc.). We are actively working on support for Delta printers and SLS printers, while our SDK can be used to easily support almost any printing methodology.
With the Photon Elephant SDK, we empower both hobbyists and startups like never before!  We expose an additional header coming off our companion board with 40 pins for you to run custom motors and sensors to your heart’s content! Using our SDK, you can create powerful plugins to control your own electronics and unleash totally new tools on your 3D printer.
Simple additions like extra motors or extruders only require tweaking some XML. If you want to do something more complicated, you can use the SDK to easily add support for anything you can imagine! Maybe you want to start incorporating new sensor feedback data into your print process to improve reliability, or you want to add an extruder that uses a bunch of motors for full color? The Photon Elephant SDK is built for this kind of thing! Understanding a few of our system calls is all you need in order to get up to speed and start hacking. You worry about the high-level logic of what you want to do, and we’ll worry about the rest!
For More Information Check Out Our Developer Blog!
The 3D printing industry is shifting so quickly that today’s high performance printer is tomorrow’s paperweight. Given how hard it is to predict the direction the industry will shift, flexibility is the name of the game. It doesn’t make sense to spend your time modifying firmware directly on a chipset that might not be used at all tomorrow.
Photon Elephant’s SDK helps you keep up with the rest of the industry by making it easy to add new features to your design. We’ll worry about offering support for the latest and greatest electronics, so you can make sure your printer always keeps pace.
Avtar Khalsa 
Robotics has always been Avtar’s true passion. In high school he made a trashcan that automatically took itself out and hasn’t stopped tinkering since. In college he moved on to helping write the code behind the Cornell Ranger robot that briefly held the record for longest distance walked by a robot on a single charge. Since then he’s mostly focused on mobile development, but never lost his love for robotics.  
Brant Merryman
Brant Merryman has been passionate about technology since his first computer, an Atari 400. He has spent the last 20 years writing commercial software for Macintosh, Windows, Linux, and several other platforms. Brant has been excitedly working with 3D printers for several years with his high school sweetheart and now wife, Christina. Brant knows C++ so that you don't have to.
 Ben McCloskey
As a lifelong breaker of things, Ben is excited about helping people be makers of things! He does a little bit of everything and prides himself on filling in the cracks, whether that means writing Java, Python, C, shell scripts, wiring up bread boards, creating marketing materials or anything else! When he’s not tinkering with software and electronics, he’s probably out hiking with his dog or playing a new board, card or video game with his amazing fiancée.
Thanks To unfilterd on Thingiverse for the great Elephant Model!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are still in the process of finalizing our SDK. We have achieved great prints doing our high level printer management in Java. We are planning to create our SDK so that the APIs support several different programming languages. We use Google protocol buffers for most of our internal communication and intend to use them for our SDK as well. If this approach works, plugins can be written in any language that supports protocol buffers; however, if we run into any major setbacks in the area, we will revert to a Java-only SDK for the first version.

The design of the circuit board is done. We have been testing with the prototype system on the Raspberry Pi for about 6 months and have consistently had great prints. We have already received our first 10 pcb boards designed fully to spec and are beginning testing with them. We will be sending out boards for people to try as soon as we have them available, with the SDK being released shortly thereafter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,

 We are so deeply sorry about the significant delays and lack of communication over the past several months. We had an internal disagreement, which lead to lawyers getting involved.* It has been an emotional rollercoaster for all of us, and unfortunately we will be unable to operate as a company going forward due to our inability to reach a final resolution. We hope you understand that this left us unable to update you folks and we REALLY apologize for that. We hope any future founders out there learn our lesson and make sure to get their proper legal paperwork in order ahead of time.

Hey everyone, We apologize for not finishing shipping this week as we promised in our last update. The boards are all tested and working, but we are having some logistical issues getting everything out the door. We're hoping to get them wrapped up quickly so we can get you your boards as soon as possible. We will be sure to keep you updated!

Hi all,
Sorry for the delayed update, but we have some big news! We have finally finished testing all the boards, and we think we have just about all the kinks resolved in our code! All thats left to sort out is a few minor logistical details. As such, we think we will be sending out boards by the end of this coming week.
Thank you all for your support and we're really excited to get your feedback so we can continue improving the print system!
It's a big day at the Photon Elephant offices! The big run of fully assembled boards arrived the same day as the T-shirts!

Hi Guys
Just a quick update. The boards have been ordered and we're expecting to have them in 3-4 weeks. Our software looks like it will be ready by then as well so we expect to ship out as soon as everything is tested! 
Be on the lookout for a survey in the near future so we can get everything out the door as quickly as possible.

Hello Photon Phriends!!
Deliveries: 
Our Beta and Preview backers now have access to our image that can be directly deployed to an SD card. When re-booted, your Pi will automatically update with our latest version of software. We will be pushing changes based on feedback from our backers, testers, and new clients. We are so excited to move The Photon Elephant from the Alpha to the Beta stage of production.

We finally got the printer running on our PCB board! And based on the survey results, we made it faster! Check out our video.
Hi All!
We are so excited to let you know that we have our printer running on the PCB board! Based on this success we have now ordered our first run of boards from the manufacturer. See update number 8 for board specs.

Hi Photon Phriends! 
We are so excited to let you know that we are on track for all deliverables! The boards are in and we are doing our second round of QA now. For those of you that are starting your build, we have included the specs below: 
Dimensions

Greetings from the Photon Elephant Team!
The first batch of T-Shirts have arrived for our Enthusiast backers. They look really great. You'll be receiving them very soon.
For those backers at the other tiers, your T-Shirts will be shipped along with the other parts of your reward.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you all so much for your support!
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Thank you for the overwhelming support. It has been a bumpy yet exciting ride for the Photon Elephant team! We have used your comments and feedback to continue to grow our product in ways that we hadn't thought of. It was really exciting to get our speed and control up as quickly as we did in two weeks. Imagine how much better it will continue to get over the next month!

campaign.story:
Website
Visit our website ColdSh.com to order after the campaign ends!
Press enquiries: press@ColdSh.com
Feature Articles About The Cold Shoulder
Japanese "GetNews"
                                Video Interviews with Dr. Wayne Hayes:
PLAY

PLAY

Articles about mild cold exposure and calorie burn have appeared in:
Our Story
I sell a vest full of ice that's designed to burn calories.
I'm a NASA scientist and a professor. What you're about to read is going to sound like science fiction, but it's not.  Scientists have spent decades studying how mild cold exposure can enhance calorie burn.  Quietly, and without fuss, the evidence for cold exposure induced calorie burn has been accumulating.  It's time to bring the science to the public. That's what I'm here to do: to explain to you what is probably the most novel, evidence-based calorie-burning idea that's come out of the scientific community in many years, and to tell you how you can take advantage of it without pain, without discomfort, and without taking more than 2 minutes of time out of your busy day. With KickStarter's help, we'll be able to bring this vest to the masses at a reasonable price.
Let's be blunt: there is no magic pill for weight loss, and The Cold Shoulder is no exception to that rule.  The cold, hard truth is that the foundation of weight control is your diet. In order to maintain a healthy weight, do what grandma told you: eat your veggies, cut the fat off your steak, and avoid junk food, especially sweets.  If you continue to eat junk, then no amount of exercise, cold exposure, or weirdly named supplements or powders will help you lose weight. The vest can burn up to 500 calories per day if used as directed, but you can easily nullify the effect by eating an extra 500 extra calories.  So don't expect that you can continue to eat junk food, wear the vest, and lose weight.  You can't.
But if you are already eating well and getting moderate exercise and want to accelerate your calorie-burning efforts by burning excess calories while at rest, there's no simpler, easier, or more time-efficient way than wearing our vest.
We'd like to emphasize exactly under what conditions The Cold Shoulder can induce the burning of excess calories.  Basically, you need to be in an environment where you are otherwise at a comfortable temperature, and you are not exercising.  If you are sitting down at rest in a room (or your car, or whatever) that is at a comfortable temperature, then wearing The Cold Shoulder directly from the freezer, and with a shirt underneath, will extract heat from your body and cause you to burn extra calories in order to stay warm.
If you are in a hot environment, the The Cold Shoulder will help you stay cool, but it won't burn excess calories, because you're not cold.  If you are working out in the gym, then The Cold Shoulder can help you stay cool, but will not enhance your calorie burn, because you're not cold in that environment.  If the vest is not cold, or if the ice has all melted, it will not induce excess calorie burn. Remember that the goal of The Cold Shoulder is to force you to burn calories at a time when you otherwise would not: sitting down, at rest, in a comfortable environment at room temperature.
So, to burn excess calories, wear The Cold Shoulder sitting on the couch watching the game, or in front of your computer, or in your car during your commute.  Any time you'd normally just be sitting around comfortable---that's the time to don The Cold Shoulder and enhance your calorie burn.
Whether you're an athlete, an actor/model, or a couch potato, almost everybody today could benefit from burning a few more calories without expending time or effort.  Note that The Cold Shoulder cannot claim to diagnose, treat, prevent, or cure any disease, illness or condition.
The Problem - Exercise is not the only way to burn calories
The first thing I always hear when I say I’m touting a “cold vest” is, “I don’t like being cold.” But think of all the other crazy things people do in order to try to lose excess fat. Starving themselves? Eating zero-calorie clay just to feel full, which carries a risk of arsenic poising? Exhausting themselves in the gym? Ingesting questionable supplements that, if they work at all, have side effects like insomnia or over‐stimulation? How about wearing a corset just to appear thinner? Drug injections? Liposuction? Freezing fat cells? Gastro‐intestinal surgery? Considering these options, wearing a cool, calorie-burning vest is pretty tame in comparison. The Cold Shoulder has no known side effects. Users who start skeptical end up wearing it routinely, and even find they look forward to putting it on at the end of a long day.
There is an aspect of the calorie equation that has been largely neglected for too long.  There is a huge hole in our collective knowledge. Although exercise is definitely good, most people think that exercise is the only way to burn excess calories.   But it's not.
The Solution - Burn excess calories using mild cold exposure
In addition to exercise, there’s another, much less well-known but scientifically well-established way to burn calories. It’s called mild cold exposure. Basically, if you extract heat from your body, even if you’re sitting on your couch in front of the T.V., your body will need to burn calories to stay warm. This is a scientific fact – and I should know,  since I work at NASA with a group of scientists that study ice. The trick is to figure out how to harness mild cold exposure without being uncomfortable.
The idea of using mild cold exposure to burn calories has slowly started to percolate into the popular media. Articles on the subject have appeared in many places, including the venues mentioned at the top of this page. The problem is that they often recommend painful or impractical methods of cold exposure, like cold showers or ice baths. Very few people have the courage to try that.
I was studying the science of how cold exposure burns calories, when I had a light-bulb moment. I thought, "If cold exposure burns calories, there’s got to be a way I can harness its power to help ordinary people increase their calorie burn." That’s when I began the work that eventually led me to develop The Cold Shoulder. It's a vest that drapes ice over the shoulder and back, and extracts calories while you wear it. The vest looks like this:
The Cold Shoulder Calorie Burning Vest
I have put it to the scientific test and proved this vest's efficacy in controlled clinical trials. Here are a few before-and-after shots after just 3 weeks of using The Cold Shoulder:
Results of 3 weeks of wearing The Cold Shoulder
Considering all the crazy things that people do to burn excess fat, from starvation diets to liposuction, a vest that burns calories while you continue about your day seems pretty tame, don't you think?
Why You’ll Love The Cold Shoulder
1. Burns calories without exercise. Whether you’re a gym rat or a couch potato, our ice vest will burn excess calories for you – the equivalent of up to 500 calories a day. This can more than double the calorie deficit you'd get from dieting alone.
2. Saves time. It takes about 30s to get the vest out of the freezer and put it on. Then you go about your day until the ice melts, and it's another thirty seconds to take it off and put it back into the freezer.  Do that twice a day, and you've spent 2 minutes to burn 500 calories. Compare that to the same calories burned in a gym workout, which can consume several hours once you include travel time, change room time, and waiting for the machines that are busy when you want to use them. Two minutes vs. two hours, for the same 500 calories.
3. It’s effective. The idea is based on decades of research by scientists from Harvard to Cambridge and beyond. Mild cold exposure burns calories – it’s a scientific fact. The only question is how to do it comfortably, effortlessly.... even fashionably!
4. It’s comfortable. The first time you wear it, yes, it'll feel cold. But you won’t shiver. After trying it a few times, you’ll hardly notice you’re wearing it. Some of our current users actually look forward to putting it on.
5. It gets more effective the more you use it. As your body acclimatizes to periodic mild cold exposure, it gets more used to the idea of turning on your internal furnace to burn calories. It gets easier and easier to burn off more and more calories, just like going to the gym gets easier the more you do it. This is exactly opposite to drugs or supplements, which usually decrease in effectiveness as your body builds a tolerance to them.
6. It’s fashionable. You can wear it pretty much anywhere. I've worn it to fancy French restaurants, as part of a 3-piece suit. I even tried wearing it on my wedding day, but my fiancé – now wife – decided it wasn’t quite ready for that.
7. Sold direct at wholesale prices. Expect to pay significantly more once this is available in retail stores. There’s no middle man on KickStarter. We’ll manufacture your vest and ship it directly to you.
How Does It Work? 
The Science Behind Cold-exposure Based Calorie Burn
You don't need to be a scientist to understand that too much cold exposure – such as, say, floating in the North Atlantic after the Titanic sank – can extract so many calories so quickly that it can kill you.  On the other hand, mild cold exposure is perfectly healthy, and has been studied by scientists for decades as a way to burn calories.
For example, Olympic swimmers burn many more calories per day than other Olympic athletes, and it has nothing to do with the exercise. It’s the water. They spend their day in water that’s 20 degrees (F) below their body temperature, and this temperature difference makes them burn way more calories than the exercise alone.
Due to the temperature difference between the body and the water, heat flows from the body to the water, burning many more calories than the exercise alone.
Any mild cold exposure causes your body to burn extra calories, whether it’s a cold day outside, air conditioning set too high, or your skin being in contact with a cold object. Scientists have been studying the effects of mild cold exposure for decades, and it’s a well documented fact that mild cold exposure induces calorie burn.
Our vest, The Cold Shoulder, has ice draped over the shoulder and across the back:
Due to the temperature difference between the body and the ice vest, heat flows from the body to the vest, causing your body to burn calories.
These are the most comfortable places to put the ice because that's where your body has the fewest nerve endings. It's also the most scientifically valid place to put the ice because, just under the skin of the shoulders and back, there's a type of tissue called Brown Adipose Tissue (BAT). BAT burns calories when you encounter mild cold. Our clinical trials show that wearing our vest twice a day for about an hour burns up to 500 calories more per day than you'd burn without it.
Example clinical trial result - Nick Hamilton
Below is a graph of the body fat of Nick Hamilton over a 16-week period. Nick was one of our early testers of The Cold Shoulder. He was on a 16 week, tightly controlled diet and exercise regimen. The only change Nick made in the last 2 weeks was to start using The Cold Shoulder ice vest. You can see how much it accelerated his fat loss.
Nick Hamilton greatly accelerated his fat loss just by wearing The Cold Shoulder for an hour each morning and evening, for the last 2 weeks of his 16-week diet + exercise regimen.
Evidence from independent scientists
For more info on cold exposure and calorie burn, see this page. Note that some of it is rather technical---definitely not light reading. But if you want some of the cold, hard scientific facts from independent researchers, this is the place to start. Most of the research was done even before I conceived of The Cold Shoulder, so you know it's independent and objective.
Our Mission
We want to bring the most functional, comfortable, and stylish clothing-based calorie-burning aid to the global market. We want to spread the word that burning calories doesn’t have to require time-consuming gym visits, sweaty exercise, crazy calorie-restricted diet fads, or taking untested, questionable supplements with unknown side effects. Instead, we advocate that a healthy lifestyle must contain not only a healthy diet and moderate exercise, but also a regular dose of mild cold exposure.
Why We Need You!
Although we have the designs and prototypes finished and our manufacturer stands ready to produce the vests, the cost of production is high unless we fulfill minimum order quantities. In order to cover the costs of fabric and production at this level, we need to commit to this minimum order quantity to secure the best deal, which can then be passed onto you, with special rewards exclusively offered here on Kickstarter!
Will It Fit Me?
We have sizes to fit everybody from XS to XXX-L. We’ll get your sizing option after the funding period is over.
The Details
Inside-out view of the front + back of the vest, showing ice pocket locations.
Re-inforced stitching at stress points
Velcro closure on ice pockets to firmly hold ice packs in place
Velcro closure at the front of the vest, which allows tightening the waist as you lose weight
The Cold Neck can be used alone or in conjunction with the vest to add an additional 20-25% calorie burn.
Backer Rewards
Stretch Goals:
Women’s sizes: Although the current vest is unisex, it's not particularly flattering to the female form. If we reach about $40k in funding, we will have enough spare capital to hire a female clothing designer to design a version more tailored to the female form. We envision it as having a fashionable waist-level fabric body-wrapping belt to adjust the waist size, rather than Velcro.  If we get here, and you want a female version of the vest, you'll be able to choose that after the funding period is over, but it'll probably add about an extra month to your delivery date.
Production Plan
Once funded, we will put in our order for materials. Delivery and preparation of materials may take 2-4 weeks. During that time we’ll confirm sizing for all of our backers and prepare the manufacturing process. To ensure quality construction, we’re personally overseeing manufacturing of our vests in the Los Angeles Fashion district, which requires 4-6 weeks. We source our ice packs from the USA.  Once the vests are made, we’ll prepare them for shipment (at most 1-2 weeks), and then ship them to your door (2-3 days Domestic US, or 1-2 weeks International). 
Total time from funding to shipment: Between 8-12 weeks within the continental US, plus another 1-2 weeks for international shipments.
Our Guarantee
We are confident that you will be happy with your vests and the results it will produce, but if for any reason you’re not completely satisfied, just send it back (you pay shipping, and please give us a “heads up” first), and we'll repair or replace your vest and ship it back to you free of charge.
TESTIMONIALS
“The Cold Shoulder allowed me to cut body fat while still gaining Lean Body Mass. It’s easy to use and makes experimenting with cold exposure simple.”– Nick Hamilton
“After just 2 weeks wearing The Cold Shoulder, I lost approximately 5.5% of my body fat. A loss like this for effectively doing nothing is excellent.”– Robert Camille
“In addition to the extra 1.5 lbs I lost using The Cold Shoulder, my second favorite benefit was that my sleep improved. I wore it for a few minutes before bed every night and slept much more soundly than I had done for months.”– Mike Sirak
“Thanks to The Cold Shoulder I was able to eat 6000 more calories over two weeks while having friends and family visit without any weight gain. It is great to be able to indulge a bit without losing precious progress.”– Kyle Timblin
“I lost 5 lbs and an inch off my torso in just 3 weeks using The Cold Shoulder. I wore it only once or twice a day, and it was cool and comfortable.” - Jocelyn Hayes
“I lost 15 lbs. in 3 weeks.  I lost much of my stomach flab and it was easy to use!” - Anthony Peters
THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Please take a look at the rewards - we hope you'll take advantage of our special early bird offer, but any contribution big or small helps lots! We'd also be so grateful if you would help us share this campaign via email, FB, and twitter!
Please help us by sharing our campaign to your wall!
Please follow us on Twitter and help by tweeting about the campaign!
Credits: Music: Stephen Froeber. Heatflow artwork: Giles Atkinson.

In terms of producing the vest, we think the risk is very low. We've already completed the hardest part of getting this vest to you! We already designed, tested, and found a manufacturer, with whom we have a great relationship, and they have already helped us make small batch runs of our prototype. Quality is our number one priority. We will personally supervise the manufacturing process to ensure the highest quality. 

We’ve had firsthand experience of our manufacturer producing quality goods at a reasonable price and in a timely manner. The only potential challenge we see, is if the quantities are higher than we expect, there is always a chance of errors that could cause a delay. Rest assured that we will be there to watch out for this and will ensure that the end product meets your and our standards.

We’ll keep you posted every step of the way, and we will not let you down. What we need most now is your support, so thank you for giving us the opportunity to offer you the world’s first fashionable, apparel-based calorie-burning aid, a product like no other in the world!

campaign.story:
Go from THICK to THIN!
Big Skinny Wallets empty & folded are less than 5mm thick! Big Skinny is known as the world's thinnest wallets that feel great in your pocket AND hold everything you need [unlike other weird, uncomfortable wallets that force you to only carry a couple cards!]. We have now created a few models with RFID protection while still keeping our wallets ultra-thin. You can still reduce your wallet size by 50+% and Conquer the George Costanza wallet once and for all. Our wallets are deceptive because they look like regular wallets yet feature extraordinary performance. Adding new RFID blocking technology is expensive due to the price of the roll of the special material we developed; we're asking for your help to fund the first few rolls of RFID material plus wallet production.  Depending on the scale of your funding support, we can scale and speed up production of the RFID wallet models to ensure you get your contribution reward asap!
MATERIALS & SMART DESIGN PLUS RFID PROTECTION
 Only the best ultra-thin materials used....we have tested our nylon microfiber and our top-grain cowhide for years. Time has proven both materials to be sturdy and long-lasting. Our workhorse, our good-looking nylon is even tough enough to machine wash regularly! Our RFID material is thin and flexible so it fits into our wallets perfectly without even being noticeable. Building a Faraday cage to help control RFID signals now doesn't require your suffering with an uncomfortable hard or metal wallet or a less than functional weird wallet.               
 There are only two ways to slim a wallet without taking your stuff out or losing functionality by going to a weird wallet design. The 1st way is to thin the material so when you add cards and cash, the material separating the cards and cash makes a huge difference in a game of micrometers! The 2nd way is to design wallets that break your thick plastic card stacks up just like cutting a deck of playing cards. So we did both and you now have multiple wallet design options as rewards for your contributions as well as RFID protection. 
HERE'S WHAT WE'RE OFFERING FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS + EARLY BIRD ADOPTER SPECIAL:
Lots of newly developed RFID wallet models to match your needs at a significant savings from their final future retail price! Most for now are available in the popular black color a la Henry Ford's famous line. As an added bonus for early adopters, the first 75 or fewer domestic contributors for each wallet model by Dec. 17th will get their wallets specially made and shipped before Christmas. Orders outside the continental USA might be also able to ship by that date but timely delivery is highly unlikely for the Holidays.  AND YES, we trust you and thank you for being one of the earliest backers, and we trust we'll make the funding goal so we will ship your wallet before the kickstarter funds are dispersed to us.
RFID lined Black Leather Bifold:  Classic style.  Full-sized billfold area and card pockets are lined with non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out.  4 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each. Capacity: about 20-25 plastic cards plus cash. Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. 4½" wide x 3⅜" tall (11.4 cm x 8.5 cm)
RFID lined Black Nylon Bifold:  This machine-washable nylon bifold is one versatile, sporty wallet.  Full-sized billfold area and card pockets are lined with non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out.  4 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each.  Capacity: about 20-25 plastic cards plus cash. 4½" wide x 3⅜" tall (11.4 cm x 8.5 cm)
 RFID lined Black Leather Trifold: Trifold lovers rejoice!  Full-sized billfold area [which accommodates international currency] and card pockets are lined with non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out.  4 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each.  Total capacity: about 20+ plastic cards plus cash.  Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. 3" wide x 4⅛" tall (7.7 cm x 10.5 cm)
RFID lined Black Nylon Trifold: This machine-washable Trifold folds up compactly, making it a terrific front pocket wallet.  Full-sized billfold area [which accommodates international currency] and card pockets are lined with non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out.  4 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each.  Capacity: about 20+ plastic cards plus cash. 3" wide x 4⅛" tall (7.7 cm x 10.5 cm)
RFID lined Black Leather Curve: Designed with the already existing cut of your front pocket in mind, the Curve eliminates 50% of the corners on traditional wallets, letting it rest comfortably in your front or even back pants pocket.  Full-sized billfold area and card pockets have a non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out.  3 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each.  Capacity: about 20+ plastic cards plus cash.  Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. 4⅝" wide x 3⅛" tall (11.8 cm x 8 cm)
 RFID lined Black Nylon Curve: Designed with the already existing cut of your front pocket in mind, the Curve eliminates 50% of the corners on traditional wallets, letting it rest comfortably in your front or even back pants pocket. Full-sized billfold area and card pockets have a non-slip interior to prevent cards/cash from falling out. 3 extra-wide pockets, 2 over-sized pockets and 1 ID pocket hold about 4 plastic cards each. Capacity: about 20+ plastic cards plus cash. Machine-washable and water-resistant, this wallet is made from ultra-thin, lightweight nylon microfiber. 4⅝" wide x 3⅛" tall (11.8 cm x 8 cm)
RFID lined Black Leather World w/zippered Pocket: International fans and those traveling abroad will rejoice in our ultra thin World wallet, designed to accommodate all different types of international banknotes.  6 extra-wide credit card pockets and one clear window ID pocket hold 3+ cards each.  Two oversized pockets hold 4+ cards each.  Zippered pocket on reverse is perfect for large, bulky coins or small valuables. All pockets and billfold are lined with a non-slip interior to help prevent your goods from succumbing to gravity.   Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. 4¼" wide x 4" tall (10.8 cm x 10 cm)
 RFID lined Black Leather World Bifold: International fans and those traveling abroad will rejoice in our ultra thin World wallet, designed to accommodate all different types of international banknotes. 6 extra-wide credit card pockets and one clear window ID pocket hold 3+ cards each. Two oversized pockets hold 4+ cards each. This version is zipper-free, for those who want the taller bifold but don't need an exterior pocket. All pockets and billfold are lined with a non-slip interior to help prevent your goods from succumbing to gravity. Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. 4¼" wide x 4" tall (10.8 cm x 10 cm)
RFID lined Black Leather Super Skinny: Clever design keeps this model flat, even when you add over three dozen plastic cards and cash!  The Super Skinny has four strategically placed pockets which line up side-by-side when closed - crafted to "split your deck" into two stacks, creating a flat plane which bends when you sit down.  Each pocket holds about 8 plastic cards, and a secret hidden pocket behind the ID pocket allows for an extra card or cash-stash. Total card capacity: about 35+. Stretchy end pocket adds extra security for those cards.  All other pockets and billfold are lined with a non-slip interior to help prevent cards and cash from sliding out. Part of our hybrid series: top-grain cowhide on the exterior, ultra-thin nylon on the interior. Yes, this wallet is designed to conquer the George Costanza type wallets (from the famous Seinfeld episode!). 5⅛" wide x 3⅝" tall (13.2 cm x 9.3 cm)
RFID lined Black Nylon Travel Wallet:  Travel with confidence knowing that your cards and passport[s] are secure in our Travel Wallet. 5 over-sized pockets and 2 ID pockets hold about 4 plastic cards each.  Passport section holds 2 passports for you and your alias. Large zippered pocket on reverse accommodates chunky international coins.  Generous billfold is divided into two sections; a very deep pocket for extra security and a more shallow pocket for easier access.  Machine-washable nylon microfiber. 4½" wide x 5½" tall (11.5 cm x 14 cm)
RFID lined Black Nylon Card Holder: Minimalist?  No need for a full wallet?  This smart little card holder has two ID pockets which hold about 4 cards each, one deep gussetted pocket which scales and holds about 20 plastic cards and one bonus pocket which hold about 3 cards. Crafted from our signature machine-washable nylon microfiber.  4" wide x 2¾" tall (10.2 cm x 6.8 cm)
RFID lined Graphite Nylon Taxicat:  This design has all the benefits of the Curve wallet [comfortable shape fits nicely in the way your front pocket is already cut or even back pants pocket] with the bonus of a magnetic snap closure and a zippered coin compartment on the reverse.  4 extra-wide pockets, 2 oversized hidden pockets, and 1 ID pocket hold about 20+ plastic cards comfortably. A great wallet for a small bag or when you don't want to take a handbag - fits into your jacket nicely. 4⅝" wide x 3⅛" tall (11.8 cm x 8 cm)
 RFID lined Cobble Nylon Slimvelope:  Our sleek clutch-like billfold wallet holds over 30 plastic cards in 8 extra-wide pockets and 2 ID pockets.  There are 3 long sections for cash, receipts, etc.  Pockets and billfold are lined with a non-slip interior to prevent your goods from succumbing to gravity.  Our clever divide-and-conquor design strategy keeps your items organized in a flat plane, instead of stacked on top of each other.  Stays flat no matter what you add to it, even when the large coin section on the reverse is full!  Neat little magnetic snap closure is strong enough to keep your wallet closed even when it's jostled around in your bag.  Crafted from machine-washable nylon microfiber. 7½" wide x 4" tall (19 cm x 10 cm)
 RFID lined Ocean Blue Nylon plus-Sized myPhone Wallet: Keep your phone right there with your cards, cash and coins.  Now it's easy to reach into your bag and pull out everything you need without having to dig around.  Accommodates most mobile phones even the big Samsungs and large Iphone 6s.  Sturdy elasticized pocket keeps phone securely in place with the added security of an elasticized snap tab.  Large zippered pocket on front holds a bounty of coins.  Interior features 6 extra-wide pockets, 2 ID pockets and a large compartment for passport.  Total capacity: about 25 plastic cards plus a generous amount of cash in the extra-deep billfold.  Small, flat, strong magnetic closure keeps it all together. Wallet: 6⅛" wide x 4⅛" tall (15.6 cm x 10.5cm) Cell Phone Pocket: 6⅛" wide x 3¾" tall (15.6cm x 9.5cm)
 HOW DOES BIG SKINNY SOLVE THE TOP 5 WALLET PROBLEMS? [and what are they?]  AND, of course, ADDING RFID BLOCKING!
Big Skinny Solves the Top 5 Wallet Problems!
In-house designing... all models are based on customer feedback, and the collection evolves over time based on reported functionality and requests. Catherine can really sew; she and her mother Linda sewed our World's Largest Wallet that set a new Guinness World Record at 21 feet long and 10 feet high and it was on wheels!
  RFID material
Ultra-thin at .08 mm, it's pretty cool looking with a metallic gold/silvery sheen because of the copper and nickel, and it is building a Faraday cage within your Big Skinny wallet to trap those RFID signals! You'll never see it because it is between our layers of nylon or leather/nylon which are almost as thin! Thin is always In and now you can be thin and safe.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only major risk that we see is that the factory creating the special RFID layer might delay production in order to fit our small order into their schedule because we are only making one special custom roll of material, so we are only a small customer to them. But by the same token, it could work the other way; they could fit us into their schedule between larger customers orders too.

We think we have other production risks under control as we have worked already with our very reliable wallet factory and they are very familiar with our previous designs. Incorporating this extra .08 mm RFID layer should not be difficult judging by the prototypes we have created and are out in the world being tested for the past few months.

The major challenges in this project were creating the right metallic mix and combination of material so that this RFID layer was flexible, ultra-thin, and technologically effective in protecting most RFID frequencies. Balancing thinness and the needed RFID technological efficacy within our functional design aesthetic are the toughest parts of this project. Also, having fun was a must but I think we overcame that challenge in spades.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
2 new RFID Big Skinny Wallet Models available!
Hello everyone on this Martin Luther King Holiday weekend. We couldn't help ourselves, we listened to all your requests and it seems that the robust and internationally reknowned World Wallet was asked about more than any other model so far! So we decided to go RFID on it so both leather versions are now available as Rewards.  $40 for the Black Leather RFID World Wallet and $45 for the Black Leather World Wallet with zippered coin pocket. campaign.story:
New Andromium User Interface combines Mac OSX simplicity and Windows 7 familiarity
Latest Update: 
Please come to our website at www.andromiumos.com to signup for our newsletter and to access the supporters/users forum, to follow our progress post Kickstarter Campaign. Despite not making our funding goal, we are continuing the development of the Andromium Platform, and is launching a free public beta at the end of January.
=========================================================
Today’s smartphones have power.
A lot of power. 
The Snapdragon CPU inside many of your devices is faster than the number one supercomputer in the world in 1996! And it could be just sitting idly in your pocket right now, as you browse Kickstarter on a clunky desktop computer.
However, while smartphones have become incredibly powerful, they still lack the functionality of a desktop.
… That’s why we built Andromium.
Our mission is to democratize the desktop: making it affordable and highly accessible. 
Andromium seamlessly turns your Android device into a desktop computer. It’s affordable, and devilishly easy to use; simply install the app, and plug your phone into the dock.
Andromium dock charging the smarthphone
Hardware: 
The Andromium dock embodies sleek, clean design. It’s a combination of the best aesthetics: beautiful, ergonomic, and pleasing to use. We built the Andromium dock with you in mind. We included three full-sized USB ports for all the accessories you would need on a desktop computer, including gaming devices. We’ve also integrated a port for a power cord, so your phone is always charged. 
We specifically designed the dock with portability in mind. We’ve given it a light, durable, travel friendly design with a flip cover to protect it during transport. On top of this, the dock has been designed so to fit your device without having to remove its slim, protective case.
And Andromium comes in any color. So long as it’s white. 
(We’re incorporating new colors as stretch goals!)
Wireless Keyboard and Bluetooth Mouse
Software:
Much of Andromium’s appeal is its software. Gordon – previously a Senior Engineer at Google – left the company to pursue his dream of making handheld desktops a reality. He built an incredibly sophisticated Android application and complete Operating System, that has turned this dream a reality. The Andromium OS works in synergy with the dock to turn your phone into a full-fledged desktop computer.  
The application integrates seamlessly with your phone, and can be entered and exited simply. While in desktop mode, your phone can still receive calls, text messages and push notifications - so you keep its complete original functionality.
The User Interface is receiving a completely updated redesign to make it even friendlier. We’ve built out all the functionality, and we’re ecstatic with how it works. We’ve teamed up with some of the best User Interface and User Experience designers in the industry to take Andromium’s aesthetics up to the quality of its performance. Adopting the best elements of Windows 7 and OSX UI paradigms, we’re creating a sleek, intuitive experience that highlights Andromium’s functionality and power.
Game Time!
Why Andromium is perfect for you:
In our modern world, many people own multiple computers. It’s not uncommon for someone to have a work laptop, a home desktop, a home entertainment system, and a smartphone. Up until now, this may have been necessary. However, with the power of Andromium, everything changes. 
You can now watch movies, edit spreadsheets, create PowerPoints, and do your work, all from your phone! And, you can do all of this without sacrificing the efficiency and usability of a full screen desktop interface, or wasting money on buying extra computing hardware. As the power of smartphones evolve, the home is evolving with it.
“With the power of Andromium, everything changes”.'
Andromium enables TRUE multitasking with a desktop browser
What you can do on Andromium:
Andromium turns your smartphone into a personal desktop computer. No catch. Play your favorite games with friends – Super Smash Bros, GTA, or Legend of Zelda. We can’t promise Andromium will get you past the water temple in OOT, but it will certainly allow you to try. 
Make your work entirely mobile. Any time, anywhere there’s a TV/Monitor and your smartphone, you have your entire desktop, OS, and files there with you. Create, edit, or collaborate using all of the programs of the Office suite. Andromium is optimized to allow you to use powerful and sophisticated programs without a worry, and without the limitations of a five inch screen. 
Andromium desktop UI
Devices compatible with Andromium:
Andromium is designed for the most popular series in Android phones, the Samsung Galaxy. It works with both the Galaxy S and Note series (S3 - 2GB RAM version, S4, Note2, Note3, Note4). Currently S5 does not fit in the dock due to the USB port cover, but rest assured - we are supporting S5 also, via Chromecast.
Update (12/20/2014): To our backers, we heard you! We are expending our supported devices list: HTC One M8, LG N5/G3, Motorola Nexus 6, and One Plus One will be supported via Chromecast (see http://andromiumos.blogspot.com/2014/12/andromium-os-chromecast-nexus-6-support.html for more information on Chromecast support). We are also in the process of designing a new docking station for LG N4, HTC One M7 phones that can also be used for the devices listed above. (We are designing a new docking station because Samsung HTC/LG/Moto devices all uses different and incompatible USB video-out connectors, so 2 new dock design is required). Andromium OS will be Chromecast ready for our Late Jan 2015 Andromium OS Playstore release. We are targeting summer 2015 (July timeframe) to ship out the new docking stations for the LG and HTC devices, for user who want to use docking station instead of Chromecast.
Andromium Lockscreen
Project Inspiration
In part, Andromium is built on the legacy of Motorola’s ‘Webtop’, and Ubuntu Edge. However, these projects were heavily governed by brand exclusivity, and non-modular software; meaning they would likely only ever be compatible with the specific device they were built for. Unlike these projects, our dream at Andromium is to develop this hybrid platform and make it ubiquitous, bringing it to as many models of Android smartphones as possible. We want to provide the option of a portable desktop from your smartphone, while still allowing users to choose their favorite phone. We want to break down the asymmetries between technological access in the developing and developed world, and the best place to start is maximizing compatibility.
Future Goals
Internet is the great equalizer of the modern world. 
Our driving motivation and key medium term goal is to bring Andromium to developing nations where it can have the largest impact. This year, an estimated 224 million smartphones were sold in India alone. 92% of those sales were made to people who had never owned any computing devices before. Due to their relatively low cost, broad distribution and multi-purpose functionality, smartphones have proliferated throughout the developing world at rates much faster than traditional computers. 
Most families in these nations share a single entry level smartphone for their internet access. Their children are at an educational disadvantage. We want to empower those families to access a higher grade of technological opportunity at marginal costs. By making it possible for families to hook up their device to existing TVs, Andromium unlocks the full power of the Internet, computers and the opportunities these provide.
We hope we can extend this equality to families, providing them with access to powerful platforms to work, learn and play; natural extensions of desktop computing that the developed world takes for granted. We want to empower the billions of people who will own entry-level smartphones to access a higher grade of technological access at marginal costs. 
The power of Smartphone
The Team
Gordon Zheng
Gordon has over 12 years of software development experience. With a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science and an MBA from Georgetown University, Gordon has the technical and business acumen to make Andromium a success. Before leaving to start Andromium, he was a Senior Engineer at Google, developing their global payment security and monitoring system. This is on top of being part of their Tier 3 Crisis Support team, where he helped handle emergency payment errors, and even combat malicious fraud. Unlocking the power of the smartphone is Gordon’s passion. As the Head Developer of the Andromium project, he has realized the potential of the hardware we take for granted. Drawing on his years of experience at the top of his field, he has created a powerful OS application, and is excited to release his work to the world.
Alejandro Zuccolillo
Meet Alejandro Zuccolillo, our Director of Communication and Design. Graduating Cum Laude in Business Administration from Lynn University, Boca Raton, and with an extensive personal background in angel investment and entrepreneurship, he brings a wealth of clinical expertise and passion to Andromium. He has spent years doing philanthropic work with public schools in the Favelas of Paraguay, his home country, where he helped improve school infrastructure and taught English to students. These experiences cemented his belief in the capacity for Andromium to upskill and empower youth education and employment opportunities in developing nations. He believes Andromium could democratize the desktop, enfranchising his students – and many more - into the global economy.
Lydia Sugarman
Lydia is our Director of Marketing, and is bringing Andromium to the world. She founded her own marketing company, PrivateLabel Interactive, at the beginning of 2001. The mission has been to empower organisations, for profit and non-profit with smart online marketing to build engaged communities. She has managed sales and marketing and business development for entrepreneurial ventures in diverse business verticals, both in the US and internationally that provides broad-based insights.  Silicon Valley’s start-up environment shaped her unique marketing perspective and we are ecstatic to have someone with her experience on our team, ensuring the power of Andromium reaches as many people as possible.
Project Update:
As requested by few supports, we have included a video to provide a more details look of the Andromium Platform as well as OS walkthrough
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In terms of hardware, the Andromium device is already built and completely functional. We are counting on your support to enable production on a larger scale. 

Our software and UI are presently ready for Andromium users. We need your financial support to continue developing new apps and functionalities on the OS, to ensure that you have a complete suite of entertainment and productivity software. Once we’ve launched, we look forward to working with more developers as they create applications for the platform. We’ve created this powerful OS and we’re really excited to see what people can build on it. 

We’ve worked hard, and we’ve been cautious to not release this project for funding prematurely. Our meticulous attention to the technical aspects of this project, extensive testing, and knowledge of the entrepreneurial process have allowed us to minimize risks and prepare for inevitable challenges. 

We hope you’ll share in our excitement, our mission, and support Andromium in any way you feel appropriate.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
