campaign.story:
99% of ordinary sunglasses are next to worthless
Here is the harsh truth.  Despite all the marketing hype, 99% of ordinary sunglasses – regardless of price – are nothing more than colored lenses in frames.  Those frames can be fancy – or sexy – or branded with some famous name – or they might be very ordinary frames from WallyWorld or CheapCo.  But when it comes to the lenses, they are basically all the same.  Generally speaking, there is no performance difference that matters in any meaningful way.  However, now you will have the chance to own sunglasses with a proven, unique and patent-powered performance difference that can actually be experienced.    
Introducing ORION4Sight "Sunglasses on Steroids."
Our ORION4Sight sunglasses are a spin-off version of patented ORION Optical Eyewear Filters used by the U.S. Military and are specifically formulated to provide an enhanced vision experience that has been independently evaluated – and which easily surpass polarized lenses or anything else available anywhere.    
What is the PROOF that ORION4Sight Sunglasses are so special?
The proof that ORION4Sight sunglasses are something different, unique and special is firmly anchored in their American military heritage.    
Our Company has been successfully selling products using our patented ORION Vision Technologies to elite U.S. Special Operations Commands for almost two decades.  We have 4 patents issued and are “Registered” to sell ORION Technologies to the U.S. Government.
Navy Seals and other Special Force Operators regularly use our ORION Optical Filter Eyewear.  If you knew the details about the missions on which our eyewear has accompanied them, your hair would literally stand on end!  We have stacks of personal testimonials.  Here is just one example.
“The main thing I was doing was small boat operations in the bay during bright and sunny weather.  The ORIONs worked great!  Even in direct sunlight, I never had to squint and thus never got a headache.  This is an awesome advantage in my line of work.” (Navy Seal Name With-Held To Protect Confidentiality)
And here is another testimonial from a former Marine with personal experience using the ORION technology:
Finally, we have a testimonial from John Hanson, an experienced sailor who publishes a well-regarded nautically-oriented magazine.
Who can BENEFIT from using ORION4Sight Sunglasses?   
Almost everyone who goes outside in bright sunlight wears sunglasses.  So ORION4Sight Sunglasses are for EVERYONE.  They are specifically designed for people who engage in outdoor leisure activities and sports – and would like to experience a higher level of enjoyment and performance.  Here is just a partial list of sports and activities where ORION4Sight can improve that enjoyment and performance – driving, cycling, hiking, fishing, sailing, flying, boating, tennis, golf and all forms of sport-shooting.  The potential list is really endless and limited only by your imagination.    
Here are the BENEFITS of ORION4Sight Sunglasses
Distinct Image Contrast
Improved Image Crispness
Provides accurate and improved color saturation
Reduces eyestrain
Unisex wrap-around frames which block unfiltered light from reaching the eye
Powered by patents proven to improve human vision under extreme lighting conditions
These pictures show persons wearing the military version of Orion eyewear.  
ORION Eyewear benefits cannot be replicated with traditional dark lenses.  The bottom line BENEFIT is that ANYONE who wears ORION4Sight “Sunglasses On Steroids” will experience enhanced vision designed to increase their performance and enjoyment of outdoor activities and sports.  We are confident that ORION4Sight Eyewear will outperform any traditional sunglasses.
HOW Does It Work?
Well that’s sort of a secret, isn’t it?  That is why we have important patents in place.  We are not unlike the famous Coca-Cola Formula.   Many have tried to “crack our code”, but none have succeeded – and we’re not talking!
WHY Does It Work?
The diagram below tells that story.
 WHY are we asking for your support?
We are honoring requests from our American Soldiers NOT to provide the Military ORION Technology to foreign countries and/or consumer markets. However, we have made certain changes to the core ORION Technology which makes the new ORION4Sight sunglasses vision technology available to you.  We will also have legal expenses as we acquire a necessary new patent. This all costs money – and we need to keep some capital reserves available for an important new Project we are working on for our military.
Rather than borrow money, we have initiated this Crowdfunding Campaign on Kickstarter to raise the necessary capital to make the ORION4Sight project possible right now.    
WHY should you support our Campaign?
We have something uniquely special, different, and better – and we know it.  And our American Soldiers know it.  Because of our decades-long commitment to their welfare and the new upcoming Project we mentioned above, we could put our ORION4Sight project on the back-burner – and delay this Goal.  But no one will benefit from that.  You can play an instrumental role in bringing these ground-breaking “Sunglasses On Steroids” to the consumer marketplace NOW by supporting our Campaign.
What do you receive for supporting our Kickstarter Campaign?
As the “reward” for your support, you can effectively acquire a single or multiple pairs of ORION4Sight sunglasses for a price that will NEVER BE LOWER or repeated again ANYWHERE.  When these sunglasses become commercially available, their price will be significantly higher – as is appropriate for a product with such a proven performance difference.
And you will be among the first to own these extraordinary, “Best In Class” sunglasses.  People will say to you, “Those look interesting.  Let me try them.”  And when they do, they will ask, “WHERE did you get those?!  I want a pair!”  (Be careful about lending them out.  You may have trouble getting them back!  We’ve learned this the hard way.)
If you choose a pair of the ORION4Sight sunglasses as your reward, you will receive the sunglasses themselves, a protective case to keep them safe, a brief Instruction booklet telling you how best to use and enjoy your Orions, and a box to keep everything in.
The result of your support is – you will own The Best Darn Sunglasses Ever – and you will have played an important role in helping to make that possible for yourself and others.  This is WIN - WIN for everyone    
A WORD to those who wear prescription eyewear. 
We do not offer prescription lenses, fit-overs, or clip-ons at this time. It is not possible to address this issue within the parameters of this Kickstarter Campaign. We will be working on this in the future. However meanwhile, consider that you may have family and friends who can benefit from our sunglasses - and enjoy them.
A SPECIAL NOTE to our supporters in the community of Amazon Sellers.
At the end of our Campaign, we will prepare a detailed Report on our Kickstarter Campaign.  It will cover all the relevant details and lessons-learned from our Campaign.  This will be made available to any Amazon Seller who would like to have a Copy.    
You can help to insure the success of our Campaign and thus insure delivery of YOUR ORION4Sight sunglasses.   
Like you, your family and friends wear sunglasses when they go outside. You might want to think of getting an extra pair or two as gifts for someone special.  But either way, you can help insure the success of the Campaign by telling others about it – and that success will insure delivery of your own ORION4Sight sunglasses.  Pass this web “link” on to others.  Just like you, they can benefit from owning the best sunglasses they will ever wear.  Tweet (#SunglassesOnSteroids), text, phone, post on Facebook and other Social Media you use, email – and basically communicate this to others in whatever way works best for you.  Help knowledge of these “Sunglasses On Steroids and this great offer to go “VIRAL” in all the communities to which you belong.
We also encourage you to follow our Kickstarter Campaign by going to our Facebook Page:  www.facebook.com/orion4sight.  By clicking the “like” button there, and interacting with the Page, you can further help to “spread the word”.    
The choice is yours. 
You can continue to use ordinary sunglasses that have NO performance difference.  And you could choose to over-pay for nothing more than “colored lenses in fancy frames”.  OR you can play an instrumental role in bringing these revolutionary sunglasses to the marketplace – and experience documented vision enhancement powered by patented technology like Navy Seals use.  When you own a pair of ORION4Sight “Sunglasses On Steroids”, you will see things you never saw before.
Choose your “reward” for supporting us from the choices to the right of the screen and be among the first to experience the benefits of this revolutionary technology.  We Guarantee your satisfaction (see below) so you have nothing to lose and better vision performance and enjoyment to gain.  So reserve your pair of ORION4Sight sunglasses now – and then “spread the word” to help insure that this Campaign succeeds.    
New U.S. Patent-Pending and other legal protective measures.

campaign.story:
********************
Well, I lied. WE MADE IT!
Hooray!
********************
What is BEHS Tech? 
Brookfield East High School Technology Club is an extracurricular initiative to inspire, educate, and support students interested in STEAM (STEM + Art). We provide a wide range of opportunities for students of any skill level to jump-start their STEAM education, or even simply discover if their interests lie in any of the STEAM fields. These opportunities include:
Brainstorming and think tanks
Skill building (metalworking to PCB design) 
Team projects (electric go-kart, autonomous quadcopter) 
Career exploration (through hands-on experience and introductions to employees in STEAM fields) 
Internships
What is this Kick Starter for? (And why should I back it?)
School funding is often limited or unavailable for extracurricular activities. In addition we have seen an explosion in the number of students interested in what we have to offer in the past couple of years especially. Because of this, we have decided to utilize crowd-sourced funding to help support our activities. We need your assistance to support our growing number of students, and each pledge will make us more successful. Spread the word! The more we raise the larger the number of students we can begin to support, and the more skilled and productive they will become.
Our club fills a major gap in technology education. Many summer camps, science fairs, and school activities boast about “getting kids interested in technology and engineering.” However, this is never followed up with real world, engineering education until college or in the workplace. As a result, many students start their college engineering studies without any useful experience. This club is able to bridge the gap by providing the resources and experience for self-directed education.
The funding goal for this project is low by Kickstarter standards. We picked this goal because we wanted to give ourselves the best possible chances of success. $1000 would let us reward our backers and help to budget for the coming year. But by no means is our project goal a cap on the money we could make use of. We hope, that with the support of the community, we can support our club throughout the coming years.
Past Student Achievements 
This club has helped to enable students to turn their dreams into real world projects. Some of these projects are visible in video above. These projects are ongoing and are often tools that aid other students projects. A few examples include: 
Quadcopter 
Electric Go-Kart 
Keypad/Solenoid Door locking system
RC Airplane Drone (work in progress) 
PirateBox WiFi HotSpot
Rockets for Schools Champions (2013) and 2nd Place (2014)
Arduino Rocket Launcher 
Taught 7th Grade Class on Embedded Electronics and Arduino
Budget
Students control most functions of this club. They will decide (with adult guidance) what projects and ideas they wish to pursue. But their decision will likely include: 
Some type of 3D printer (or printer upgrade) 
Further development of our 3D-Robotics Quadcopter 
And may include:
Raspberry Pi’s
Upgraded revision of the electric go-kart 
Build a DIY Laptop (from desktop parts) 
Laser Death Ray Jet Car (can’t go wrong with lasers)
Voting Reward: Every backer gets one vote per dollar they back in deciding a project (from a list assembled from your suggestions).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As you might have noticed, the rewards for this campaign are limited mostly to our appreciation and advertising space on our projects. Education and learning rarely has physical up-front rewards. Keep in mind that with your help, our students have the opportunity to pioneer a new generation of technology.
 As far as risks go, there’s not much to discuss. If you backed high enough to get advertising space (for which we thank you again!), there is the highly unlikely chance that each and every one of our projects spontaneously combusts, meaning we wont have anywhere to put your advertisements. It’s doubtful.
 The real risk that we will be worrying about is that no matter how hard we try, we can never thank our backers enough for their donations!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Unfortunately, it looks like we're not going to reach our goal. In retrospect, there were serious flaws in our campaign plan. Our club is not an all-or-nothing project, and so the Kickstarter paradigm didn't fit our needs from the start. But all is not lost! We just launched a nearly-identical Campaign on IndeGoGo! The key changes: Flexible funding and a lower goal. 
We hope that current backers of this campaign will consider matching their donation. All perks are identical on the new site. In Addition any new backers should definitely back the IndeGoGo Campaign and not this page.

project_data.project_name: BE High School: Engineering and Technology

campaign.story:
Update: Stretch Goals
I've been polling the existing backers for ideas for stretch goals.  The popular requests so far are 1) introduction to 2D (basic) gaming, 2) Videos, Videos, Videos, and 3) Business-style apps that connect to a data source, such as a JSON feed. 
Stretch Goal #1 ($15K)  The most popular request by far has been for videos, so the companion web site will be modeled after my http://www.joyofbootstrap.com site but also include a link for a video.
Stretch Goal
All the code examples in the book will be downloadable, of course, but if we hit this goal you can also click the button  "View Video" for a quick tutorial of the code in action.
Introducing Swift
Swift is an innovative new programming language by Apple for building iOS and OS X applications.  When iOS 8 and OS X Yosemite are released this fall, you can submit apps that use Swift to the App Store and Mac App Store. 
According to Apple, writing code in Swift is interactive and fun, the syntax is concise yet expressive, and apps run lightning-fast.   That sounds pretty good to me!  
So how are you going to learn Swift?  So far, there is only one book available on the topic, and it's published by Apple.   Unfortunately for beginners, it is full of sentences like this one: 
“When a closure’s type is already known, such as the callback for a delegate, you can omit the type of its parameters, its return type, or both.”
Excerpt From: Apple Inc. “The Swift Programming Language.” iBooks. https://itun.es/us/jEUH0.l
That might be perfectly concise for the advanced developer, but I think most of the book is just too advanced for most beginners. 
I'm confident I can write a book that's easier to understand for most people.  
Be Ahead of the Crowd
You want to be ahead of the crowd, not behind it, when Swift is officially released. You want to learn all you can and be ready to leverage Apple's latest and greatest.  Let's get started!
Announcing Swift
 Book, Source Code, Videos
This project will produce a book in Kindle, PDF, ePub, and paperback formats, and an associated website "www.joyofswift.com" (not yet live) featuring instructional videos showing how some of the code works.
This book with be the 4th book in the "Joy" series, which are designed to put some joy in the task of learning to program.   My other published books are "The Joy of PHP" and "The Joy of jQuery".
Top-Rated Author
My book The Joy of PHP has 50 reviews on Amazon as I post this project.  Although the ratings move up and down all the time, it has often been the #1 top-rated book as well as the #1 best seller. I have also written The Joy of jQuery and I'm wrapping up The Joy of Bootstrap.
Rated #1 by readers
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk is, of course, that good writing is hard. Inevitably writing a book takes longer than you think. Also, Swift is a moving target, not yet officially released. I'll do my best to keep you all informed.

I haven't quite finished "The Joy of Bootstrap" yet, but this new announcement from Apple is just too good to sit on. I'll work hard to get Joy of Bootstrap out to my backers then dive into Swift as Apple puts puts out updates to the beta of Swift.

With three books published now I KNOW I can write an awesome book that does Swift justice. I've done it before, and it is something I enjoy. I won't be off watching TV or doing something else when I should be writing because I love to write. I've set a realistic timeline on this project, and I am confident I can deliver. The risks are minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello,
I finally shipped out the last of my Joy of Swift books (print edition) and I'm at it again! Based on suggestions from readers about what to write about next I've launched a new campaign called The Joy of AngularJS.
Angular is is a web framework backed by Google designed for building single-page web applications.

updates.update_userinfo: Final round of print books are here, plus introducing the Joy of Angular
updates.update_content:
Hello,
Last week I was in Europe (Bratislava) and mailed out a number of books bound for backers living across Europe via Slovak Post.   I got back Saturday and the final box of books was waiting.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
I wanted to let you know that if you have a Kindle, you can "buy" Joy of Swift for free from December 26 - 30. Get your copy here http://www.amazon.com/Joy-Swift-program-applications-programmed-ebook/dp/B018ZKTYIK
Alan

Hello backers
Those of you expecting print edition versions of the Joy of Swift should know that the covers have been finalized and I have placed an order for both the B&W and color versions through CreateSpace. 
The books are scheduled to arrive around Jan 10 to my house; unfortunately that's the same day I fly to Europe for a week on business.  I will make every effort to ship them before I leave but I may not get all of them out depending on when they arrive.

campaign.story:
The Creation Station
CNC stands for Computer Numeric Control. A CNC machine is a computer controlled router that can cut shapes out of whatever material is placed in it. The Creation Station is a low cost CNC router kit designed to be high performance and high quality as well as simple to use. 
We've reached our goal!  Thank you!
We've updated our stretch goals because we want to give them to you!
$100,000 - 3-LED Work Area Light:  Mounts on the bottom of the spindle holder and lights up the work area - very useful. *** UNLOCKED ***
$150,000 - 'Soft' Emergency Stop Button: In addition to the 'full' emergency stop button which kills power to the Creation Station, we will provide a "soft emergency stop button" that will stop the machine through software which will preserve the machine's coordinate space and will allow you to easily continue your job without the need to reset the machine. This is useful if you detected a problem and need to stop the machine quickly but it's not a full emergency - huge time saver.
$200,000 - Electronic Touch Off Strip: We will include a precisely machined stainless steel strip and connections to the Creation Station for easily setting the cutter depth.
The High Performance CNC For The Rest of Us!
The Creation Station fits a huge 24" x 24" x 5" work area into a compact design that is at home on any workbench.
Thick 20mm hardened and chromed rails and precision linear bearings for exceptionally high accuracy. Optional 1HP router can cut though the toughest jobs.
High torque stepper motors, advanced motor drivers and ball bearing lead screws mean high speed cutting - up to 80"/min with plenty of torque.
We cut this 1" square from 1/8" thick aluminum to test accuracy.
We developed the Creation Station for makers like you - like us.  We are makers — we developed the Creation Station with all the features and capabilities that we wanted to see in the CNC machine on our workbench.  We made a tool that we love and now we want to share it with you — we know you'll love it too. 
Our goal was simple: create a high performance, high quality CNC machine that the average person could afford.  After over a year of research, development and testing, we did it. The Creation Station is loaded with features usually only found on machines costing thousands of dollars, but costs less than a good laptop. We are sure this will become the most useful tool in your workshop!
We have over 20 years of experience in engineering, development and product testing.  We've studied every part of the Creation Station to ensure durability, reliability and performance while making it one of the most affordable CNC machines on the market.  Hundreds of hours were spent sourcing components and studying samples so we could make the Creation Station the best CNC machine in its class. 
We designed and tested many different combinations of controllers, motors and drive systems until we came up with the best combination for speed, power and accuracy.
What can you do with the Creation Station?
As a full function, 3-axis CNC machine, there are very few limitations to what you can do with the Creation Station.  If the router bit can reach it, the Creation Station can cut whatever shape you can dream up.  The Creation Station can cut foam, wood, plastic, aluminum, brass, stone, ceramic, tile, glass - anything softer than steel!  We made the Creation Station as versatile as possible so that it will be limited only by your imagination.
PLAY

* not actual speed.  This image was cut from a 6" x 12" x 1" piece of oak and took 1.5 hours. Artwork provided by vectorart3d.com.
Some of the things you can create with the Creation Station.
Easy to Build:
The Creation Station comes as a kit, but don't let that put you off.  The Creation Station is easy to assemble and can be put together in a few hours.  Only simple hand tools are needed - the kind that everyone has in their tool drawer.  Each part is labeled and detailed instructions (including video instructions) on how to assemble the Creation Station will be provided.
World Class Software:
Making things on your Creation Station (or any CNC machine) takes three steps: 1) design something to make, 2) convert that design to G-code and 3) run the G-code on your Creation Station.
For the first two steps, we've partnered with world class CNC software maker, Vectric.  Our Maker Bundle includes the versatile Vectric Cut2D software (a $149 value), while our Creator bundle include the powerful Vectric VCarvePro software (a $599 value).  These applications allow you to design your creation (or import designs from other design applications) and specify the cutting tool paths that the Creation Station will use to cut the shape.  Finally, this software will generate the G-code needed to run the Creation Station.
Cut2D Features include:
Automatically converts CAD drawings and Graphic designs to G-Code / CNC Toolpaths. 
Accepts most industry standard 2D vector drawing formats DXF, EPS, AI & PDF file formats. 
Pocket Machining with either raster or offset machining patterns, plus the option to ramp the cutter into the material. 
Profile Machining-running the cutter around the outside, inside or on the selected geometry, with the option to ramp the cutter into the material. 
Automatic cutter diameter compensation for toolpaths ensures parts are cut to the required size. Simply select the shapes and Cut2D compensates for the cutter diameter and shape. 
Interactive Tab / Bridge placement to ensure parts are securely held in place when cutting from sheet material. 
Automatic calculation for Outside and Inside cutting when multiple shapes are selected. 
The option to Ramp the cutter into the job is very important when cutting hard materials because it reduces the load on the bottom of the cutter. 
Drilling with option for Peck drilling cycle. 
3D Colour and 2D wireframe toolpaths Previews shows exactly what the part will look like when machined
VCarve Pro Features include:
Complete set of 2D Design and Layout Tools
Layer control, Guide lines, Snap Grid
True Shape Nesting maximizes material usage minimizing waste
Text Editing + Single Line Engraving Fonts
File Import - DWG, DXF, EPS, AI, PDF
Image File Import - BMP, JPG, TIF, GIF
Vectorize images to create vectors for machining
Robust V-Carving
Raised 3D Prism machining
Auto-Inlays with multiple options
3D Random Texturing Toolpath
2D Profiling with Interactive Tabs / Bridges, Lead and Ramp options
Pocketing with optimization for 2 cutters
Drilling with option for Peck Drilling
Beveled Letters
Custom Molding and Form Cutters
Wrapped Rotary Axis Machining
Multi-color Toolpath Previews
For more information on Vectric products along with a complete set of training videos and sample projects, visit www.vectric.com.
The last step requires "machine controller" software to actually run the G-code and control the Creation Station.  We recommend LinuxCNC on a dedicated computer to act as the "machine controller".  The requirements for LinuxCNC are very low so it's easy to find a computer - very likely for free - from friends, your local MakerSpace or craigslist that will do the job - see www.creationstationcnc.com for details.  LinuxCNC, is free, open source and very easy to install; no unix/linux experience needed! We will include complete instructions on how to install, set up and use LinuxCNC.
Video Examples: In addition to the massive video training library provided by Vectric, we will produce one "sample project" video per week demonstrating how to use the Creation Station throughout this project.  If there's a particular project you'd like to create on the Creation Station, send us a note at info@creationstationcnc.com. Feel free to send us your original design files too, and if we like it, we'll make a how-to video! 
Other software options:  We offer a Creation Station option without software.  This option is perfect for someone on a tight budget, who prefers to use any of a multitude of free, open source software: e.g. Inkscape for making 2D designs and makercam.com for generating G-code from those designs.  Or Blender, which is a powerful 3D design package, and is also free and open source.  There is even a CAM version design specifically for CNC that can generate G-code directly.  As for machine controllers, we love LinuxCNC. There are a limited number of other free options but there are also commercial options such as Mach3.  We will provide a moderated forum at www.creationstationcnc.com for users who have chosen this route to exchange how to's and answer questions.
Our Production Schedule:
All design and sourcing work for the Creation Station is done and a production plan is in place — all we need to do is pull the trigger.  As soon as we hit our goal we will start placing orders for long lead-time parts and order the remaining parts at the end of the campaign to ensure we hit our shipping targets.
What You Get:
You get a complete Creation Station Kit which includes all parts and electronics along with detailed instructions and a video assembly guide.  The kit will take just a few hours to put together.  If you selected the option with a spindle (router), you will also get a Bosch Colt 1HP router and world class Vectric, Inc. software. If you opted to go without a spindle, we will include a spindle holder designed for a rotary tool, which you can then use to cut a holder for whatever spindle you choose. 
Bonus:
With each Creation Station you will receive a 25% off coupon for the purchase of 3D art from vectorart3d.com. 
Vector Art 3D provides relief-style clip-art for computer controlled routing and engraving
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are determined that our project not become another "really late" Kickstarter project and that it ship on time. We have experience in manufacturing several different types of products and have done a lot of planning. While there is always a risk of unexpected delays, we are confident that we can ship on time.

We have contacted several contract manufacturers and suppliers who have assured us that they can get us onto their production schedules and deliver on time. Therefore, in all but the worst case scenarios (fire, natural disaster, vendor failure) we do not foresee anything but minor delays. 

Whatever the situation, we promise to give frequent updates on the status of the project to keep you in the loop. We feel that good 2-way communication is an important part of our project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Sorry for the long delay on this update. I hurt my leg packing a “Box 1” and that has made things a lot more difficult and time consuming. It’s healing up, so I am almost back to full speed.
The latest update is that we will ship up to backer number 192 by the end of this week (yes, that’s you Mel and with no broken parts). That will leave us with 33 units remaining to hit the end of the Kickstarter list. We are very much looking forward to shipping that last unit and having the opportunity to take a moment’s breath. I’m sure a bottle of champaign or three will also be involved as well.
Support, Sharing and the Forum:

We've seen a few more power supply failures than we think we should be seeing. After looking at several possibilities we found that the failed power supplies were set to 220v.  When the power supply is set to 220v it does actually work on 110v and delivers 22-23v (within tolerance) but fails quickly - sometimes in seconds, but most go after days or weeks.  
PLEASE VERIFY THAT YOUR POWER SUPPLY IS SET TO 110v! **

We found a new problem with the controller board (part AC) late last week. While I was packing the cards into individual static proof bags I noticed that the relay (the part that switches the router on and off) had “5VDC” printed on it. This usually indicates the coil voltage for the relay. I designed the board myself and know that the coil voltage should be 12VDC. After looking at the data sheet for the relay, it became clear that the boards do in fact have the 5v version of the relay instead of the 12v version they should have. This is bad because if you run a 5v relay at 12v, it will greatly reduce the life of the relay. If the relay fails during a job, it could damage the work piece, router bit or even the machine.

About two weeks ago we received another batch of Melamine parts from our CM. They ship us about 32 machines worth of parts at a time on two pallets. We still had plenty of stock from previous shipments so we left the parts on the pallets until we where ready for them. When we started running low on parts and started unloading the new parts from the pallets, we found a quality issue with Part A (The machine base front) part. Two of the horizontally drilled holes where drilled way off center due to an improperly set up driller. This would cause problems when assembling the machine and could even damage the machine base top (Part F) as well as part A. I contacted the CM who was very apologetic. Apparently these holes are drilled by a different rig than other holes (because of it's position) which is more temperamental. The CM said that he will cut a new batch of Part A's as soon as possible and express ship them to us.  The parts should be here in less than a week but this CM has a poor track record of getting things to us when promised.  We will be holding their feet to the fire until we get the parts.

This is a quick update to clear up confusion regarding a mistake with the x-axis limit switches.  When the engineer modeled the position of the limit switches, he accidentally used a model that was a mirror image of the actual switch.  As a result, the holes for the switch are mirrored and when mounted using these holes, the switch faces the wrong direction and never come into contact with the X-axis carriage. 
We didn't catch problem this until the first couple of batches of of machines had been cut.  The solution was fairly simple - we decided to drill out a mirrored set of holes before shipping.  We updated the instructions to highlight the correct placement and position of the switch but we missed the pictures which showed the switches mounted in the wrong direction.  Some people where confused by this and mounted the switches as shown in the photos - understandable.  We have since removed the photos and bolded the text that describes the correct placement.  We will post new photos on Monday.

project_data.project_name: The Creation Station Open Source CNC Router

campaign.story:
Introducing...
Console OS Pro - Android Remastered for the Desktop. With InstaSwitch, WindowFlinger, Hundreds of Features & Free Upgrades for Life!
Android on the PC. Android taking on the desktop. Lots of people have talked about it - we’re delivering.
We’ve taken Android apart, and put it back together for your PC. Console OS is a fork of Android designed to take everything that has made mobile awesome and bring it back to your PC.
This isn’t an emulator and this isn’t homebrew. Console OS is real, native Android that can really toggle with Windows on your PC.
How Console OS stacks up to the emulators and other Android PC initiatives
Our Vision
What if you could toggle between native Android, and native Windows?
Android is the most popular operating system in the world today. More new devices are born with Android, than anything else. We're taking the next step, and bringing Android back to the desktop.
That’s what this Kickstarter is raising money to pull off.
Production-grade Android on the Desktop
Team iConsole has worked for the past 18 months to make sure everything from (optional) multi-touch to Miracast™ works great.
We fully support many popular multi-touch displays that can turn the smallest to the largest desktops into giant multi-touch Android devices. And no, you don’t need a multi-touch display for Android to be awesome on your PC - we’ve made the UX both multi-touch and non-touch friendly.
Console OS is painless to install - for end-users and system builders alike.
This is what makes Console OS so great. You can either install it on your PC's internal drive, or run it entirely from a USB external hard disk.
We’re not talking a demo (or "live") version either; all your apps, documents, even encryption can work booting directly from a USB hard disk.
Want to boot Windows alongside Android from your internal drive? No problem - we think that's what most will do, and we fully support that. Our installer takes less than five minutes to pull that off, automagically.
Built for the Mainstream
Every thing in Console OS is built for a mainstream audience. It is designed to provide OEMs (original equipment manufacturers) with a drop-in, native Android solution for their PCs. Console OS will be both Secure Boot and dm-verify - which means trusted computing that OEMs can ship alongside Windows.
For Tablets Too
Tablets today come on x86 and ARM. But, they only run Windows. Or, they only run Android. You shouldn’t have to buy two identical tablets to do one job.
Console OS is the solution. We’ve built a version of Android that we completely control. So, we can drop it in and run Windows and Android side-by-side.
The benefit? Say you have an x86 tablet or device that doubles as a tablet and a laptop. You can rock through the workday with Microsoft Office, then play your favorite Android game all night long. Same hardware, different operating systems, living in harmony.
But we’re doing more, including enabling Android apps to run side-by-side, baking in a familiar app launcher, and swipe motions that are more natural.
For Gamers Too
People don’t think of Android today as a true console-quality gaming experience. But that’s changing. Live at GDC, we showed off how OpenGL ES 3.1 (and eventually the full OpenGL 4 stack) will enable Console OS and Android to become a mainstream gaming platform.
And we do expect Console OS to support OpenGL 4. Why would you need another gaming OS when Android is already the most popular OS in the world.
From the application store process to the user experience, we’ve been working for the past year and a half to remaster Android for the desktop. Now, we need your help to make it a revolution.
Be an early backer and get all the benefits of Console OS Pro - free for life!
Console OS Pro - Taking Android Even Farther
Console OS Pro will add over twenty killer premium features, including InstaSwitch. InstaSwitch will eventually facilitate switching instantaneously between native Windows and native Android, on your x86-based tablet or PC.
Typically $20/year, we’re going to make Console OS Pro free for life for select Kickstarter backers! That’s right, back us now, get free upgrades for life to Console OS Pro.
InstaSwitch will leverage cutting-edge XenGT technology. It's the one feature that we know will be the most challenging, but will eventually deliver instant toggling between native Android and other operating systems. Imagine editing a document in Microsoft Office®, playing Half-Life 3™ in SteamOS™, and reviewing your Gmail™ inside Android... all from the same tablet or gaming rig.
Console OS Pro, more specifically, is set to include the following:
WindowFlinger – A true window manager for Android – run Android apps in windows (Console OS - standard version - will run two apps side-by-side) 
InstaSwitch – Building a new hypervisor to instantly toggle between native Android and native Windows 
Console Remote Access -> Remotely access your Console OS device from any old Android 
Additional codecs and media playback support 
Native DVR support (planned ATSC, DVB, QAM/CableCARD, & DTCP-IP) 
Built-in media serving (UPnP and DLNA) 
Console Files – A new file manager we’re building in to the desktop
Console Maps Pro – Premium Maps with Enhanced Turn-by-Turn
Requirements
Android is built differently from Windows, OS X, and even traditional Linux platforms. So, we have to build Android for one device at a time to make sure it always works awesomely. That’s a huge chunk of the benefit behind Console OS - you get Android built just for your PC.
We support Android for devices based on demand - and when you back the Kickstarter, you’ll help tell us which devices Console OS with Android Inside should land on.
It's important to note that Console OS will work just fine with gazillions of other PCs too - but we're providing official targeted devices, because we want to point customers to PCs and PC Tablets that we are confident that everything will "just work" out of the box.
Out of the gates, we will support (over!) 25 iconic Laptops, PCs, x86 tablets and convertible devices with Console OS. And, here they are:
Acer: Aspire S7
ASUS: Transformer Book T100, T300
CircuitCo: Minnowboard MAX
Dell: XPS 11, XPS 12, XPS 13, and XPS 15, Venue 8 Pro, Venue 11 Pro
Gigabyte: Most BRIX Models, H87-ITX, Z87-ITX
Intel: Next Unit of Computing (all NUC models except for Celeron 847)
Lenovo: Miix 2 8-inch, Miix 2 10-inch, IdeaPad U430p, ThinkPad X1 Carbon, Yoga 2, Yoga 2 Pro
Sager: NP2740
Sony: VAIO Tap 11, VAIO Pro 11 & 13 
System76: Galago UltraPro
Toshiba: Portégé R30 & Z30, Satellite L55, Tecra A50, Z50 & Z40
Most Portable All-in-One Systems
And, of course, all of our own iConsole-branded hardware like the iConsole Developer Kit
Support for additional systems will be steered by OEM backing and by the community.
Want to see your PC up there? Back the Kickstarter – and your vote will count in telling us which PCs to support next.
As to Macintosh, and Surface Pro, see above. We’ll support them if we get enough backing to do so.
Industry-licensed Technology
As a stealth startup, we didn’t get asked by anyone to do this. Console OS is our product, and we're fiercely independent. We relied on Intel’s promise to work with disruptive startups – and they made good on that commitment.
We’re the first startup to successfully license all the key bits that make Android rock on PC hardware, a testament to Intel’s promise to keep startups on a fair, level playing field with the big guys.
We’re featuring support for all the innovative hardware that x86 systems rock on the desktop, even advanced features like Miracast, HDCP, HDMI mirroring, dual-display, 4K with DisplayPort, ARM NDK app compatibility, and native hardware-accelerated H.264 decoding.
Our App Store, Our UX, Our Android™
One of the reasons homebrew versions of Android have failed, is the lack of Google Play. Google doesn’t let you install Google Play on Android without the device being certified. So, over the past year, we’ve lined up all the apps and tools needed to make you not miss Google Play.
We’re going to stay true to the Android code, we’re 100% Android compatible, with strict adherence to the Android API stack - Dalvik, Bionic, and ART, and even RenderScript.
We’re only forking the user experience to make Android awesome on the desktop.
But, we know you probably own a lot of apps on Google Play™. So, we’re going to support the following:
The Console Store - Our upcoming application store for Console OS-enhanced Android apps (un-modified Android apps typically work great - even with a keyboard and mouse!) 
Importing App Purchases (since we’re Android-compatible) – via Console OS Import Apps tool for your phone or tablet. Copies licensed apps to your Console OS PC or PC Tablet.
Amazon Appstore for Android
How’d we pull all this off?
We’ve been working in stealth mode for the past 18 months. We quietly shipped iConsole.tv Unit 00, a developer kit for our upcoming Android gaming console. It’s the fastest Android ever built, and it was already using Intel® Core processors inside.
Unit 00 is out of stock right now, but as we mentioned earlier we'll have more hardware to share later this month!
When we realized people really want to instantly switch between Windows and Android, we started taking what we learned with iConsole.tv, and built it out into Console OS today.
When will it be ready?
We're aiming to ship Console OS Developer Release 1 within about 30 days of the Kickstarter’s conclusion.
From there, we’ll use Kickstarter funds to build out support for the devices that you vote for.
Our goal is to implement all of the features listed here over the next year, but we may ship Console OS 1.0 before that depending on the challenges that we encounter. Our goal is to give the OEMs something to ship in time for compelling new x86 tablets and convertibles this winter to ship in stores.
Okay, I’m sold. What’s in it for me?
In summary, you’re helping us make Android awesome, and fiercely independent on the PC. We’d much rather you keep us honest and focused than alternatives.
On most backer tiers, you’ll get Console OS Pro free for life. And, you’ll vote on what PCs and tablets with x86 processors that we should branch out to next with officially-supported Console OS builds.
The first 10,000 backers can get Console OS Pro for life for only $9.99. After that, $14.99. That’s still less the cost of one release of Console OS Pro for all the PCs in your family.
Thanks for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have most of Developer Release 1 done. It'll include a starter version of our user experience and should work on all 25 devices we listed in the initial supported device list.

The Console OS Pro feature set is largely what funds will go toward (in addition to expanding device support, based largely on Kickstarter backer votes).

We expect Console OS (Pro) 1.0 around December, 2014. We can't promise each and every device/feature/item will make the cut, as with any operating system, some features will get added, and some delayed.

We hope that ecosystem players (here's looking at you, Google) embrace and support our innovation. We don't expect too much push back, but it is a potential risk when doing anything with Android. The beauty of Console OS being so disruptive, is there's potential for all kinds of interesting relationships.

A lot of people ask about Android and Chrome OS™. We think native Android will be totally awesome even if the two were to merge. If something crazy like that were to happen (and Google has said it won't), our feature set may change - but it won't hurt our efforts.

More generally, however, major changes to Android may cause us to have to rewrite portions of our code. We're ready for that.

Finally, as to open-source challenges, we plan to contribute all direct AOSP improvements back to AOSP. How much of that Google will accept or allow us to submit, is up to Google, not us.

Console OS is an operating system - the contents and features of which may change, shift, or move around the cabin during delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy new year everyone, we have an update on our new blog, at our new URL - Console.enterprises
You can read more about the name change, spec bump for ConsoleTab, and more at the blog post.

We apologize for the repeated delays. As we'll explain, it's good news all around though for Console, Inc. - and for our backers!
First, Android on Intel - An Update
We've held a lot of meetings with Intel over the past few weeks. We had the same concerns that many have had lately about the state of Android on Intel.

Hello everyone - consistent with our last community update, we've moved update posts that are not Kickstarter backer-exclusive to our main site.
You can read this new update directly, by clicking this link: Thoughts on Chips.

updates.update_userinfo: Our Commitment to Backers - During & After the Pivot
updates.update_content:
First, thank you to everyone that has tried the soft relaunch of Console OS. We appreciate the feedback, and it’s going into what we consider the hard launch.
Since launching, we’ve revamped nearly every page on our Wiki. Before we get to Console OS itself, we wanted to point that out so you can benefit from the updated documentation. Furthermore, we're going to begin going over our entire web presence and revising - making it easier to obtain Console OS and spread the word.
Extending Lollipop, Assimilating Remix OS

Today we're announcing a new add-on that builds atop Microsoft's announcement earlier this week that command-line Linux app support is coming to Windows.
We're bringing the same suite of tools from the iOS world, starting with Swift apps! The Windows Subsystem for Swift will parallel the Windows Linux subsystem this summer.
Just like their Linux support, our Windows kernel add-on will allow you to run Swift-based iOS apps inside the Windows command line!

Hi all, it's time for an update!
First, in case you haven't been glued to our comment wall, we started posting Console OS Lollipop a couple or so weeks back. You can log in and download it right now, if you're a Kickstarter backer.
It's important to note that Console OS Lollipop, is a complete reboot of the project. Under our new path forward, we are forking the Android-x86 source code, and delivering a free, open-source software alternative to rival closed-source distributions that have followed in our footsteps.

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing the Windows Subsystem for Swift
updates.update_content:
First, Lollipop!
Hi all, if you've been following the Kickstarter comment wall, we've placed Console OS Lollipop builds up for download... for backers. We've already gotten great feedback from a few very-early-adopters. We expect Console OS Lollipop to be made available more broadly in the next week or two.

updates.update_userinfo: Lollipop, The Roadmap, Physical Goods, and What's Next
updates.update_content:
We promised in our last update, that we would announce this week our first major initiative for giving back to the open-source community - rewarding them to work alongside us on our new path forward.
Aside from Google’s Nexus Player, and the Minnowboard MAX, there really aren’t any devices in the x86 arena that are buildable officially. Not really any tablets or phones - what Android is supposed to be about... We're already working on fixing that with our reboot of Console OS, forking the Android-x86 kernel, and re-articulating it to build per-device.

campaign.story:
GeckoTek is the first 3D Printer build plate with a permanent coating that is scientifically developed for 3D printing. We developed the GeckoTek Build Plate to be high performance, versatile, cost-effective, and super simple to use. It’s the perfect product for anyone who is tired of using tape or glue to get their parts to stick to the print bed. 
We have spent over a year developing the GeckoTek Build Plate. With our backgrounds in Polymer Science and Nanotechnology we have been able to develop a coating material that has the perfect level of adhesion to your printed parts while remaining extremely durable. It is available in any size or shape up to 12” x 12” (300mm x 300mm) as well as in a variety of specialized magnetic bases for the most popular 3D printers. 
The GeckoTek Plates shown in the video above are hand made functional prototypes. We need your help so that we can scale up production and reduce the cost. 
How Does It Work? 
Insert the GeckoTek Build plate into your 3D printer. If you don’t have one of our magnetic bases then use binder clips or tape to secure it in place. If you received a magnetic base it will come with its own installation instructions 
If it's your first time using the GeckoTek Build plate, follow your printer’s procedure to level the build plate. It is critical keep your 3d printer bed level and z-axis set correctly at all times. 
Print your part! For PLA there is no need for heating the bed. For ABS, Nylon and HIPS its recommended to heat to 90-100C. 
If the bed is hot, let it cool. Then remove the GeckoTek Plate with the finished part. If needed, the plate can be gently flexed to pop the part off. 
Repeat! GeckoTek has a permanent coating so there is now need to re-apply anything. You won’t need to re level the bed after the first print. You will be good to go for many more prints to come. 
Magnetic Base Combo 
In order to get maximum value from your GeckoTek Plate we recommend getting a Magnetic Base Combo. This provides one GeckoTek Build Plate and a precision machined aluminum base with embedded magnets. 
This provides the simplest, cleanest, and the most reliable option for securing the build plate to the Printer. When removing and attaching binder clips it is easy to apply to much force and knock the print bed out of level. Having a GeckoTek with a magnetic base eliminates this issue. 
We currently have specialized magnetic bases for the following printers: 
RepRaps (any printer that uses a MK1 or MK2 214 x 214mm heated bed) 
Makerbot Replicator 2 and 2X 
PrinterBot simple 
Solidoodle 2nd, 3rd, and 4th Gen 
Ultimaker 1 and 2
MakerBot Replicator 1
Flash Forge Creator and CreatorX
Wanhao Duplicator 4x.
Robo 3D R1
 (If you would like us to offer a magnetic base for your printer let us know!) 
Stretch Goal 1:  $30,000 - Cheap Filament. Unlocked!!
If the Kickstater raises a total of $30,000 -- 200% of our funding goal -- you will have the opportunity to purchase rolls of high quality filament for $15! (1Kg /2.2lb spool) One of our partners, Additive Manufacturing Solutions (AMS) (www.additivems.com) is allowing us to offer rolls at a significant discount to our Kickstarter backers. We do the thermal and physical testing for all AMS products in our lab, so we know it is high quality filament. You will be able to choose between PLA and ABS in a range of colors. (We suggest GeckoTek Green)Once we reach our goal, simply increase your pledge by $15 and you will receive a roll of AMS filament. Limit 450, 1 per backer.  The rolls and color choices will be first come first serve. if we sell out then any extra pledges will be refunded at the end of the kickstarter.  
Shipping
We have tried to include the price of domestic shipping in the pledge amounts. International shipping rates will be determined after the conclusion of the campaign. The actual shipping rates will depend on the quantity of plates sold. We hope that there will be no extra shipping charges but we may need to charge a small amount to cover our expenses. This is an effort to keep the plates as affordable as possible for our Kickstarter backers. 
The Team 
Brad Ruff (Co-Founder and CEO) MS in Mechanical Engineering, Nanotechnology 
Aniket Vyas (Co-Founder and CTO) PhD in Material Science, Surface Coating Technology
Patrick Sledz– (COO) MBA – money manager and entrepreneur 
Mark Evans – (Legal Counsel) JD – Practicing Attorney 
Special Thanks to:
Our Exceptional Team 
Padmanabh Joshi Ph.D. Candidate in Chemistry, University of Cincinnati - Technical guidance.
Erik Evers - Graphics
Ryan Kreps - Video Editing
University of Cincinnati 
Cincinnati start up community 
Studio J Photography - Letting us use the studio and Lighting
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest challenge will be to adjust the processing of our coating process for mass production. The recipe won’t change but automated processes take special care to ensure that quality is maintained on each and every GeckoTek Plate. The processes used are common to the industry and we have extensive manufacturing experience on our team. We don't believe that we will have any trouble scaling our production, but none the less, this will be one of our main areas of focus.

Our next challenge will be to work on our supply chain. Although the materials we require a commercially available, we are already in talks with several experts to aid us in this process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Need Help with the Solidoodle Magnetic Base Designs
updates.update_content:
Im due for an update on the shipping, so here goes. All the Replicator, Duplicator, and Creator Magnetic Bases have shipped now. If you are still waiting on one of those Magnetic Bases send me a message. 
Next up is the Ultimaker 2s. I already have them about 90% done and they should start shipping out this week. I would include a picture but I dropped my phone and it broke the camera lens. After that Ill start on the Rostock Max and Orion Magnetic Bases. Then finish up with the Robo3d and Solidoodles.

Hey Backers, 
The install instructions for the Replicator 2X Magnetic Bases are now available on our website on the Makerbot product page. The product re-uses the original heater pad. I found that to be way easier install than having to cut the the wires and solder in a new heater. Also sourcing the heater would have added additional delays to delivery. 
Also I posted a unedited video of installing the first test unit.

Hey Backer, 
I wanted to give a quick update on the HT Base production and shipping. First off, I am on track to have all the Kickstarter rewards shipped before the end of the year. Rep 2x, Rep1, Flashforge and Duplicator bases are all nearly ready will hopefully all go out this week and early next week. Then its on the the rest. If you have questions about you order send an email to info@geckotek3d.com.

Hi Backers,
We are ready to start shipping the rest of the Magnetic Bases!!
Below is the link to a survey for backers still waiting on HT Magnetic Bases to update your shipping/order info and a link to where you can add items to your order. To reward you for your extraordinary patience we have extended the Kickstarter pricing to you one last time. Add an extra HT or NY Build Plate to your order for only $25! Please read the all details below.

Hey Backers,
I wanted to send a quick update on the shipping. We have about 60 HT and Nylon build plate orders that have been sent out so far! Hopefully this week we can get another 50-75 out the door yet this week. It was a slow start but we are starting to pick up the pace. It looks like we will be ready to start shipping the magnetic bases in 2-3 weeks. 
There is a still quite a few backers in the $25 and $39 pledge levels that have not filled out the shipping survey. Just a reminder that.

Hi Backers,
We are finally ready to reveal the full GeckoTek product line. In order to provide the best performance with both ABS and Nylon print materials, we had to create separate plates that are optimized for each. One build plate that only worked mediocre with ABS and Nylon wouldn't be useful to anyone. 
Now we have 3 different products optimized for each type of printer. The RT Build Plate, formerly known as the PLA build plate, is optimized for Room Temperature printing. The HT Build Plate is optimized for printers with heated beds to be able to print ABS and PLA when heated and provide easy removal when cooled down. The Nylon Build Plate is optimized for the different grades of Nylon.

updates.update_userinfo: HT and Nylon Build Plates are shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
I know many of you have been anxious to know if we were going to be able to keep our last shipping estimate for the ABS build plates. We have been working very hard to do all the testing and validation need to answer that question. There is still a lot of logistics to figure out before we can start shipping but the formula and processing procedures are ready. As it sits right now we are on track to start shipping all the remaining rewards around the end of next week or the week after.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal: $65,000-Reached
For the $65K, we will upgrade our hardware again. Instead of using Spartan 6 LX9 with TQFP144 package we are going to use Spartan 6 LX9 with FBGA256.
What does this mean? It means more GPIOs. We will have around 64 GPIOs without any multiplexing. In addition to that we will have 8 LEDs, 4 Switches and 2 HDMI connectors.
3D model for miniSpartan6+ $65k stretch goal
Please check update#8 
Stretch Goal: $50,000- Reached
We reached our stretch goal of $30k and we will add all the upgrades we mentioned before.
For the $50K, we will upgrade our hardware again based on discussions with our backers.
We will keep 4 LEDs for debugging and add 2 Push-button Switches.
We will add additional an HDMI connector, which means the miniSpartan6+ will have 2 HDMI connectors. By default one of the connectors will be input and the other one will be output. The user can add/remove some resistors to configure any of the two connectors as input or output.
We will increase the number of available GPIOs by giving the user access to the IOs used in different circuits on the board.

Stretch Goal: $30,000 - Reached.
If we reach our stretch goal of $30,000, we will make some upgrades to the hardware, based on feedback from our backers.
A Faster Spartan 6 LX9: We will be able to ensure that we procure a faster version of the Spartan 6 LX9 chip, with speed grade -3. This increases the maximum I/O speed, the PLL speed, and the TMDS I/O. For example, the TMDS I/O will be increased, to throughput up to 1050 Mbps. With speed grade -3, you can potentially capture and output signals faster.
A higher resolution analog to digital converter: We will use a 12-bit analog to digital converter, with 8 channels, instead of the 8-bit one we had in the original design, so you can have higher resolution inputs for better quality.
Support for HDMI input and output: Our current HDMI port was designed to work as an HDMI output only, so we are going to redesign it, adding an EDID chip, so it can work as an HDMI input and output port. Now you will be able to process HDMI input.
Meet the miniSpartan6+ and the Scarab IDE:
When we came up with our board's design, we looked at what was available in other boards on the market and enhanced it.
Our kit is small, much smaller than the closest thing on the market,it's smaller than a credit card at only 1.8 in x 3.0 in. That means you can put it inside some pretty small projects. (Here's something to get you thinking, by 2025 the cost of putting one pound into space is expected to be just $100.)
And our kit is bread board friendly, so you can quickly connect it to a shield or to a bread board.
Now, there’s a handful of other broads with many of these features on the market, but our miniSpartan6+ costs around half of what its closest competitor does.
The miniSpartan6+:
The Spartan6 LX9 FPGA from Xilinx, one of the best FPGAs on the market.
An on-board USB JTAG Programmer to power and program your FPGA with any open source programmer, like the one inside our own Scarab IDE.  
An on board USB interface that powers the board and allows communication with the PC at speeds up to 480Mbps. (That's fast enough to make a logic analyzer. Check our website for updates on projects and tutorials).
An on-board HDMI port. Instead of using VGA output on your projects, now you can go HDMI.
An 8-channel analog to digital converter running at 1 MSPS with 8 bit resolution. So you can start connecting real world sensors to your FPGA kit.
Memory: 32MB of SDRAM, 64Mbit of SPI Flash and a microSD card interface.
A stereo audio output jack using 1-bit sigma-delta DAC to start playing your music.
24 Digital I/O pins.
8 LEDs.
A screenshot of the Scarab IDE.
The Scarab IDE:
We took existing IDEs in the embedded systems community, like the Mojo IDE, and improved on them, coming up with the Scarab IDE, an easy to use GUI that allows you to develop, compile, and download programs to your FPGA (through the on board USB JTAG Programmer) with the click of a button. The Scarab IDE only requires the Xilinix ISE Design Tool to be instlalled on your machine.
It comes with our well documented Verilog/VHDL libraries and .bit files to easily program the FPGA for common tasks. Need the HDMI output? Maybe a logic analyzer? It’s all there.
Of course, your project might be more complicated to build, but you can start with a solid foundation that lets you focus on the heart of the software, not on how the FPGA can talk to your TV.
And you are not locked into our Scarab IDE. You can use the Xilinx ISE Design Tool to program your miniSpartan6+. Also Scarab IDE can be used to program any Xilinx Spartan 6 FPGA, no matter which kit it is a part of.
Why would you want an FPGA?
Because you want speed and flexibility.
You can divide the field of embedded systems into microcontroller based systems or FPGA systems.
Microcontroller kits - like the Arduino - have been more popular for a long time because they are easier to program -- you can write code in a familiar language like C++, and quickly talk to other hardware through whatever ports your board happens to come with. But microcontrollers have some big limitations: they are essentially small specialized computers that can only talk to the outside world in a few ways. They can't multitask, and are slow.
A Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) is like a digital circuit you can re-wire as many times as you like with the click of a button. FPGA's can be used to prototype a great idea for a device, or actually drive an amazing project you want to build. For applications where you want speed and full control over your hardware, you want an FPGA.
With an FPGA, you can program your logic gates into powerful blocks that can do different tasks at the same time. Even the microcontroller at the heart of the Arduino is easily emulated in an FPGA.
Here are a few projects you can make right away with the miniSpartan6+ and the Scarab IDE:
Logic Analyzer.
Multimedia Player.
Game Console Emulator.
Arduino Emulator.
Stereo Vision Camera.
What made us want to create the miniSpartan6+ and the Scarab IDE?
We believe it's time for the hackers community to get an easy to use FPGA kit. So we have put together a powerful, affordable hardware package, and are making available our own open source IDE to make programming a breeze.
We got our ideas from years of using FPGA's for commercial applications, and teaching engineering students about them.
On the hardware side, we wanted to make a powerful low-cost FPGA kit with the latest peripherals to let you build your project right away. The miniSpartan6+ is the third version of the board.
The first prototype, the second prototype, and the miniSpartan6+
And we noticed how many hobbyists are put off by the complexity involved in programming FPGAs, so we took a cue from the microcontroller industry, which has advanced because of open source collaboration on the libraries driving kits like the Arduino.
There are many open source libraries for the FPGA, but they are not organized in a beginner-friendly way. So we came up with the Scarab IDE, which we hope will be the seed for fruitful collaboration between our users.
Our Scarab IDE comes chock full of the libraries you need -- everything from outputting HDMI video, to a complete logic analyzer -- to get your projects up and running with a few clicks.
Of course, we have documented those libraries well so you can hack them, and share what you come up with.
With room to grow, our kit is great for beginners and experts alike.
If you are an expert with FPGAs, the miniSartan6+ is perfect for your complex projects, and comes at an affordable price and in a small form factor.
If you are a beginner, you have everything you need to start a Hello World project. You even have 8 LEDs to play with. Of course, we hope you move on to more complicated projects, and with the miniSpartan6+ you will have plenty of room to grow.
The miniSpartan6+ layout.
A commitment to remaining open source
We are in the business of getting hardware into the hands of folks who can build on it, and make something that can make the world a more interesting place to live.
So everything about our product is open source.  The schematics, the source code, all the libraries for making our projects -- it's all going to available for you to download.
If we reach our stretch goal of $30,000, we will make some upgrades to the hardware, based on feedback from our backers.
A Faster Spartan 6 LX9:
We will be able to ensure that we procure a faster version of the Spartan 6 LX9 chip, with speed grade -3. This increases the maximum I/O speed, the PLL speed, and the TMDS I/O. For example, the TMDS I/O will be increased, to throughput up to 1050 Mbps. With speed grade -3, you can potentially capture and output signals faster.
A higher resolution analog to digital converter:
We will use a 12-bit analog to digital converter, with 8 channels, instead of the 8-bit one we had in the original design, so you can have higher resolution inputs for better quality.
Support for HDMI input and output:
Our current HDMI port was designed to work as an HDMI output only, so we are going to redesign it, adding an EDID chip, so it can work as an HDMI input and output port. Now you will be able to process HDMI input.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making a handful of miniSpartan6+ boards is not difficult, scaling that to hundreds or thousands of boards, as we plan to do, though, is a different story.

Our normal production time is about two months. This includes around 3 weeks for the production of the PCBs, which we plan to have done outside the US. Another 3 weeks are expected to assemble the boards, which we will do in-house, unless we get a high enough volume of orders that we can have them done by someone else. Finally, we expect testing to take another 2 weeks, and this step we plan on doing ourselves, perhaps hiring some help if we have a high volume of boards. In any case, testing will be done under our supervision, because we want to make sure you are getting a quality piece of hardware that functions as promised.

For the reward levels where we are shipping out the boards to you early, we will do all the assembly and testing in-house, within a month.

Some components, especially if ordered in bulk, can have lead times upwards of 6 weeks, so we might need to revise our timeline if we get a very high number of orders. There are also some delays possible from international shipping, but we will plan ahead to try and make sure this does not happen.

And if problems arise with the component purchase, the assembly, shipping -- anything -- we will be sure to update you, our backers, first.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We would like to give you a quick update about where we stand right now.
miniSpartan6+ kits: all the kits are shipped and they should have been received by backers.
Bare boards: They are not shipped yet. We made a mistake in production, and we needed to populate all the bare boards that we had. We are receiving more bare boards tomorrow and we will ship them to our backers.
Shields: Arduino Shield & Camera Shield: we are testing the prototypes now. We should go for production next week WiFi Shield: Some of our backers suggested to use ESP8266 instead of CC3200. We are testing both of them right now and we will see which one we are going to use.

We have shipped all international orders, and have around 150 US orders to be packed left.  Our original estimate of being done with shipping by Monday, Jan 12 is obviously turning out to be hasty.  We will need a few days this week.  Once your board is shipped, you will get an email with tracking information.
Nearly there!

Hi backers,
A few people who have received their miniSpartan6+ have sent us pictures of the board, and even some examples of simple code running on it.  If you have time, we would really appreciate more feedback, like pictures or experience using the board.  If you have twitter, mention us https://twitter.com/scarabhardware and we will retweet you.
We have also received questions from backers looking to buy shields or additional boards.  You can do so by visiting our website:

Scarab IDE:
To start working with miniSpartan6+ you need to install:
1) Xilinx ISE Web edition which is free tool to synthesize the design and generate the .bit file.

Tomorrow we will ship the last group of board to the international backers. By tomorrow all the international backers should receive their tracking number. Please email us if you didn't receive tracking number by tomorrow.
We will continue shipping to our backers in US. We are expecting to finish shipping by next Monday.

We want to get folks the boards around the same time.  So, based on our previous experience in how long it takes for the boards to reach different countries, we have shipped out these countries first: Australia, Greece, Belgium, Germany, France, India, Turkey, Ukraine, Thailand, Hong Kong, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Japan, Taiwan, Russia, Poland, and Singapore.
You will receive an email with your tracking number when your board is sent out.

We have received a number of messages, emails, and comments -- some as late as yesterday -- from backers updating us about their shipping address.
While we have made every effort to track these address updates, we want to be sure we don't miss anyone. 
So, if you have moved since the campaign and want to make sure we have your correct address, send us a message with the words "updated shipping address" in it.  Please send this message within the next 48 hours, because we want to ship things to you ASAP.

Hey backers,
We are still testing the boards.  Testing 900 boards is going slower than we expected. 
But early next week we will ship out the international orders, and later in the week all the other orders. 
Thanks again for everyone's patience!
We received the rest of the boards, around 900 boards, yesterday.  We started the testing. We will start shipping next week.
